original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: skye ba'i phyir sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin no //
translated: The elements are the basis of the substance of sentient beings because sentient beings arise from them.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag bzhir bstan gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir 'byung ba dag bzhir bstan gyi /
translated: The elements are taught to be four because the eye and so on arise in dependence on the primary elements and form and so on arise in dependence on the primary elements.

original: brten pa sems las byung ba rnams dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brten pa sems las byung ba rnams dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the elements are not the basis of the derivative form of the mind and mental factors.

original: gzhan dag ni nying mtshams 'byor par 'brel ba'i tshe mig la sogs pa rnams med pas de dag ma gsungs la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nying mtshams 'byor par 'brel ba'i tshe mig la sogs pa rnams med pas de dag ma gsungs la /
translated: Others say: The elements are not taught to be the basis of sentient beings because the eye and so on do not exist when the embryo is first conceived.

original: de'i tshe lus kyi dbang po yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe lus kyi dbang po yod mod kyi /
translated: But the body faculty exists at that time.

original: des de'i gnas skabs na grang ba la sogs pa yongs su gcod par ni mi nus te /
analyzed: des de'i gnas skabs na grang ba la sogs pa yongs su gcod par ni mi nus te /
translated: But it cannot function to cognize cold and so on at that stage.

original: yod kyang rang gi dgos pa mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis rnam par mi 'jog go snyam du sems so //
analyzed: yod kyang rang gi dgos pa mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis rnam par mi 'jog go snyam du sems so //
translated: If it exists but does not perform its own function, then those who do not possess a need for it do not posit it.

original: de ltar na khams drug po 'di dag sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na khams drug po 'di dag sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin te /
translated: Thus these six elements are the basis of the substance of sentient beings.

original: nying mtshams sbyor sems nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi bar du dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor sems nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi bar du dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is necessary from the linking mind to the mind of death.

original: / gal te ston pa'i dgongs pa de ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: / gal te ston pa'i dgongs pa de ltar yin gyi /
translated: If you understand that this is the intention of the Teacher,

original: 'byung ba tsam zhig bzhed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khod du chud ce na /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam zhig bzhed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khod du chud ce na /
translated: then you should understand that he does not assert mere elements.

original: yang rig pa'i tshogs drug gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang rig pa'i tshogs drug gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the six collections of consciousness are taught.

original: mdo de nyid las mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar reg pa'i skye mched drug gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar reg pa'i skye mched drug gsungs te /
translated: That sutra declares the six bases of contact from the base of eye contact to the base of mental contact.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba tsam ma yin pa'i phyir khams drug gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba tsam ma yin pa'i phyir khams drug gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: Therefore you should understand that the six elements are taught because there are more than just the elements.

original: de ltar ma yin na mig la sogs pa rnams sa'i khams la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na mig la sogs pa rnams sa'i khams la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were not so, then because the eyes and so on would not be different from the elements such as earth,

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug ces yang mi gsung bar yang mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug ces yang mi gsung bar yang mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: the six bases of contact would not be mentioned.

original: / de la mig nyid reg pa'i skye mched yin pa ni mig gi reg pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: / de la mig nyid reg pa'i skye mched yin pa ni mig gi reg pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The eye itself is the sense-sphere of contact, i.e., the sense-sphere of contact of the eye.

original: yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ni sems las byung ba'i chos reg pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ni sems las byung ba'i chos reg pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sense-sphere of contact of the mental faculty is the basis of contact of the mental faculty.

original: sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And also because it would follow that there would be no mental factors.

original: ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci yin zhe na /
translated: What would follow?

original: khams drug tsam yin pa'i phyir @72a * //
analyzed: khams drug tsam yin pa'i phyir @72a * //
translated: Because there would be only six elements.

original: mdo las khams drug gsungs kyi /
analyzed: mdo las khams drug gsungs kyi /
translated: In the s≈´tra, the six elements are mentioned,

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: but not the derivative form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement that the six elements are mentioned in the s≈´tra?

original: sems kyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the six elements are mentioned in the s≈´tra in order to indicate the basis of the substance of the mind.

original: gal te mdo las sa'i khams la sogs pa ltar mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma gsungs pas de rnams med par 'dod na de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma gsungs pas de dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mdo las sa'i khams la sogs pa ltar mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma gsungs pas de rnams med par 'dod na de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma gsungs pas de dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that the eyes, etc. do not exist because they are not mentioned in the sutras, like the earth element, etc., then it follows that mental factors such as feeling do not exist because they are not mentioned in the sutras.

original: ci ste ji ltar 'byung ba dag kho nas 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin gyi sems las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin pas thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar 'byung ba dag kho nas 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin gyi sems las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin pas thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that mental factors are the mind itself, just as the primary elements are the source of the secondary elements, then the consequence is that mental factors are not different from the mind.

original: de'i phyir / sems nyid ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems nyid ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe mind itself is the mental factors.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it contradicts the sutras.üîΩThe sutras state:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the mind?

original: mdo las 'du shes dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo las 'du shes dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, the mind arises with attachment and so on.

original: mdo las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The sutra passage is applied to this.

original: sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes khas blang bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes khas blang bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to accept that mind itself is mental factors.

original: gang gi phyir sems 'dod chags dang bcas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems 'dod chags dang bcas /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind is associated with attachment,

original: sems zhe sdang dang bcas /
analyzed: sems zhe sdang dang bcas /
translated: the mind is associated with aversion,

original: sems gti mug dang bcas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gti mug dang bcas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the mind is associated with delusion.‚Äù

original: gzhan zhig gzhan dang bcas so zhes bya bar ni brjod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gzhan dang bcas so zhes bya bar ni brjod kyi /
translated: It is said that one thing is associated with another,

original: bdag nyid bdag nyid dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag nyid dang ni ma yin te /
translated: but not that something is associated with itself.

original: de'i phyir sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar khas blang bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar khas blang bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable to accept that mind itself is mental factors.

original: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs nye bar bkod pa kho na legs so //üîΩgzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs nye bar bkod pa kho na legs so // gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system is the best.üîΩThe ten physical elements are aggregations.

original: gzugs can bcu kho na bsags pa zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba nyid kyis gzhan brgyad bsags pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs can bcu kho na bsags pa zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba nyid kyis gzhan brgyad bsags pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The ten physical elements alone are aggregations.

original: yang ji ltar na de dag bsags pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de dag bsags pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How then are they not collections?

original: de'i phyir / rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩgcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so // gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause they are aggregations of subtle particles.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //
translated: The four external elements are

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the cutter and the cut.

original: phyi rol smos pa ni nang gi khams bsal bar bya pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol smos pa ni nang gi khams bsal bar bya pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúexternal‚Äù is used to exclude the internal elements.

original: bzhi smos pa ni sgra dang chos kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi smos pa ni sgra dang chos kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúfour‚Äù is used to exclude sound and the element of mental objects.

original: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: An axe, a tree, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni re @72b re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni re @72b re dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is to be construed with each of the terms.

original: dgra sta dang ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgra sta dang ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: An axe and a sword, etc. are the cutter.

original: shing dang lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shing dang lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba'o //
translated: A tree and a body, etc. are the cut.

original: 'dir ni'i sgra ni gnyis char la gnyis ka bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir ni'i sgra ni gnyis char la gnyis ka bstan pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhere‚Äù in the verse refers to both the cutter and the cut.

original: 'dir ni grags pa'i dbang gis tha dad par dper brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni grags pa'i dbang gis tha dad par dper brjod do //
translated: Here, the examples are stated separately by the force of their fame.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù has the sense of restriction.

original: phyi rol gyi kho na'o snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi kho na'o snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is external.üîΩIf all formations that have arisen cease immediately, since they are inactive, what is the dharma called ‚Äúcutting‚Äù?

original: gal te bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa'i 'du byed thams cad la bya ba med pas gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni ci zhe na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir gcad par bya ba dang / gcod par byed pa med na gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa'i 'du byed thams cad la bya ba med pas gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ni ci zhe na zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir gcad par bya ba dang / gcod par byed pa med na gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since they are momentary, if there is nothing that is cut and nothing that cuts, what is the dharma called ‚Äúcutting‚Äù?

original: 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung pa can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel par 'byung pa can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The continuum of the collection, which is a connected occurrence, is the generation of the separation.

original: 'brel pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConnected‚Äù means connected as cause and effect.

original: 'di la rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba yod pas na 'brel par 'byung ba can te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba yod pas na 'brel par 'byung ba can te /
translated: Since there is an occurrence that is uninterrupted, it is a connected occurrence.

original: 'dus pa'i rgyun rgyud chags pa 'brel par 'byung ba can de rnam par 'byed pa'i skyed pas gcod pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyun rgyud chags pa 'brel par 'byung ba can de rnam par 'byed pa'i skyed pas gcod pa zhes bya'i /
translated: The continuum of the collection, which is a connected occurrence, is called ‚Äúcutting‚Äù because it generates the separation.

original: gcad par bya ba'i rgyun las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcad par bya ba'i rgyun las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not something different from the continuum that is to be cut.

original: rdul phra rab gcig la rnam par 'byed pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa dang rnam par bye ba'i dus gnyis kyang rdzas kyi skad cig gcig la mi srid pas 'dus pa'i rgyun la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig la rnam par 'byed pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa dang rnam par bye ba'i dus gnyis kyang rdzas kyi skad cig gcig la mi srid pas 'dus pa'i rgyun la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because the arising of a distinction in a single atom is impossible, and because it is impossible for the two times of connection and distinction to exist in a single moment of substance, he says ‚Äúin the continuum of the collection.‚Äù

original: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The body faculty and so on are not to be cut.

original: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa dag la ni rnam pa de lta bu'i gcod pa de mi rigs te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa dag la ni rnam pa de lta bu'i gcod pa de mi rigs te /
translated: Such cutting is not possible in the body faculty and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yan lag ma lus par bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag ma lus par bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when all the parts are cut, they cannot be made two.

original: ma lus par smos pa ni yan lag 'phro dang bcas par bcad na dbang po la rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus par smos pa ni yan lag 'phro dang bcas par bcad na dbang po la rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is used because when the parts are cut together with their extensions, the faculties are seen to be distinguished.

original: 'di la yang tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that you will not believe this merely on the basis of words,üîΩwe reply:

original: de'i phyir / dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe faculties are not divided into two parts.‚Äù

original: ni'i sgra ni dbang po rnams ni gcod par byed pa'i rkyen gyis rnam pa gnyis su sbyar mi nus pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni dbang po rnams ni gcod par byed pa'i rkyen gyis rnam pa gnyis su sbyar mi nus pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means that the faculties cannot be divided into two parts by the condition of being cut.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: gcad pa'i yan lag la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcad pa'i yan lag la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faculties are not present in the parts that are cut off.

original: de yang yan lag des yul mi 'dzin pa las shes te /
analyzed: de yang yan lag des yul mi 'dzin pa las shes te /
translated: That is understood because those parts do not apprehend objects.

original: 'di ni rab tu grags pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu grags pas ma bshad do //
translated: This is well known, so it is not explained.

original: de lta na gal te sna'i rtse mo bcad pa slar @73a * //
analyzed: de lta na gal te sna'i rtse mo bcad pa slar @73a * //
translated: If the tip of the nose is cut off and then reattached,

original: sbyar bas lus kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar bskyed ce na /
analyzed: sbyar bas lus kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar bskyed ce na /
translated: how does it generate a body consciousness?

original: rgyas pa las 'byung ba'i dbang po skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las 'byung ba'i dbang po skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault, because a faculty that arises from development arises.

original: 'dis ni dud 'gro'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gi mjug ma gcad pa slar skye ba yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dud 'gro'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gi mjug ma gcad pa slar skye ba yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the regrowth of a tail that is cut off in some specific animals.

original: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not cut or weighed.

original: dbang po'i mtshan nyid can rnams ni nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i mtshan nyid can rnams ni nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties are not cut or weighed, because they are clear, like the light of a gem.

original: nor bu'i 'od ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The light of a gem is not cut,

original: nor bu ma lus par bcad na de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nor bu ma lus par bcad na de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because when the gem is completely cut, it is not divided into two.

original: 'di ni nges bar gzung ba las rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni nges bar gzung ba las rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is understood from the statement of the definition of the sense faculties.

original: de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal byed pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bsgre ba smos pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal byed pa'o // zhes bya ba ni bsgre ba smos pa ste /
translated: The same is true of burning and weighing.üîΩThe sense faculties are not burned or weighed, because they are clear, like the light of a gem.

original: de dag nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /üîΩde nyid 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la / de nyid 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The sense faculties are not burned or weighed,üîΩbecause they are clear, like the light of a gem.

original: sreg pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: sreg pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this thing called burning?

original: rgyu'i rgyun las me la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi rgyu can 'bras bu mi 'dra ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyun las me la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi rgyu can 'bras bu mi 'dra ba skye ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of a dissimilar effect from a cause, such as fire, that is a condition of a continuum of cause.

original: dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculties are not burned,

original: dangs pa'i phyir 'od bzhin no ste /
analyzed: dangs pa'i phyir 'od bzhin no ste /
translated: because they are clear, like the light of a gem.

original: dbang po ni bsreg par bya ba dang / 'jal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni bsreg par bya ba dang / 'jal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculties are not burned or weighed,üîΩbecause they are clear, like the light of a gem.

original: dangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is clear.

original: sgra yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not sound,

original: chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is discontinuous.

original: rgyun chags par 'dug pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig rgyun chags su gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyun chags par 'dug pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang lhan cig rgyun chags su gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not continuous with form, etc. because it does not exist in a continuous series,

original: de'i phyir 'di la drug tshan 'di dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la drug tshan 'di dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and therefore it does not have the sixfold character.

original: sreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra // zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is disagreement about burning and weighing.

original: sreg dang gzhal ba ni sreg dang gzhal ba dag ste /
analyzed: sreg dang gzhal ba ni sreg dang gzhal ba dag ste /
translated: Burning and weighing are burning and weighing.

original: sreg pa dang gzhal ba de dag la'o //üîΩci ste zhe na /
analyzed: sreg pa dang gzhal ba de dag la'o // ci ste zhe na /
translated: They are about burning and weighing.

original: mi mthun smra'o //
analyzed: mi mthun smra'o //
translated: What is the disagreement?üîΩThere is disagreement about whether or not they exist.

original: mi mthun par smra ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: mi mthun par smra ba ni rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to disagree,

original: phyogs gnyis ka rigs par mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka rigs par mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because both sides can be seen to be reasonable.

original: / ji ltar zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: / ji ltar zhe na smras pa /
translated: How is that?

original: kha cig na re khams bzhi po de dag nyid sreg par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re khams bzhi po de dag nyid sreg par byed pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the four elements themselves burn,

original: mtha' dag rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mtha' dag rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
translated: because they are the cause of the transformation of the whole.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say that

original: me'i khams kho na sreg par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: me'i khams kho na sreg par byed pa yin te /
translated: The fire element alone burns.

original: gang gi phyir byed pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis mnan nas me'i khams kyis bya ba thob pa'i phyir ma zhes bya ba ma yin pa'i sa la sogs pas mi sreg pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byed pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis mnan nas me'i khams kyis bya ba thob pa'i phyir ma zhes bya ba ma yin pa'i sa la sogs pas mi sreg pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod do //
translated: For, since it is associated with another function, the fire element obtains its activity by overpowering the other primary elements, and it does not burn the earth element, etc., which are not fire.

original: gzhan dag na re phyi rol gyi khams bzhi po 'byung ba me shas che ba kho na sreg par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyi rol gyi khams bzhi po 'byung ba me shas che ba kho na sreg par byed de /
translated: Others say: The four external primary elements, which are a predominance of the fire element, burn.

original: gal te me'i khams kho na sreg par byed na ni lhan cig tu gyur pa'i @73b 'byung ba gsum dang / de dag la brten pa'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang sreg par byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te me'i khams kho na sreg par byed na ni lhan cig tu gyur pa'i @73b 'byung ba gsum dang / de dag la brten pa'i rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang sreg par byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the fire element alone burned, then the three simultaneously existing primary elements and the derivative form that is based on them would also burn.

original: me med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that fire would not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba bzhi thams cad nyid sreg par zhes bya ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba bzhi thams cad nyid sreg par zhes bya ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, all four primary elements are the cause of burning, which is a transformation.

original: me'i khams kho na ni sreg par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me'i khams kho na ni sreg par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The fire element alone does not burn.

original: gzhal bar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhal bar zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term ‚Äúis weighed‚Äù is explained.

original: sas srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sas srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Weight alone is what is weighed, because heaviness is the cause of the downward movement of the scale-pan.

original: yang ba rnams la srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsmra ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas rnams srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu nyid du smra'i /
analyzed: yang ba rnams la srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir ro // smra ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas rnams srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu nyid du smra'i /
translated: Because it is impossible for lightness to be the cause of the downward movement of the scale-pan.

original: yang ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that substances that possess the quality of heaviness are the cause of the downward movement of the scale-pan, but not those that possess the quality of lightness.

original: de lta na yang der lci ba nyid nus pa dang ldan par snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang der lci ba nyid nus pa dang ldan par snang ngo //
translated: Even so, heaviness appears to be the cause of the downward movement of the scale-pan.

original: rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyal las byung ba nang gi lnga //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyal las byung ba nang gi lnga // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five internal elements are derived from maturation and the great elements.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúfive‚Äù is used to clarify the five elements of consciousness.

original: 'di ci zhig tu nges par gzung zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig tu nges par gzung zhe na /
translated: What is definitely meant by this?

original: nang gi lnga ni rnam par smin pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: nang gi lnga ni rnam par smin pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The five internal elements are definitely determined to be only the result of karmic maturation and the result of enhancement.

original: 'dis gang las she na /
analyzed: 'dis gang las she na /
translated: From what are they the result?

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni med de zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni med de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: They are not the result of natural outflow.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because there is no natural outflow that is not included in those.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba'i rgyud las ma gtogs pa skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus skyed pa rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba'i rgyud las ma gtogs pa skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus skyed pa rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of that is that there is no other result of natural outflow that is generated by the homogeneous cause or the omnipresent cause, which are not included in the continuum of the result of karmic maturation and the result of enhancement.

original: med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they do not exist.

original: mig la sogs pa sngar skyes pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa phyis skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa sngar skyes pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa phyis skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu yin la /
translated: Previously arisen eyes and so on are the homogeneous cause of later arisen eyes and so on and of those that are not arisen.

original: rgyu mthun pa yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Natural outflow is the result of the homogeneous cause.

original: de dag gi rgyu mthun pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi don gzhan ma yin no //üîΩji ltar rnam par smin pa las skyes pa las tha dad par rgyas pa las 'byung ba'i yod pa'am ;
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu mthun pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi don gzhan ma yin no // ji ltar rnam par smin pa las skyes pa las tha dad par rgyas pa las 'byung ba'i yod pa'am ;
translated: The homogeneous cause is only derived from karmic maturation and enhancement, it is not a separate object.üîΩJust as the cause of enhancement is separate from the cause of karmic maturation,

original: shi ba la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dag dmigs pa de bzhin du rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las 'byung ba de dag gi rgyu mthun pa ni de dag las tha dad par dmigs pa med de /üîΩde'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mthun @74a * //
analyzed: shi ba la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa dag dmigs pa de bzhin du rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las 'byung ba de dag gi rgyu mthun pa ni de dag las tha dad par dmigs pa med de / de'i phyir rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mthun @74a * //
translated: or just as the homogeneous cause of form and so on that arises from karmic maturation and enhancement is observed to be separate from them, the homogeneous cause of those that arise from karmic maturation and enhancement is not observed to be separate from them.

original: pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no homogeneous cause that is not derived from karmic maturation or enhancement,

original: mig la sogs pa dag rgyu mthun pa las byung ba med par bshad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag rgyu mthun pa las byung ba med par bshad do //
translated: it is explained that the eyes and so on do not arise from the homogeneous cause.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa ni rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin na ji ltar de dag rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa ni rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin na ji ltar de dag rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If the effect of a prior action is not related to another effect, how can it be called arisen from the effect of a prior action?

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: The effect of a prior action is not an effect.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: It is arisen from the cause of an effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta lta bu'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta lta bu'o zhes smos so //
translated: the middle term is elided, as in the expression ‚Äúchariot of the ox.‚Äù

original: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or else, the S≈´tra means to say that the action which has reached the time of its effect.

original: dus gang gi tshe bar med par las las 'bras bu'i skye ba de ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe bar med par las las 'bras bu'i skye ba de ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
translated: The time of the effect is the time when the effect arises from the action without interruption.

original: de'i tshe de'i las rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i las rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the action is called the effect of the action, because it is the effect of the action.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The S≈´tra teaches this:üîΩ‚ÄúThe action that has been accumulated does not mature in the atom or the void, but for the one who accumulates the action and for whom there is the action, the action is accumulated.‚Äù

original: bar med par 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i las las skyes pas na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bar med par 'bras bu skyed par rung ba'i las las skyes pas na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: It is born from karma that is fit to generate a result without interval, therefore it is born from the result of karmic maturation.

original: gal te 'bras bu la mngon du phyogs pa'i las rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu la mngon du phyogs pa'i las rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin ba yin na /
translated: If karma that is directed toward a result is the result of karmic maturation,

original: 'o na 'bras bu ji ltar rnam par smin ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu ji ltar rnam par smin ba yin zhe na /
translated: then how is the result of karmic maturation?

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa khon yin pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa khon yin pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe result is the result of karmic maturation because it is the result of karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: dngos po sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of an entity.

original: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or it is a designation of the result in the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la rnam par smin pa btags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la rnam par smin pa btags pa'o //
translated: Maturation is designated in the cause of maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa skyed par byed pa'i las la rnam par smin pa btags te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa skyed par byed pa'i las la rnam par smin pa btags te /
translated: Maturation is designated in karma that generates maturation.

original: dper na 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like designating the cause in the result, as in the statement, ‚ÄúThese six sense bases that are the result of contact should be known as past karma.‚Äù

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The six sense spheres are not karma, but

original: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: they are the result of previous karma.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu btags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu btags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cause is designated by the name of its result.

original: zas la legs par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gnyid log pa'i khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pas na rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: zas la legs par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gnyid log pa'i khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pas na rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúarisen from enhancement‚Äù because they are enhanced by the enhancement of proper action, meditative concentration, and sleep.

original: rgyas pa las yod pa ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: rgyas pa las yod pa ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste /
translated: They exist due to enhancement, thus they are arisen from enhancement.

original: sde tshan bzhin no //
analyzed: sde tshan bzhin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúenhancement‚Äù is like the term ‚Äúgroup.‚Äù

original: yang na rgyas pa nyid rgyas pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyas pa nyid rgyas pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Or else, enhancement itself is arisen from enhancement,

original: rang gi don la 'phel ba byas par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi don la 'phel ba byas par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: like the term ‚Äúenhancement of one‚Äôs own purpose.‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúenhancement‚Äù is applied to each of the three.

original: de la legs par bya ba ni khrus dang bsku mnye dang / 'bad rtsol dang / bsku byug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la legs par bya ba ni khrus dang bsku mnye dang / 'bad rtsol dang / bsku byug la sogs pa'o //
translated: Proper action is bathing, massage, exercise, anointing, and so on.

original: @74b gzhan dag na re tshangs par spyod pas kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @74b gzhan dag na re tshangs par spyod pas kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say that proper action is also celibacy.

original: zas la sogs pa spyod kyang mi tshangs par spyad pa las 'grib pa dang / gnod par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zas la sogs pa spyod kyang mi tshangs par spyad pa las 'grib pa dang / gnod par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even though they consume food, etc., they do not increase because they see the disadvantages and the harm of sexual misconduct.

original: 'di ltar ba lang dang rta la sogs pa 'og bcad pa rnal ba rnams la rgyas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang dang rta la sogs pa 'og bcad pa rnal ba rnams la rgyas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, one sees that cows, horses, etc., who are castrated do not increase.

original: gal te de lta yin na tshangs par spyod pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na tshangs par spyod pa rnams kyi ci'i phyir rgyas par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, why don‚Äôt the celibate increase?

original: de la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su gdung bas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su gdung bas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are harmed by the torment of lustful thoughts.

original: des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: des ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: That does not harm them,

original: rgyas pa ni zas la sogs pa dag kho nas yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni zas la sogs pa dag kho nas yin no //
translated: but they do not increase because of food, etc.

original: zas la sogs pa dag ni rnam par smin pa la phan 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: zas la sogs pa dag ni rnam par smin pa la phan 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Food, etc., benefit the stream of evolution of the result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la phyi bzhin du kun du srung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyud la phyi bzhin du kun du srung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the stream of evolution of the result is protected by the stream of evolution of the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ni stobs chung ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir ni stobs chung ba yin la /
translated: The continuum of karmic maturation is weak because it is not capable of the action of going, etc.

original: rgyas pa'i rgyud ni stobs chung ba rab dang 'dra ba de gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rgyud ni stobs chung ba rab dang 'dra ba de gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The continuum of enhancement is similar to the weak continuum, but it is stronger because it is the cause of the enhancement of the continuum of karmic maturation.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba med par rnam par smin pa las skyes pa mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba med par rnam par smin pa las skyes pa mod kyi /
translated: The continuum of karmic maturation does not arise from the continuum of enhancement,

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med par rgyas pa las byung ba ni yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med par rgyas pa las byung ba ni yod par 'gyur te /
translated: but the continuum of enhancement does arise from the continuum of karmic maturation.

original: dper na lha'i mig bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lha'i mig bzhin no //
translated: For example, the divine eye.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba kho na bkag par sgra ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa la yod do zhes bya bar khong du chud de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba kho na bkag par sgra ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa la yod do zhes bya bar khong du chud de /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúThe continuum of karmic maturation is not enhancement‚Äù should be understood to mean that enhancement and natural outflow exist in the continuum of karmic maturation.

original: mgul pa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las byung ba dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mgul pa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las byung ba dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Sound that is not different from the great elements of enhancement that exist in the throat, etc., is enhancement.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'byung ba dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa na rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i 'byung ba dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa na rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It is derived from the cause of natural outcome, because it exists in a state that is not different from the primary elements that are derived from the cause of natural outcome.

original: sgra ni rnam smin las skyes pa yin no ;
analyzed: sgra ni rnam smin las skyes pa yin no ;
translated: Sound is derived from the cause of retribution.

original: / tshig tsam gyis 'dod pa mi 'grub pas de'i rgyu dris pa dang / 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes rgyu smras te /
analyzed: / tshig tsam gyis 'dod pa mi 'grub pas de'i rgyu dris pa dang / 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes rgyu smras te /
translated: Since one cannot establish a thesis merely by asserting it, the author of the treatise asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the reason that sound is derived from the cause of retribution?‚ÄùüîΩThe author of the treatise replies, ‚ÄúBecause it occurs at will.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni 'dod kyang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni 'dod kyang mi 'byung la /
translated: Retribution of the eye, etc., does not occur when one desires it,

original: mi 'dod kyang 'byung gi /
analyzed: mi 'dod kyang 'byung gi /
translated: but it does occur when one does not desire it.

original: sgra ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not like that.

original: brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It occurs only when one desires it.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs ni rnam par cha da nas yang skye ba yang ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs ni rnam par cha da nas yang skye ba yang ma yin na /
translated: Since form derived from retribution does not arise again after it has been destroyed,

original: sgra ni skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: and since sound does not arise if it is not produced,

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: sound is not derived from the cause of retribution, because it is beyond the nature of retribution.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The author of the treatise replies, ‚ÄúBecause it is contrary to the treatise.‚Äù

original: 'o na gang bstan bcos btags pa @75a * //
analyzed: 'o na gang bstan bcos btags pa @75a * //
translated: But the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: las zhes bya ba rgyas par smras so //üîΩ'grub pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba rgyas par smras so // 'grub pa bden mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe sound of the voice of BrahmƒÅ arises from the abandonment of harsh speech.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pas 'dir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pas 'dir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: This is true, but since this is not a case of retribution, there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: 'o na ci yin zhen /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhen /
translated: What is it then?

original: kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: Some say: This is a three-fold continuum,

original: de ltar na tshig rtsub po spong ba sgra'i rgyu'i rgyu yin gyi dngos su ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na tshig rtsub po spong ba sgra'i rgyu'i rgyu yin gyi dngos su ma yin la /
translated: because the abandonment of harsh speech is the indirect cause of sound, but not the direct cause.

original: rnam par smin pa ni de ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But the voice of BrahmƒÅ is not like that.

original: kha cig na re gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa las rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa las rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin pa skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: Some say: It is not logical that what is born from a cause of retribution would be born from a cause of retribution,

original: de'i phyir brgyud pa 'di bzhi pa'am lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyud pa 'di bzhi pa'am lnga pa yin te /
translated: so this continuum is four-fold or five-fold.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: las dag las ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: las dag las ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: From actions arise the primary elements born from a cause of retribution.

original: de dag las ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de dag las ni rgyas pa las 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: From those arise the primary elements born from enhancement.

original: zas dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par dag gis bskyed kyang /
analyzed: zas dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par dag gis bskyed kyang /
translated: Though they are generated by food and proper performance,

original: rnam par smin pa las bskyed pa'i 'byung ba la brten nas skye bas de dag la ni rgyas pa las byung ba rnams te zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las bskyed pa'i 'byung ba la brten nas skye bas de dag la ni rgyas pa las byung ba rnams te zhes brjod do //
translated: they are called ‚Äúarisen from enhancement‚Äù because they arise in dependence on primary elements generated from karmic maturation.

original: de dag las ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de dag las ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams te /
translated: From those, sound is derived.

original: de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From those, sound is derived because they are the homogeneous cause of sound.

original: de dag las ni sgra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag las ni sgra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: From those, sound is derived.

original: de lta na 'o na lus kyi tshor ba yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na lus kyi tshor ba yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If that is so, then also bodily feeling would be derived from enhancement,üîΩbecause it is generated from the primary elements derived from enhancement.

original: de la tshor ba gang zhig dngos kyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa de ni rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la tshor ba gang zhig dngos kyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa de ni rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever feeling is the result of the actual basis of karma is karmic maturation.

original: las las skyes kyi 'byung ba las skyes pa ni ma yin te /üîΩsgra bzhin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: las las skyes kyi 'byung ba las skyes pa ni ma yin te / sgra bzhin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is generated from karma, but not generated from the primary elements,üîΩlike sound.

original: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were like sound, it would contradict reasoning.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and it is not a maturational result.

original: sgra ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa yin par rigs pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: sgra ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa yin par rigs pa dang 'gal te /
translated: Sound is not a maturational result, because it is illogical that it is.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa ni 'dod dgur 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The eyes, etc. are not a maturational result, because they are not a result of a wish.

original: tshor ba ni 'dod pas 'jug pa'am ldog pa ma yin pas tshor ba de rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid yin par rigs pa dang mi 'gal gyi /
analyzed: tshor ba ni 'dod pas 'jug pa'am ldog pa ma yin pas tshor ba de rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid yin par rigs pa dang mi 'gal gyi /
translated: It is not illogical that feeling is a maturational result, because feeling is not engaged or stopped by a wish.

original: sgra ni 'gal te ;
analyzed: sgra ni 'gal te ;
translated: Sound is illogical,

original: 'dod dgur 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod dgur 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a result of a wish and because it is discontinuous.

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nye bar 'dus pa med kyang 'byung zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen log kyang mi ldog pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal de ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nye bar 'dus pa med kyang 'byung zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen log kyang mi ldog pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal de ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin la /
translated: If feeling were pleasant or painful, it would not arise without the condition of pleasure or pain, and it would not cease when the condition of pleasure or pain is stopped.

original: gang zhig bde ba @75b dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul nye bar tshogs pa las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig bde ba @75b dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul nye bar tshogs pa las 'byung zhing /
translated: It arises from the assembly of objects that are experienced as pleasure and pain.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba de ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //üîΩrgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba de ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o // rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
translated: That which arises from the assembly of objects that experience pleasure and pain and that does not occur when that assembly does not exist arises from natural outflow.

original: thogs pa med brgyad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: thogs pa med brgyad ces bya ba la /
translated: Eight are from natural outflow and karmic maturation.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang rnam par smin pa skyes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba nges par bzung gi / brgyad kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang rnam par smin pa skyes pa kho na'o zhes bya ba nges par bzung gi / brgyad kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: Only those that arise from natural outflow and those that arise from karmic maturation are definitely included in the eight,

original: gsum rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThree are of three types.‚Äù

original: gang dag skal ba mnyam ba dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed cing rnam par smin pa las tha dad pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: gang dag skal ba mnyam ba dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed cing rnam par smin pa las tha dad pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Those generated by the homogeneous and omnipresent causes that are distinct from karmic maturation are those that arise from natural outflow.

original: gang dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa de rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: gang dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa de rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
translated: Those generated by the cause of karmic maturation are those that arise from karmic maturation.

original: de la chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can gang dag kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa de dag ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de la chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can gang dag kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa de dag ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa yang yin te /
translated: Those that are afflicted and pervasive are also generated by the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúThe pervasive are afflicted.‚Äù

original: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa also states, ‚ÄúThe pervasive are the cause of the afflicted.‚Äù

original: rnams kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin gyi ;
analyzed: rnams kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin gyi ;
translated: Those that are generated by the homogeneous cause are not generated by the pervasive cause.üîΩThose that are generated by the pervasive cause are also generated by the homogeneous cause.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus skyed pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus skyed pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: Those that are generated by the homogeneous cause are not generated by the pervasive cause.

original: dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are generated by the homogeneous cause are virtuous and unobscured neutral states.üîΩThey are not generated by the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba ni med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba ni med de /
translated: They are not generated by the cause of enhancement.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: thogs pa med pa rnams la rgyas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams la rgyas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because enhancement does not exist for those that are unimpeded.üîΩThose that are unimpeded do not have enhancement.

original: gzugs can rnams phan tshun thogs pas bar mtshams med par gnas pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni thogs pa med pa dag la srid pa ma yin pas de dag rgyas pa las byung ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams phan tshun thogs pas bar mtshams med par gnas pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni thogs pa med pa dag la srid pa ma yin pas de dag rgyas pa las byung ba med do //
translated: Those that are unimpeded do not have enhancement because it is not possible for them to be without intervals, to be without gaps, and so on.

original: gzhan rnam gsum rnam pa gcig gam /
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum rnam pa gcig gam /
translated: The others are of three types.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not of two types.

original: zhes nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes nges par gzung ngo //
translated: This is a restrictive rule.

original: de la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
translated: Those that are not distinct from the faculties that are arisen from ripening are arisen from ripening.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Those that are not distinct from the faculties that are arisen from enhancement are arisen from enhancement.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: The remaining ones are arisen from natural outflow.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa yod do zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba ma gtogs pa rgyu mthun pa yod do zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you know that those that are not arisen from ripening or enhancement are arisen from natural outflow?

original: shi ba la yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shi ba la yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they continue to exist after death.

original: shi ba la rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa rjes su 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrdzas dang lhan cig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shi ba la rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa rjes su 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // rdzas dang lhan cig ces bya ba la /
translated: It is not logical that ripening and enhancement continue to exist after death.üîΩThey exist simultaneously with the substance.

original: gcig kho na rdzas dang ldan no zhes nges par @76a * //
analyzed: gcig kho na rdzas dang ldan no zhes nges par @76a * //
translated: Only one exists simultaneously with the substance.

original: gzung gi / gcig rdzas dang ldan pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung gi / gcig rdzas dang ldan pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that only one is substantial.

original: de la 'dus byas brtan pa ma yin pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dus ma byas ni brtan pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas brtan pa ma yin pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro // 'dus ma byas ni brtan pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because there is also an impermanent, conditioned entity.üîΩThe unconditioned is substantial because it is permanent,

original: 'dus byas thams cad spangs pa'i sgo nas dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir rdzas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad spangs pa'i sgo nas dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir rdzas so //
translated: or because it is virtuous and permanent in the sense of being the abandonment of all conditioned entities.

original: 'jig rten na gser la sogs pa'i rdzas la brten no zhes smra ba po dag yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gser la sogs pa'i rdzas la brten no zhes smra ba po dag yod de /
translated: In the world, they say, ‚ÄúI rely on the substance of gold, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de kho na rdzas yin gyi gzhan ni rdzas ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na rdzas yin gyi gzhan ni rdzas ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, only that is substantial, and the others are not substantial.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: rdzas ngan pa'i phyir chung ma ngan pa bzhin no //üîΩtha ma gsum skad cig ma ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas ngan pa'i phyir chung ma ngan pa bzhin no // tha ma gsum skad cig ma ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are bad substances, like a bad wife.üîΩThe last three are momentary.

original: tham gsum kho na skad cig ma ste zhes bya ba nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: tham gsum kho na skad cig ma ste zhes bya ba nges par gzung ngo //
translated: Only the last three are momentary.

original: gal te 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If all conditioned entities are momentary,

original: de bzhin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes smra'o //
translated: then that is so.

original: 'o na ni ji ltar tha ma gsum kho na skad cig ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni ji ltar tha ma gsum kho na skad cig ma yin zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how are the last three moments momentary?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain this, the root text says:üîΩThey are momentary because they are not derived from natural outflow.

original: de dag ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni zag pa med pa'i dbang po sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The three faculties of the last three moments of the path of seeing are not derived from natural outflow.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text says, ‚ÄúThey are momentary.‚Äù

original: de dag la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i skad cig yod pas na skad cig ma rnams so //
analyzed: de dag la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i skad cig yod pas na skad cig ma rnams so //
translated: They are momentary because they are not derived from natural outflow.

original: ji ltar de dag rgyu mthun ma yin pa'i skad cig mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rgyu mthun ma yin pa'i skad cig mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are they not derived from natural outflow?

original: zag pa med pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med pas sgal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med pas sgal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not derived from natural outflow because they are not homogeneous causes of uncontaminated states.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan ni rgyu mthun pa las ma byung ba 'ga' yang med pas de dag ni skad cig ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan ni rgyu mthun pa las ma byung ba 'ga' yang med pas de dag ni skad cig ma ma yin no //
translated: Other conditioned phenomena are not derived from natural outflow, but they are not momentary because they are not derived from natural outflow.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la ltos pa med par skye ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la ltos pa med par skye ste /
translated: The moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises without relying on a homogeneous cause.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ches stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ches stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the condition as similar and immediately antecedent is very powerful.

original: de'i rgyu stobs dang ldan pa nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam dang rnam pa mtshungs pa'i chos du mas gsos btab cing /
analyzed: de'i rgyu stobs dang ldan pa nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam dang rnam pa mtshungs pa'i chos du mas gsos btab cing /
translated: The power of its cause is itself activated by many phenomena that are similar in aspect to the ƒÅrya‚Äôs path.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni don de la rab tu spyor ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni don de la rab tu spyor ba'i phyir ro /
translated: It becomes its nature because it is applied to that object.

original: sngar bshad pa'i khams gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i khams gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir / de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate those three realms that were previously explained,üîΩit says, ‚ÄúThe mind that is concomitant with perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering‚Äù and so on.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes @76b pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes @76b pa'i khams yin no //
translated: The consciousness that is concomitant with perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is the mind element and the mind consciousness element.

original: lhag ma bzod pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang / thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: lhag ma bzod pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang / thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The rest, i.e., the associated factors such as sensation, etc., which occur with patience, the non-associated factors such as acquisition, etc., and the uncontaminated restraint are the element of factors.

original: gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The rest, i.e., the eye element, etc., are the elements of the sense faculties, objects and consciousnesses.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection here?

original: chos mngon pa ni mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'di la 'brel pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'di la 'brel pa ci zhig bya /
translated: Since Abhidharma is distinguished by its characteristics, what connection is there here?

original: chos mngon pa'i lugs shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i lugs shes pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who know the system of Abhidharma

original: mtshan nyid 'chad pa na 'brel pa la gus par mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'chad pa na 'brel pa la gus par mi byed do //
translated: do not respect the connection when explaining the characteristics.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dag bshad zin dang / da ni de gnyis kyi 'thob pa dang ldan pa dag bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dag bshad zin dang / da ni de gnyis kyi 'thob pa dang ldan pa dag bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the eye and the eye consciousness have already been explained, and now we should consider their acquisition and possession. This is the connection.

original: so so zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis te /
analyzed: so so zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis te /
translated: The word ‚Äúeach‚Äù refers to the two alternatives.

original: mig gi khams dang yin la /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la ;
analyzed: mig gi khams dang yin la / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la ;
translated: There is the eye element and the eye consciousness element.üîΩThere is the eye consciousness element and not the eye element.üîΩThere is the eye element and the eye consciousness element.

original: mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yod ces bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yod ces bya'o //
translated: There is not the eye element and the eye consciousness element.

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni mu gsum pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni mu gsum pa ste /
translated: Simultaneously means the third alternative.

original: mig gi khams dang yin pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang yin pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin pa'o //
translated: There is the eye element and the eye consciousness element.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni mu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni mu bzhi pa ste /
translated: And means the fourth alternative.

original: mig gi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya'o //
translated: There is not the eye element and the eye consciousness element.

original: yang gi sgra'i don ni 'brel pa las 'chad do //
analyzed: yang gi sgra'i don ni 'brel pa las 'chad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is explained in terms of its connection.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the desire realm, there is the obtaining of the eye faculty in stages.

original: 'dod pa'i khams smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the desire realm is to exclude the form realm.

original: rim smos pa ni rdzus te skye ba bzlog par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rim smos pa ni rdzus te skye ba bzlog par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mention of stages is for the purpose of excluding miraculous birth.

original: gang gi phyir nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni nying mtshams sbyor ba nas bzung ba nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa kho na yin gyi /üîΩlung bstan ming thob lhan cig skye //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni nying mtshams sbyor ba nas bzung ba nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa kho na yin gyi / lung bstan ming thob lhan cig skye //
translated: Because the states of kalala and so on are definitely concomitant with virtuous and afflicted eye consciousness from the moment of conception.

original: zhes 'byung ba las na mig gi khams dang ni ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po thob pa de'i tshe mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa thob kyi /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba las na mig gi khams dang ni ma yin te / de'i phyir gang gi tshe mig gi dbang po thob pa de'i tshe mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa thob kyi /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúThe obtainment of the formless realm arises simultaneously with that which is to be obtained.‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, when the eye sense faculty is obtained, the eye element alone is obtained, but not the eye consciousness element.

original: sngar kho na nas ldan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar kho na nas ldan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is already possessed.

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na zhes bya ba la /üîΩci mig @77a * //üîΩgi khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob kyi /
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na zhes bya ba la / ci mig @77a * // gi khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob kyi /
translated: When one dies in the formless realm and is born in the second absorption and so on,üîΩdoes one obtain the eye element but not the eye consciousness element?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs su bab pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs su bab pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied to the present context.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni bsam gtan gsum pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the third meditative absorption and so on.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa nas 'chi 'phos nas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa nas 'chi 'phos nas zhes bshad do //
translated: Those who are born in the formless realm are not endowed with either form or the eye faculty.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are born in the second meditative absorption and so on manifest the eye consciousness of the first meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i 'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i 'o //
translated: The eye consciousness belongs to the level of the first meditative absorption.

original: de ni de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob kyi /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob kyi /
translated: At that time, they are not endowed with the eye-consciousness element.

original: mig gi khams dang ni mi ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ni mi ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: However, they are not not endowed with the eye element.

original: de dag ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir sngar kho na nas mig gi khams thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir sngar kho na nas mig gi khams thob zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not incomplete in terms of faculties, they have already obtained the eye element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed de /
translated: They manifest the neutral eye consciousness of the first meditative absorption because the eye consciousness of the second meditative absorption and so on does not exist.

original: de'i phyir snga nas mi ldan pas lta ba'i tshe kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa 'thob kyi /
