analyzed: de'i phyir snga nas mi ldan pas lta ba'i tshe kho nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa 'thob kyi /
translated: Therefore, since one does not possess it previously, one obtains possession of it at the time of seeing.üîΩ

original: mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since one does not possess the eye element prior to seeing, one obtains possession of the eye element only at the time of seeing, but not the eye consciousness element.

original: de dag nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba ste /
analyzed: de dag nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba ste /
translated: When one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,

original: de ni mig gi khams dang ldan zin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de ni mig gi khams dang ldan zin pa kho na yin la /
translated: one possesses the eye element,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni sngar mi ldan pa las srid pa bar ma do'i gnas skabs su ldan pa 'thob po //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni sngar mi ldan pa las srid pa bar ma do'i gnas skabs su ldan pa 'thob po //
translated: but one does not possess the eye consciousness element prior to that. One obtains possession of the eye consciousness element in the intermediate existence.

original: lhan cig tu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //üîΩgzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo // gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsimultaneously‚Äù and so on is stated.üîΩWhen one dies in the formless realm and is born in the desire realm or the Brahma world,

original: de ni sngar nas gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa 'dod pa'i khams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na cig car ldan pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de ni sngar nas gnyis ka dang mi ldan pa 'dod pa'i khams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na cig car ldan pa 'thob bo //
translated: one obtains possession of both the eye element and the eye consciousness element simultaneously, since one did not possess both prior to that.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten dang ldan pa'i shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten dang ldan pa'i shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba na'o //
translated: Those who die in the formless realm and are reborn there, or who die in the Brahma world and are reborn there.

original: thob pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: thob pa bshad zin to /
translated: Obtaining has been explained.

original: // / da ni ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, possession should be explained.

original: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de mig gi khams kho na dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de mig gi khams kho na dang ldan gyi /
translated: One who possesses the eye element possesses only the eye element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te /
translated: But one does not possess the eye consciousness element,

original: rang gi sa pa med pa'i @77b phyir dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yang mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa med pa'i @77b phyir dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yang mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not have the level of one's own realm and because the level of the first absorption is not manifest.

original: mu gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The second possibility is one who possesses the eye consciousness element but not the eye element.

original: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa kho na dang ldan gyi /üîΩmig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa kho na dang ldan gyi / mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: One who possesses the future eye consciousness element but not the eye element.üîΩOne who possesses the eye element but not the eye consciousness element is one who is born in the desire realm.

original: ma thob pa dmus long ngo //
analyzed: ma thob pa dmus long ngo //
translated: One who possesses neither is one who is born blind.

original: nyams pa ni mig la gnod pa byas pas long ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni mig la gnod pa byas pas long ba'o //
translated: Loss is the blindness caused by an injury to the eye.

original: gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig thob pa dang / ma nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na mig thob pa dang / ma nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The third possibility is one who possesses both eyes in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ni de na dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir thob pa dang ma nyams pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ni de na dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir thob pa dang ma nyams pa mi bya'o //
translated: One born in the first absorption does not possess or not possess eyes, because there is no incomplete sense faculty there.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One born in the second absorption and so on is like that.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gnyis ka dang ldan pa'o //üîΩbzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ldan pa'o // bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes pa ste /
translated: One who possesses both.üîΩThe fourth possibility is one who does not possess either.

original: de ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: One born in the formless realm does not possess both.

original: de bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dag dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dag dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, the Abhidharmakosa states, One who possesses the eye element and the form element.

original: gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin nam zhen /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin nam zhen /
translated: Is it not the case that one who does not possess the eye element obtains it?

original: 'di ni mu bzhi med do //
analyzed: 'di ni mu bzhi med do //
translated: This is not a tetralemma.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the correct explanation?

original: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: The correct explanation is that the latter phrase is connected with the former phrase.

original: gang gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa thob pa de mig gi khams dang yin te /
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa thob pa de mig gi khams dang yin te /
translated: One who obtains the eye element without the form element is one who obtains the eye element but not the form element.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //
translated: This refers to one who dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm or form realm.

original: mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa thob pa yin gyi /
translated: One who obtains the eye element but not the form element exists,

original: snga nas ldan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams ma yin pa yod de /
analyzed: snga nas ldan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams ma yin pa yod de /
translated: but one who obtains the form element but not the eye element does not exist, because one who is born in the desire realm or form realm already possesses the form element.

original: rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa na'o //
analyzed: rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa na'o //
translated: One who obtains the eye faculty gradually.

original: gang mig gi khams dang yang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang yang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who possesses the eye element also one who possesses the form element?

original: 'dir yang mu bzhi mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang mu bzhi mi rigs te /
translated: Here, the four possibilities are not correct.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the correct explanation?

original: tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /üîΩgang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //üîΩgzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste / gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no // gzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi /
translated: The correct explanation is that the former phrase is connected with the latter phrase.üîΩOne who possesses the eye element also possesses the form element.

original: mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: One who possesses the form element but not the eye element exists.

original: mig ma thob dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mig ma thob dang nyams pa'o //
translated: Those who have not obtained the eye or have lost it.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams kyang ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams kyang ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not the case that one who obtains the eye sense faculty without possessing eye consciousness also obtains the form element?

original: mu bzhi ste /üîΩmu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes @78a * //
analyzed: mu bzhi ste / mu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes @78a * //
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed ba dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed ba dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
translated: The first possibility is one born in the second absorption and so on who manifests eye consciousness and one who dies in the second absorption and so on and is born in the desire realm or the Brahma realm.

original: gnyis pa ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag tu skye na ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag tu skye na ste /
translated: The second possibility is one who dies in the formless realm and is born in the second absorption and so on.

original: de ni gzugs kyi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa 'thob kyi /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa 'thob kyi / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te /
translated: One obtains the form element alone,üîΩbut not the eye consciousness element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis pa la sogs pa nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis pa la sogs pa nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a second eye consciousness and so on does not exist.

original: mu gsum pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dag tu skye ba na ste /üîΩde ni gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob la /
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dag tu skye ba na ste / de ni gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob la /
translated: The third possibility is when one who dies in the formless realm is born in the desire realm or the first absorption.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin no //
translated: He obtains the form realm and the eye consciousness element.

original: mu bzhi pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa de nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de dag de nas shi 'phos nas de dag nyid du skye ba'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa de nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de dag de nas shi 'phos nas de dag nyid du skye ba'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is when one born in the formless realm dies and is reborn there, or when one born in the desire realm or the first absorption dies and is reborn there.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who possesses the eye consciousness element also one who possesses the form element?

original: 'dir yang tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: Here, the former term is applied.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin te /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin te /
translated: One who possesses the eye consciousness element is also one who possesses the form element.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //üîΩgzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o // gzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi /
translated: when one is born in the desire realm or in the first concentration, or when one is born in the second concentration and so on and visual consciousness is manifest.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a realm of form that is not a realm of consciousness.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o //
translated: When one is born in the second concentration and so on and visual consciousness is not manifest.

original: nang gi bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang gi bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The twelve internal ones are called the internal.

original: 'di ci zhig tu gzung bar bya /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig tu gzung bar bya /
translated: What is this?

original: ci bcu gnyis nang kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ci bcu gnyis nang kho na yin gyi /
translated: Are the twelve only internal,

original: 'on te bcu gnyis kho na nang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bcu gnyis kho na nang gi yin zhe na /
translated: or are only the twelve internal?

original: gnyis ka ltar yang nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yang nges par gzung ste /
translated: Both are ascertained.

original: nges par gzung ba nyid kyis ni gzhan dag phyi'i zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba nyid kyis ni gzhan dag phyi'i zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: By the very ascertainment, the others are established as external.

original: grangs tsam zhig bstan pas khyad par du rtog par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs tsam zhig bstan pas khyad par du rtog par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: Since a mere enumeration is taught, it is not conceived as a distinction. Therefore,

original: bcu gnyis gang dag ce na zhes dris so //
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang dag ce na zhes dris so //
translated: which twelve?

original: de dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dmigs kyis dgar ba'i phyir /
translated: To specify that, he says:

original: gzugs la sogs ma gtogs zhes bya ba smos @78b so ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ma gtogs zhes bya ba smos @78b so ;
translated: apart from form, etc.

original: / bdag gi dbang du byas na ni nang gi ste /
analyzed: / bdag gi dbang du byas na ni nang gi ste /
translated: If the self were the dominant factor, then the internal would be the self.

original: nang gi nyid ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: nang gi nyid ni nang gi'o //
translated: The internal itself is the internal.

original: bdag med na nang gi'am phyi 'di 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag med na nang gi'am phyi 'di 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no self, then this internal or external would not exist.

original: tshul khrims med par ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims bslab par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩsems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims med par ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims bslab par mi 'gyur ro zhe na / sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If there were no morality, then the training in superior morality would not exist.

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis ngar 'dzin pa'i rten la bdag ces brjod de /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis ngar 'dzin pa'i rten la bdag ces brjod de /

original: ngar 'dzin pa yang sems la brten te /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa yang sems la brten te /
translated: The KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,

original: de yang rtog pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang rtog pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,

original: gang zag smra bar rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag smra bar rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: The KaÃÑra·πáapraj√±ƒÅpti says,üîΩThe Ka

original: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal ba bzhag pas na sems kho na bdag yin la /
analyzed: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal ba bzhag pas na sems kho na bdag yin la /
translated: Since the mind is posited as the self through the positing of the pride of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù the mind alone is the self.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyang sems la brten pa'i phyir sems kho na la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyang sems la brten pa'i phyir sems kho na la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: And since mental factors are based on the mind, the mind alone is designated as the self.

original: 'dir sems la bdag tu mngon par bzhed do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'dir sems la bdag tu mngon par bzhed do zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How do we know that the self is asserted to be the mind alone here?üîΩTherefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / mkhas pas bdag nyid shin tu ni //üîΩzhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mkhas pas bdag nyid shin tu ni // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The wise should thoroughly

original: 'di yang lung gzhan la ltos te don de nyid kyi khungs yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang lung gzhan la ltos te don de nyid kyi khungs yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this is that this is a source for that meaning in dependence on another scripture.üîΩIt is not independent.

original: yan gar ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yan gar ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain this, it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said in another s≈´tra:

original: 'di las ni /
analyzed: 'di las ni /
translated: Here it says:

original: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren //üîΩzhes sems dul ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren // zhes sems dul ba gsungs so //
translated: A tamed mind leads to happiness.üîΩThus it says that a tamed mind is the self.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bdag gi sgra sems kho na mngon par bzhed do zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bdag gi sgra sems kho na mngon par bzhed do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore here the word ‚Äúself‚Äù is known to be asserted to be the mind alone.

original: de'i phyir / mig la sogs pa ni sems bdag tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mig la sogs pa ni sems bdag tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe eyes and so on are the support for the mind that is the self.‚Äù

original: bdag tu gyur pa'i ni bdag dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu gyur pa'i ni bdag dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The mind that is the self is like the self.üîΩThe eyes and so on are the support for the mind that is the self because they are like a support.üîΩThe eyes and so on are the support for the mind that is the self because they are the basis for the mind‚Äôs presence.

original: rten gyi dngos por zhes bya ba ni rten dang 'dra bas na rten to //üîΩnye bar gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rten gyi dngos por zhes bya ba ni rten dang 'dra bas na rten to // nye bar gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the basis for the mind‚Äôs presence?üîΩWhat is the difference between the eyes and so on and form and so on, since the mind is not present in form and so on?

original: mig la sogs pa rnams la gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas sems yul na mi gnas pa'i rten gyi dngos po gang zhig yod ce na /üîΩkhyad par gang zhig yod na sems de dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed par 'gyur la /üîΩde dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa las kyang rnam par shes pa de dag yul na mi gnas kyang mig la sogs pa dag kho na mngon gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams la gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas sems yul na mi gnas pa'i rten gyi dngos po gang zhig yod ce na / khyad par gang zhig yod na sems de dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed par 'gyur la / de dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa las kyang rnam par shes pa de dag yul na mi gnas kyang mig la sogs pa dag kho na mngon gyi /
translated: What is the difference between the eyes and so on and form and so on, since the mind is not present in form and so on?üîΩWhat is the difference between the eyes and so on and form and so on, since the mind is not present in form and so on?

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar @79a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar @79a * //
translated: What is the difference between the eyes and so on and form and so on, since the mind is not present in form and so on?üîΩWhat is the difference between the eyes and so on and form and so on, since the mind is not present in form and so on?üîΩWhat is the difference between the eyes and so on and form and so on, since the mind is not present in form and so on?

original: tshor ba bde ba'am sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi yul la yongs su gcod kyi /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba'am sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi yul la yongs su gcod kyi /
translated: Consciousness associated with pleasant or unpleasant feeling completely determines the object of the body.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi yul la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi yul la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not determine the object of the object, such as form.

original: de'i phyir khyad par 'di las mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyur khyad par med kyang rten nyid dang yul nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par 'di las mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyur khyad par med kyang rten nyid dang yul nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, although there is no difference between the eye, etc. and form, etc. in their role as causes of the arising of consciousness, they are established as the basis and the object, respectively, on the basis of this difference.

original: de'i phyir nang gi dang phyi'i nyid kyang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi dang phyi'i nyid kyang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are also the internal and the external.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa dag rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos po yin na /üîΩde lta na 'o na rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa dag rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos po yin na / de lta na 'o na rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If the eye, etc. are the basis of consciousness,üîΩthen the six elements of consciousness would not be mentioned in the sutra, because they would be included in the six sense faculties.üîΩIf the six sense faculties are the basis of consciousness,üîΩthen the six elements of consciousness would not be mentioned in the sutra, because they would be included in the six sense faculties.

original: de dag yid kyi khams nyid du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba na ni drug po 'das ma thag pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yid kyi khams nyid du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba na ni drug po 'das ma thag pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa'o //
translated: The six elements of consciousness are mentioned in the sutra because the six sense faculties are not the basis of consciousness.

original: da ltar ba'am ma 'ongs pa ni sems kyi rten ma yin te /üîΩdrug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: da ltar ba'am ma 'ongs pa ni sems kyi rten ma yin te / drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The present and future are not the basis of mind.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: The consciousness that has just ceased is the mental faculty.

original: zhes de'i tshe yid kyi khams nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gis yang de'i tshe na yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes de'i tshe yid kyi khams nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro // gang gis yang de'i tshe na yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: At that time, it is established as the mental faculty element.üîΩBy what?

original: 'das pa'am da ltar byung ba yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'am da ltar byung ba yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether past or present,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa de dag nyid de dag ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa de dag nyid de dag ste /
translated: those very eye consciousness elements, etc.

original: yid kyi khams yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi khams yin no //
translated: are the mental faculty element.

original: rnam par shes pa 'das pa la ni sngar ma byung ba'i yid kyi khams nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'das pa la ni sngar ma byung ba'i yid kyi khams nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Past consciousness would not become the mental faculty element, which did not exist previously.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid sngar yod pa 'am ldog pa med de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid sngar yod pa 'am ldog pa med de /
translated: Or, the previously existing eye consciousness element, etc. would not cease,

original: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos pos yid kyi khams su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa'i gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos pos yid kyi khams su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness itself is established as the mental faculty element by the fact that it is the basis of another consciousness.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, it does not go beyond the definition of mind.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable that the past and future are the mental element.

original: de lta ma yin na ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the past and future were not the mental element, then what would they be?

original: gal te rnam par shes pa da ltar 'byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yid kyi khams su mi 'gyur na ni 'das pa yang yid kyi khams dang / mig la sogs par shes par mi mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa da ltar 'byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i yid kyi khams su mi 'gyur na ni 'das pa yang yid kyi khams dang / mig la sogs par shes par mi mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the present consciousness were not the mental element of the present and the mental element of the future, then the past would not be the mental element and the eye element, etc.

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If that were so,

original: yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: then the past would be the mental element alone.

original: gal te yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the past were the mental element alone, what would follow?

original: de'i phyir / khams bco brgyad po dag ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / khams bco brgyad po dag ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúThe eighteen elements would not be tenable.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir de ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is that asserted?

original: @79b de'i phyir gal te rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: @79b de'i phyir gal te rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIf the future consciousness were not the mental element of the future, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni /
translated: The cause of that is explained:

original: mtshan nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The characteristic is that it is not confused about the times.

original: 'khrul pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa gzhan dag yin zhing /üîΩda ltar byung ba gzhan dag yin la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa gzhan dag yin zhing / da ltar byung ba gzhan dag yin la /
translated: The future is different from the present and the past.üîΩThe present is different from the future and the past.

original: 'das pa gzhan yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa gzhan yin pa'o //
translated: The past is different from the future and the present.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'das pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'das pa'i yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of future consciousness and the characteristic of present consciousness are the same as the characteristic of past consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristic of the present and future consciousnesses is the same as the characteristic of the mental element,

original: 'das pa'i dus su de'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su de'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa med do //
translated: the characteristic of past consciousness is not different from the characteristic of present and future consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa rnams la rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin nyid ni thams cad kyi tshe yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa rnams la rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin nyid ni thams cad kyi tshe yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the support of consciousness does not exist at all times.

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The immediately past of the six consciousnesses

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: is the mental faculty.

original: zhes 'das pa rnams la ni mngon par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'das pa rnams la ni mngon par gsal ba yin no //
translated: This is clearly stated in the past.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams drug car yang nang gi yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams drug car yang nang gi yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the six internal elements of consciousness are past, future, and present.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang bcas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang bcas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The element of mental objects is that which is associated with the supported.

original: brten pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is associated with the supported‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: lhag ma ni de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand that which is similar to it‚Äù is supplied in order to indicate that the other elements are not associated with the supported.

original: 'di ni brten pa dang bcas pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni brten pa dang bcas pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of the supported object.

original: yul gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi dmigs par nges la /
analyzed: yul gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi dmigs par nges la /
translated: The object that is ascertained as the objective support of a consciousness.

original: gal te yul de la rnam par shes pa skyes pa 'am zhes bya brgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yul de la rnam par shes pa skyes pa 'am zhes bya brgyas par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If the consciousness has arisen with regard to that object, then the object is said to be ‚Äúthat which is associated with the supported.‚Äù

original: skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos can las khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos can las khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is subject to arising‚Äù is used to distinguish this from that which is not subject to arising.

original: de ltar na de ni gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the object is said to be ‚Äúthat which is associated with the supported‚Äù because it is the object that is grasped by the consciousness that is the supported.

original: chos kyi khams kyang gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can yin pas brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyang gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can yin pas brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The element of mental objects also has the characteristic of being apprehended and apprehending, and so is said to be supported.

original: gang la yod kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang la yod kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The consciousness that exists in it is called the consciousness of mental objects.

original: yid ni shes bya ma lus pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: yid ni shes bya ma lus pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir te / gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am /
translated: The mental faculty is the subject of all objects of cognition.

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khams dus gsum pa dang / dus med pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med do //üîΩmtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su bgrang @80a * //
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khams dus gsum pa dang / dus med pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med do // mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su bgrang @80a * //
translated: There is no element of mental objects in the three times or outside of time that is not the object of the infinite mental consciousness, nor is there any that will not be its object.

original: du med pa'o //
analyzed: du med pa'o //
translated: Infinite means innumerable.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: This means ‚Äúfor what reason?‚Äù

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad la ni gdon mi za bar chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa'i shes pa 'di skye ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad la ni gdon mi za bar chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa'i shes pa 'di skye ste /
translated: For all noble persons, the knowledge that all things are selfless definitely arises.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi khams ni rtag tu brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi khams ni rtag tu brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the element of mental objects is always concomitant with something else.

original: de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig tu byung ba ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig tu byung ba ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The focal object of that is all phenomena, except for itself and what is concomitant with it.

original: chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa'i shes pa de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi bdag nyid la byed par 'gal bas de nyid kyis de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med do snyam pa'i shes pa de'i dmigs pa yang rang gi bdag nyid la byed par 'gal bas de nyid kyis de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The cognition that thinks ‚ÄúAll phenomena are selfless‚Äù does not apprehend itself because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: bdag nyid ma gtogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma gtogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
translated: That is the focal object of that cognition, except for itself and what is concomitant with it.

original: dmigs pa gcig pas sems las byung ba rnams ma gtogs pa dang / shin tu nye ba'i phyir thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa rnams ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pas sems las byung ba rnams ma gtogs pa dang / shin tu nye ba'i phyir thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ldan pa rnams ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad yin no //
translated: All phenomena other than that are the focal object of that cognition, except for itself, because they are the same focal object as the mind and mental factors and because they are very close, except for obtainment, arising, and so on that are concomitant with it.

original: sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas shing lhan cig 'byung ba dang bcas pa de yang sems gzhan gyis bdag med par 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas shing lhan cig 'byung ba dang bcas pa de yang sems gzhan gyis bdag med par 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: That mind possessing concomitants and arising together is apprehended as selfless by another mind.

original: de ltar na skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na skad cig ma gnyis kyi dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur te /
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa states,

original: kun rdzob gcig pus rang tshogs las //
analyzed: kun rdzob gcig pus rang tshogs las //
translated: The conventional is only one‚Äôs own mental assemblage.

original: gzhan ni bdag med nyid rig 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag med nyid rig 'byung //
translated: The other arises from the knowledge of selflessness.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: 'o na khams bco brgyad po thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na khams bco brgyad po thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If all eighteen elements are objects of the knowledge of selflessness,

original: chos kyi khams bzhin du brten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi khams bzhin du brten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then like the phenomena element, they would be supported.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: They are not,

original: de dag ni rang gi byed pa la ltos nas brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi byed pa la ltos nas brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are posited as supported and similar to that in dependence on their own function.

original: lhag ma ni de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The remaining are similar to that.

original: gal te chos zhes bya ba brten pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ba nyid kyis de las gzhan pa rnams brten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid du grub na /
analyzed: gal te chos zhes bya ba brten pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ba nyid kyis de las gzhan pa rnams brten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid du grub na /
translated: If it is ascertained that the phenomena element alone is supported, then it is established that the others are supported and similar to that.

original: yang ci'i phyir rtsom par byed ce na /üîΩci nas kyang de khams gcig la de dang mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rtsom par byed ce na / ci nas kyang de khams gcig la de dang mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Why does he compose this treatise?

original: 'on kyang thams cad gnyis ka yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur bar khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad gnyis ka yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur bar khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make a distinction, so that it will be understood that the eye sense faculty is not homogeneous with any of the elements, but rather that all are homogeneous with each other.

original: @80b gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
analyzed: @80b gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
translated: That which does not perform its own function

original: de ni de dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: is homogeneous with that.

original: zhes ston te /
analyzed: zhes ston te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gang rang gi las byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rang gi las byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which performs its own function is said to be supported.

original: de dag las gang gi las gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las gang gi las gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the function of each of those?

original: de la mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong ba'am zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: de la mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong ba'am zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo ;
translated: The eye sense faculty sees visible form.

original: / de dang mtshungs pa'i mig la slob dpon rnams kyi blo tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de dang mtshungs pa'i mig la slob dpon rnams kyi blo tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Vasubandhu‚Äôs opinion differs from that of the masters on the topic of homogeneous eyes.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say there are four types.

original: gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gag pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gag pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The eye sense faculty that ceases without seeing visible form.

original: mig da ltar ba ni 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'gags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig da ltar ba ni 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'gags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The present eye is called ceased because it is about to cease.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi byed pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi byed pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of impermanence is present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The future eye is called that which will cease because it is characterized by arising.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar ji ltar skye ba de bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar ji ltar skye ba de bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because it will certainly cease in the same way that it arises.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can gang yin pa de yang rkyen ma tshang pa las mi skye ba nyid yin pas ches shin tu de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can gang yin pa de yang rkyen ma tshang pa las mi skye ba nyid yin pas ches shin tu de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: That which is not characterized by arising is not produced because its conditions are incomplete. Therefore it is similar to that.

original: nub phyogs pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: nub phyogs pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: According to the westerners, there are five types.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam pa gsum ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Three types are as above.

original: mi skye chos can ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa sta /
analyzed: mi skye chos can ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa sta /
translated: That which is not characterized by arising is consciousness and that which is not associated with consciousness.

original: ji ltar mig da ltar ba cung zad cig ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mig da ltar ba cung zad cig ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Just as the present eye sense faculty is sometimes associated with consciousness and sometimes not,

original: 'ga' zhig ni mi ldan pa yin pa de bzhin du mi skye ba'i chos can yang yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni mi ldan pa yin pa de bzhin du mi skye ba'i chos can yang yin no //
translated: so too it is sometimes a nonarisen dharma.

original: yid mi skye ba'i chos can kho na de dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: yid mi skye ba'i chos can kho na de dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is only a nonarisen dharma.

original: skyes pa gdon mi za bar dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa gdon mi za bar dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is definitely apprehended when it arises.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus consciousness does not arise without an object field,

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gi dbang po'i byed pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i phyir ro // rang gi dbang po'i byed pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is said that consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: rang gi dbang po'i byed pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: rang gi dbang po'i byed pa smos pas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the activity of its own sense faculty‚Äù

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'i byed pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'i byed pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: indicates that the activity of the homogeneous cause and so on is also included.

original: gcig gi mig brten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gcig gi mig brten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe eye of one who possesses eyes‚Äù indicatesüîΩthat the activity of the dominant condition is also included.

original: lha sbyin gyi mig brten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni nag po la sogs pa thams cad kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi mig brten pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni nag po la sogs pa thams cad kyi yang yin no //
translated: The eye sense faculty and its basis are also the eye sense faculty of Devadatta.

original: de dang mtshungs pa rnams kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba la /üîΩgcig gi mig de dang mtshungs pa @81a * //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa rnams kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba la / gcig gi mig de dang mtshungs pa @81a * //
translated: The same holds for the other sense faculties.

original: gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yang yin te /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yang yin te /
translated: The eye sense faculty of one person is the eye sense faculty of all,

original: yid kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yid kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: as is the case for the mental faculty.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig gis brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog go //üîΩgzugs ni gang zhig lta ba de'i brten pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig gis brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog go // gzugs ni gang zhig lta ba de'i brten pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Because the eye sense faculty is not specific to one person, it is considered to be the eye sense faculty of all, as is the case for the mental faculty.

original: gang mi lta ba de'i ni de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang mi lta ba de'i ni de dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The eye sense faculty is the eye sense faculty of the person who sees by means of it; it is also the eye sense faculty of the person who does not see by means of it.

original: de'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig gi dbang gis gzugs brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rgyud gcig gi dbang gis gzugs brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because the eye sense faculty is not specific to one person, it is considered to be the eye sense faculty of all, as is the case for the mental faculty.

original: gzugs gang la gcig lta ba de las zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs gang la gcig lta ba de las zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe eye sees the form for which it has an object.‚Äù

original: gzugs ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa du ma bskyed pa'i nus pa yod do //üîΩde'i phyir de ni rgyud du ma'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gang gis lta ba de'i brten pa dang bcas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa du ma bskyed pa'i nus pa yod do // de'i phyir de ni rgyud du ma'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gang gis lta ba de'i brten pa dang bcas pa yin gyi /
translated: Form is common because it is possible for many eye consciousnesses to arise from it.

original: thams cad kyi ni ma yin no ;üîΩ/ lha sbyin gyis mig gis ni gzhan nam yang lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni ma yin no ; / lha sbyin gyis mig gis ni gzhan nam yang lta ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established by the power of many mindstreams. Thus, it is the object of the eye consciousness of one who sees it, but not of all.

original: bsgre ba ni /
analyzed: bsgre ba ni /
translated: The eye consciousness of Devadatta does not see the form that is the object of the eye consciousness of Yaj√±adatta.

original: gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du sgra dang zhes rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du sgra dang zhes rgyas par smos so //
translated: The S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúJust as it is with form, so it is with sound, and so on.‚Äù

original: sgra ni de lta yin du chug na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po rjes su yid ma rang ba'o //
analyzed: sgra ni de lta yin du chug na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po rjes su yid ma rang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLet us assume that sound is like that,‚Äù means that the opponent does not accept that.

original: dri la sogs pa ni gang dag gcig gis 'dzin pa de dag gzhan gyis mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa ni gang dag gcig gis 'dzin pa de dag gzhan gyis mi 'dzin to //
translated: Smell and so on are not apprehended by one who apprehends another.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause they are apprehended through contact.‚Äù

original: de'i mig la sogs pa bzhin du de dag kyang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i mig la sogs pa bzhin du de dag kyang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: Like the eye faculty, etc., they are not shared in common.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gcig gi sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gi sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i dri la sogs pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nose, etc., of one person can produce the olfactory consciousness, etc., of another person.

original: res 'ga' zhig rkyen nye na de dag nyid thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sna la sogs pa'i yul du skyes pa na /
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig rkyen nye na de dag nyid thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sna la sogs pa'i yul du skyes pa na /
translated: When the conditions are close, they are shared in common. Therefore, when the object arises as the object of another‚Äôs nose, etc.,

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba srid pa de ni yod kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba srid pa de ni yod kyi /
translated: it is possible that the consciousness arises in that other person.

original: gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan lta ba ni nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan lta ba ni nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the eye of one person never sees the form of another person,

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not shared in common.

original: gal te chos kyi khams kyang thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rgyud du ma'i dbang gis brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ci'i phyir rnam bar mi 'jog ce na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi khams kyang thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rgyud du ma'i dbang gis brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ci'i phyir rnam bar mi 'jog ce na /
translated: If the element of mental objects is shared in common, like form, etc., why is it not established as being supported by many streams and as being similar to them?

original: gzugs ne da ltar byung ba kho na mthong gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs @81b pa dang ; mi skye ba'i chos can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ne da ltar byung ba kho na mthong gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs @81b pa dang ; mi skye ba'i chos can ni ma yin te /
translated: Form is seen only in the present, not in the past or future, nor as a nonarisen dharma.

original: reg bya'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: reg bya'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of tactile objects.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo rgyud du ma'i dbang gis bya ba byed pa las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo rgyud du ma'i dbang gis bya ba byed pa las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, form and so on are established as having a basis and as having a nature that is similar to it, because they function through the power of a continuum of many causes.

original: chos zhes bya ba la ni rnam par rtog pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la ni rnam par rtog pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for dharmas.

original: de ni dus gsum dang / dus su ma gtogs pa la yang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus gsum dang / dus su ma gtogs pa la yang rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are objects of consciousness in the three times and also outside of time.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag gi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dag gi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof eye consciousness, etc.‚Äù is an example.

original: ji ltar brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How do they have a basis and how are they similar to it?

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúbecause they are subject to arising and non-arising.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness that does not have an objective referent is not subject to arising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: yid kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin no zhes dper brjod pa smos so //
analyzed: yid kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin no zhes dper brjod pa smos so //
translated: it says, ‚Äújust like the mind element.

original: skye ba'i chos can gyi yid ni brten pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can gyi yid ni brten pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The mind that is subject to arising is associated with support.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can ni de dang mtshungs pa yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can ni de dang mtshungs pa yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: The mind that is not subject to arising is similar to that.

original: brten pa dang bcas pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúassociated with support‚Äù?

original: brten pa ni brten pa'o //
analyzed: brten pa ni brten pa'o //
translated: Support means that which is supported.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas brten pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas brten pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: Since they have that, they are associated with support.

original: de yang dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun brten pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang / yul dang / rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun brten pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That is to say, the faculties, the objective domains, and the consciousnesses are mutually supportive.

original: rten dang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por phan tshun rjes su mthun pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rten dang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por phan tshun rjes su mthun pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmutually corresponding‚Äù is that they are mutually supportive in the sense of being the support, the objective domain, and the possessor of the objective domain.

original: yang na byed pa la brtan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byed pa la brtan pa ste /
translated: Or else, the meaning of ‚Äúhaving the same basis‚Äù is that they have the same activity.

original: gang zhig gang gis byed pa yin pa de la de rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis byed pa yin pa de la de rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: That which is the activity of one is the activity of the other.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po'i byed pa lta ba yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gnas pa yod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po'i byed pa lta ba yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gnas pa yod pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the activity of the eye faculty is seeing, the activity of consciousness is cognition, and the activity of form is to be the object of those two.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: yang na 'bras bu reg pa 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu reg pa 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, the meaning of ‚Äúhaving the same basis‚Äù is that they have the same result.

original: rten mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: rten mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving the same basis‚Äù is that they have the same result.

original: 'di ltar reg pa ni de dag la rag las pa'i phyir yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa brten pas brten pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa ni de dag la rag las pa'i phyir yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa brten pas brten pa yin te /
translated: Because contact depends on the object, faculty, and consciousness, it is said to be based on the three.

original: de'i phyir brten pa mtshungs pa dag ste /üîΩreg pa mtshungs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir brten pa mtshungs pa dag ste / reg pa mtshungs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, they are said to have the same basis because they have the same result.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúhaving the same contact‚Äù is that they have the same result.

original: de dag gi reg pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos 'bras bu mtshungs @82a * //
analyzed: de dag gi reg pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos 'bras bu mtshungs @82a * //
translated: The result of contact is feeling.

original: pa des na rgyun dngos por mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa des na rgyun dngos por mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, the continuum is similar to a thing because it is similar to it.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like it.

original: gang dag brten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang dag brten pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Those that are not associated with the elements are the five sense faculties of the eye, etc.

original: de dag ni brtan pa dang bcas pa de dag dang 'dra bas de dang mtshungs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni brtan pa dang bcas pa de dag dang 'dra bas de dang mtshungs pa dag go //
translated: They are similar to those that are associated with the elements because they are similar to them.

original: tshul gang gis she na ;
analyzed: tshul gang gis she na ;
translated: In what way?

original: bshad pa / rigs mthun pas mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rigs mthun pas mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said: because they are similar in type.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are like that.

original: de dag gnyis ka yang lta ba dang / skye mched gcig dang / khams gcig yin na'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka yang lta ba dang / skye mched gcig dang / khams gcig yin na'o //
translated: Both of those are one view, one sense base, and one element.

original: yang na phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i rigs 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i rigs 'dra ba ste /
translated: Or, they are similar in type because they are mutually causal.

original: phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun 'dren par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun 'dren par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually related and mutually related.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: How many elements are to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: de la gang dag mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la gang dag mthong bas spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: Those that are abandoned by the path of insight are the factors that are abandoned by insight.

original: gang dag bsgom pas spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag bsgom pas spong bar 'gyur ba de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: Those that are abandoned by the path of cultivation are the factors that are abandoned by cultivation.

original: zag pa med pa dag ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dag ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The factors that are pure are not to be abandoned.

original: yang rnam pa dgu char yang rdo bcag pa'i tshul du lam rnam pa gcig gis spong ba de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //üîΩrnam pa dgu /
analyzed: yang rnam pa dgu char yang rdo bcag pa'i tshul du lam rnam pa gcig gis spong ba de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o // rnam pa dgu /
translated: Moreover, those that are abandoned by a single path, like a rock that is split by a single lightning bolt, are the factors that are abandoned by insight.

original: lam rnam pa dgus padma'i rtsa ba'i thag pa'i tshul du spong ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: lam rnam pa dgus padma'i rtsa ba'i thag pa'i tshul du spong ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: Those that are abandoned by nine paths, like a lotus that is split by nine lightning bolts, are the factors that are abandoned by cultivation.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The factors that are abandoned by insight and cultivation are classified as follows:

original: zag pa dang bcas pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are factors that are abandoned by insight and that are impure.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang yod ces rgyas par mdo nyid las gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kyang yod ces rgyas par mdo nyid las gsungs so //
translated: The sutra itself explains this in detail.

original: re zhig gzugs can zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs can zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are form‚Äù is explained in detail.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to exclude those that are not form.

original: bcu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúten‚Äù is used to clarify the element of mental objects.

original: lnga yang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dag go //
analyzed: lnga yang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfive as well‚Äù refers to the elements of visual consciousness, etc., excluding the element of mental consciousness.

original: 'di lta bu ci zhig tu nges par gzung zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta bu ci zhig tu nges par gzung zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of this enumeration?üîΩThe five elements are only to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: khams lnga po dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi / de dag kho na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o zhes ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khams lnga po dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi / de dag kho na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o zhes ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that only those are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation,

original: tha ma'i rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma'i rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Abhidharmasamuccaya states, ‚ÄúThe last three are of three types.‚Äù

original: de la gzugs can bcu po @82b dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la gzugs can bcu po @82b dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The ten elements that are form are only to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: bden pa dag la log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dag la log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no wrong understanding of the truths.

original: ji ltar log par rtogs pa med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar log par rtogs pa med ce na /
translated: How is there no wrong understanding?

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin yang kha phyir bltas par 'jug pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin du zin yang kha phyir bltas par 'jug pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: Even though the five consciousnesses such as eye consciousness have objects, they are abandoned by cultivation because they engage external objects.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kha nang du bltas pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kha nang du bltas pas 'jug ste /
translated: Those abandoned by the path of seeing engage internal objects.

original: nges par rtog pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par rtog pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage by way of decisive conception.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not not to be abandoned.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are contaminated.

original: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to ;
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to ;
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of inclusion.

original: / tha ma'i gsum rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / tha ma'i gsum rnam gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: The last three are of three types.

original: 'don pa'i go rims kyis mtha' na yod pa'i phyir tha ma'o //
analyzed: 'don pa'i go rims kyis mtha' na yod pa'i phyir tha ma'o //
translated: Because they are at the end in the order of recitation, they are the last.

original: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni khams gsum gyi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni khams gsum gyi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The eighty-eight negative tendencies are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of the three realms.

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba smos pas ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid dang / phra rgyas rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa sdud do //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba smos pas ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid dang / phra rgyas rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa sdud do //
translated: By mentioning that they arise together with them, the mental factors and the mind that are associated with them, their characteristics, and the acquisition that is co-arisen with the proclivities are included.

original: de dag gi thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag sngar skyes pa dang / phyi nas skye ba de dag sdud do //
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag sngar skyes pa dang / phyi nas skye ba de dag sdud do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äútheir acquisition‚Äù includes those that arise previously and those that arise later.

original: rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba rjes kyi thob pa dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rjes su 'brang ba rjes kyi thob pa dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalong with their following‚Äù includes their subsequent acquisition and the characteristics that are compatible with them.

original: de la phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The consciousness that is associated with the eighty-eight proclivities is the mind element and the mind-consciousness element.

original: lhag ma mtshungs par ldan pa phra rgyas dag dang lhan cig pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi chos kyi khams te /
analyzed: lhag ma mtshungs par ldan pa phra rgyas dag dang lhan cig pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi chos kyi khams te /
translated: The remaining elements are the element of mental objects, which is associated with the proclivities and is not associated with them.

original: khams gsum po 'di dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: These three realms are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma rnams ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no zhes bya ba dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma rnams ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no zhes bya ba dag 'byung ste /
translated: The remaining contaminated states are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩUncontaminated states that are not seen are not objects to be abandoned.

original: ma mthong ba zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag go zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa'i khams gsum po de nyid de /
analyzed: ma mthong ba zag pa med pa rnams ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dag go zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa'i khams gsum po de nyid de /
translated: The three realms are included in the truth of the path and unconditioned states.

original: nyes pa med pa ni spang bar mi 'os la /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa ni spang bar mi 'os la /
translated: It is not suitable to abandon that which is free of error.

original: chos zag pa med pa rnams kyang nyes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos zag pa med pa rnams kyang nyes pa med pa yin no //
translated: Uncontaminated states are free of error.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩkha cig na re gang gi phyir so so'i skye @83a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩkha cig na re gang gi phyir so so'i skye @83a * //
translated: The nature of ordinary beings and so on.üîΩSome say: Because ordinary beings are not suitable to abandon the nature of ordinary beings, it is not an object to be abandoned.

original: bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: and the body and speech karma of beings of lower rebirths are objects abandoned by the path of seeing, like the afflicted view of the self and the extreme view, because they are incompatible with the arya path.

original: 'di ltar lam gyi skad cig dang por skyes pa na so so'i skye bo nyid dang mi ldan pa 'thob pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa log par mi ltung ba'i chos can no zhes kyang bshad na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam gyi skad cig dang por skyes pa na so so'i skye bo nyid dang mi ldan pa 'thob pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa log par mi ltung ba'i chos can no zhes kyang bshad na /
translated: Thus, when one is born in the first moment of the path, one obtains the state of an ordinary being and it is explained that one is a stream enterer who will not fall back.

original: ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las ma spangs par ni ngan song zad par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las ma spangs par ni ngan song zad par yang mi rigs so //
translated: But it is illogical that the stream enterer would not abandon the body and speech karma of beings of lower rebirths and that he would not exhaust lower rebirth.

original: de'i phyir phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / de dag dang lhan cig pa'i 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu nyung bar brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / de dag dang lhan cig pa'i 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu nyung bar brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the statement that the eighty eight negative tendencies and the primary elements that are simultaneous with them and so on are extremely few is excellent.
