original: 'di la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: The reply to that is as follows.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The state of being an ordinary person, the bodies of those in the lower rebirths, and their verbal actions are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIn brief, this is the meaning.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs can min mthong yang min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong yang min //
translated: They are not afflicted, nor are they seen.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni so so'i skye bo nyid spang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni so so'i skye bo nyid spang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the state of being an ordinary person is not something to be abandoned.

original: gzugs min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang ngan song ba'i lus dang / dag gi las mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston to //üîΩdrug pa min skyes min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang /
analyzed: gzugs min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang ngan song ba'i lus dang / dag gi las mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston to // drug pa min skyes min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang /
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúThey are not form‚Äù shows that even though they are afflicted, the bodies of those in the lower rebirths and their verbal actions are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThe phrase ‚ÄúThey are not of the sixth‚Äù shows that even though they are afflicted, they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThe phrase ‚ÄúThey are not born‚Äù shows that even though they are afflicted, they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúThey are not of the sixth‚Äù shows that even though they are afflicted, they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gal te / bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin no //üîΩlnga yang zhes bshad na /
analyzed: gal te / bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin no // lnga yang zhes bshad na /
translated: If it is explained that ‚ÄúTen are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation,‚ÄùüîΩthen why is it said that ‚ÄúFive are also‚Äù?

original: yang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
analyzed: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
translated: The six nonindicative states are not derived from the four great elements.

original: zhes brjod ce na /üîΩnges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes brjod ce na / nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that, then it is said:

original: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //üîΩzhes bshad pa der nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo // zhes bshad pa der nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The last three are of three types.üîΩThis passage is for the purpose of ascertaining that nonindicative form is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can yin yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Although it is afflicted, nonindicative form is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can yin yang tshor ba la sogs pa drug pa las skyes pa ma yin pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes nges bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin yang tshor ba la sogs pa drug pa las skyes pa ma yin pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes nges bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Although it is afflicted, the six such as feeling that are not derived from the fourth absorption are not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la /
translated: There is not the slightest nonindicative form that is abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzugs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is form abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: so @83b so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: so @83b so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The state of an ordinary being is nonindicative form that is unafflicted and neutral.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩmi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa de nyon mongs pa can ma yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba log par rtogs pa la de rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba'i don to // mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa gang yin pa de nyon mongs pa can ma yin par mi rigs so zhes bya ba log par rtogs pa la de rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is: it is not obscured and it is indeterminate.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is not afflicted, since it is the basis of all unwholesome dharmas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to refute that misconception, he says: ‚ÄúThe root of the wholesome that is severed,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te de dge ba yin par 'gyur na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams so so'i skye bo ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de dge ba yin par 'gyur na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams so so'i skye bo ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were wholesome, then those who have severed the wholesome roots would not be ordinary beings.

original: dge ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang chad pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyid du 'gyur na de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang chad pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyid du 'gyur na de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And because it is wholesome, and because it is severed, it would be the state of an ƒÅrya. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not wholesome.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can smras pa ni mi dge pa la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can smras pa ni mi dge pa la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Afflicted is stated as unwholesome.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: mi dge ba yang ma yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang ma yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not nonvirtuous, because those who are free from attachment also possess it.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so so'i skye bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so so'i skye bo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who are free from worldly attachment possess the nature of being ordinary beings.

original: mi dge ba yin na ni sa de pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ltar de'i rang bzhin spang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi dge ba yin na ni sa de pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ltar de'i rang bzhin spang bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were nonvirtuous, then just as the afflictions of that level are abandoned, its nature would be abandoned.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi rang bzhin ni spangs par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi rang bzhin ni spangs par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not asserted that the nature of being an ordinary being is abandoned.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa 'dod chags spangs pas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa 'dod chags spangs pas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is abandoned by abandoning the desire that focuses on it, that is, by abandoning attachment.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: Being an ordinary being is not an afflicted state.

original: de lta bas na mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin na gzugs ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin na gzugs ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang rung ste /
translated: The actions of body and speech are form. Form is either afflicted or not afflicted.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest form that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bden pa dag la sogs par mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dag la sogs par mi rtogs pa'i phyir dang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not realize the truths, etc., and because that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is motivated by the mental afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa na so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: And because it would follow that one would be an ordinary being when one has perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas de spong na ni bzod pa skyes pa na yang des spang bar bya ba rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa yang so so'i skye bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas de spong na ni bzod pa skyes pa na yang des spang bar bya ba rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa yang so so'i skye bor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one abandons that by means of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, then when perseverance has arisen, one would possess that which is to be abandoned by perseverance and therefore even an ƒÅrya would be an ordinary being.

original: gal te khyod kyi ltar na yang so so'i skye bo nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i @84a * //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi ltar na yang so so'i skye bo nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i @84a * //
translated: If you say that even according to you, ordinary being is to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: phyir slob pa dang yang ldan pas nyes pa shin tu chen por 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: phyir slob pa dang yang ldan pas nyes pa shin tu chen por 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then is it not the case that there is a very great error because one in training would possess it?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nyid dang lhan cig tu de'i thob pa gcod phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nyid dang lhan cig tu de'i thob pa gcod phyir ro //
translated: because the possession of the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness is cut off.

original: 'o na ji ltar ma spangs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ma spangs she na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness is not abandoned?

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the defilements that have it as their object are not abandoned.

original: sngar ni de nyams pa nyid yin gyi spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni de nyams pa nyid yin gyi spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Previously, it was only damaged, but it was not abandoned.

original: yang bral ba dang spangs pa dag gi khyad par ni zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang bral ba dang spangs pa dag gi khyad par ni zhig ce na /
translated: What is the difference between being separated and being abandoned?

original: cung zad cig dang bral ba ni bral ba yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig dang bral ba ni bral ba yin te /
translated: Being separated is being separated from a small part.

original: cung zad za ba bzhin no //
analyzed: cung zad za ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like saying one eats a little.

original: rab tu bral ba ni spangs pa ste /üîΩbral ba la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye la /
analyzed: rab tu bral ba ni spangs pa ste / bral ba la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams skye la /
translated: Being abandoned is being completely separated.

original: dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa srid pa ni med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa srid pa ni med do //
translated: The defilements that have it as their object do not arise, but it is not the case that it is not their object.

original: gal te spangs pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye na'o na ni dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i /
analyzed: gal te spangs pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skye na'o na ni dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i /
translated: If the defilements that have the abandoned as their object do not arise, then why does the Abhidharma say:

original: yul can dri ma rnams kyi ldan //üîΩzhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: yul can dri ma rnams kyi ldan //üîΩzhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúOne is endowed with the stains that have the first type as their object.‚Äù

original: tshul de ni nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: tshul de ni nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: This mode is afflicted.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i /
translated: The state of being an ordinary being is not afflicted,

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: but is neutral. Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: drug pa las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: drug pa las skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not produced by the sixth,

original: drug pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi skye mched do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drug pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi skye mched do zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the sixth is the mental faculty.

original: drug pa las skyed pa ni drug pa skyes te /
analyzed: drug pa las skyed pa ni drug pa skyes te /
translated: That which is produced by the sixth is produced by the sixth,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: which is mental consciousness.

original: drug pa las skyes pa ma yin par ni drug pa min skyes te /
analyzed: drug pa las skyes pa ma yin par ni drug pa min skyes te /
translated: That which is not produced by the sixth is not produced by the sixth,

original: dbang po lnga las skyes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga las skyes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: which is that produced by the five sense faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: de las gzhan las skyes pa ni drug pa las ma skyes pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las gzhan las skyes pa ni drug pa las ma skyes pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is produced from another than that is not produced by the sixth,‚Äù

original: de yang kha phyir bltas par zhugs pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang kha phyir bltas par zhugs pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: because it is not abandoned by the path of seeing, since it is directed outward.

original: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni //
analyzed: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni //
translated: The part of the eye element and the part of the phenomena element

original: lta ba yin te zhes 'byung ste //
analyzed: lta ba yin te zhes 'byung ste //
translated: that are view are the view of the transitory collection.

original: de la chos thams cad kyi nang nas lta ba'i rang bzhin ni chos gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi nang nas lta ba'i rang bzhin ni chos gnyis yin te /
translated: Among all the dharmas, the nature of the view is twofold.

original: gzugs can rnams las ni mig gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams las ni mig gi dbang po'o //
translated: Among the material dharmas, it is the eye sense-faculty.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams las ni shes bya rtogs par sems pa rgyu ba gsal ba can gyi shes rab kha nang du bltas par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams las ni shes bya rtogs par sems pa rgyu ba gsal ba can gyi shes rab kha nang du bltas par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Among the non-material dharmas, it is the wisdom which is the inner mental attitude of the person who is intent on understanding the object of knowledge.

original: de la re zhig mig gi mtshan nyid ni //üîΩde dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
analyzed: de la re zhig mig gi mtshan nyid ni // de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten //
translated: The eye sense-faculty is the particular inherent characteristic of the eye.üîΩThe eye sense-faculty is the basis of the visual consciousness.

original: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
analyzed: mig la sogs gzugs dang ba rnams //
translated: The eye sense-faculty is the clear form which is the basis of the visual consciousness.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: gal te yang dag pa'i lta ba smos pas 'di dag gsum char yang bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa'i lta ba smos pas 'di dag gsum char yang bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But, if the right view is mentioned, would not all three be indicated?

original: de lta yin mod @84b kyi ;
analyzed: de lta yin mod @84b kyi ;
translated: This is true, but

original: so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i sa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i sa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du dbye bar bya'o //
translated: the threefold division is made in order to indicate the stage of ordinary man, the stage of the person in training, and the stage of the person beyond training, and in order to indicate the order of arising.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du phra rgyas kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas bstan par ston pa'i dus la bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du phra rgyas kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas bstan par ston pa'i dus la bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The views of the perishable composite, etc. are like attachment, etc. and are by nature propensities. Therefore, the time has come to teach the propensities.

original: ji skad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad ce na /
translated: How so?

original: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs par ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // zhes bya ba la sogs par ro //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúself, mine, permanence, annihilation,

original: lta ba gsum po dag gi rang gi ngo bor ni gzhan du ston pa'i skabs med pas 'di nyid du de dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: lta ba gsum po dag gi rang gi ngo bor ni gzhan du ston pa'i skabs med pas 'di nyid du de dag gi rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: Since there is no other occasion to teach the nature of the three views, their nature is taught here.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since there is wisdom that is concomitant with eye consciousness, etc., and that is nonvirtuous, indeterminate, and uncontaminated,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes khyad par rnam pa gsum brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes khyad par rnam pa gsum brjod do //
translated: the root text states, ‚Äúvirtuous wisdom concomitant with mental consciousness and associated with the contaminants.‚Äù Thus, three aspects are mentioned.

original: slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni slob pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni slob pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The wisdom of learners that is uncontaminated is the view of learners.

original: slob pa smos pa ni mi slob pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa smos pa ni mi slob pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of learners is to distinguish it from the view of nonlearners.

original: zag pa med pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of uncontaminated is to distinguish it from contaminated.

original: mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o //üîΩsprin dang bcas pa dang / sprin med pa'i mtshan mo dang / nyin mo'i gzugs la lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o // sprin dang bcas pa dang / sprin med pa'i mtshan mo dang / nyin mo'i gzugs la lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The wisdom of nonlearners that is uncontaminated is the view of nonlearners.üîΩJust as one sees forms at night with and without cloudsüîΩand during the day, so too one sees phenomena.üîΩJust as one sees forms at night with and without clouds and during the day, so too one sees phenomena.üîΩJust as one sees forms at night with and without clouds and during the day, so too one sees phenomena.üîΩJust as one sees forms at night with and without clouds and during the day, so too one sees phenomena.

original: de la snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir mun pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mtshan mo sgang gshong spel ma dag la phyin ci log tu lta ba de bzhin du /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag gis chos la lta'o //
analyzed: de la snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir mun pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mtshan mo sgang gshong spel ma dag la phyin ci log tu lta ba de bzhin du / 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag gis chos la lta'o //
translated: Just as one sees forms at night with and without clouds and during the day, so too one sees phenomena.üîΩJust as one sees forms at night with and without clouds and during the day, so too one sees phenomena.

original: 'jig rten gyi lta bas ni 'gro ba rtag tu mtshan mor gyur par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lta bas ni 'gro ba rtag tu mtshan mor gyur par mthong ste /
translated: Just as one sees forms at night with and without clouds and during the day, so too one sees phenomena.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the light of uncontaminated wisdom is absent.

original: de la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi dra bas g-yogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyi dra bas g-yogs pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, because it is covered by the net of the condition of ignorance,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs na 'gro ba sprin dang bcas pa'i mtshan mo dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs na 'gro ba sprin dang bcas pa'i mtshan mo dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: the occasion of the practice of all afflicted phenomena is like a night with clouds.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod par mi mthong bar rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod par mi mthong bar rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin pa rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the nature of impermanence, emptiness, selflessness, and so on is not seen, and the nature of permanence, and so on, which does not exist, is imagined.

original: de nas 'jig rten pa'i @85a * //
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten pa'i @85a * //
translated: Then, by means of the correct view of the world,

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas lta ba chos yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas lta ba chos yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: the view of phenomena becomes completely pure.

original: sprin dang bral bas zla ba'i 'od kyis mun pa bcom pa'i mtshan mo'i gzugs dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sprin dang bral bas zla ba'i 'od kyis mun pa bcom pa'i mtshan mo'i gzugs dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the form of night that is perceived when the light of the moon destroys the darkness with the absence of clouds.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lta bas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dag gis ni de ltar chos la blta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lta bas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dag gis ni de ltar chos la blta ste /
translated: The view of the world should be seen in that way by those who are not afflicted.

original: sprin gyi dra ba lta bu'i gti mug med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin gyi dra ba lta bu'i gti mug med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from the net of the cloud of ignorance.

original: mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor lta ba yod mod kyi yongs su gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor lta ba yod mod kyi yongs su gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Although they see the nature of things as impermanent, empty, nonself, etc., they do not see it clearly.

original: de nas slob pa'i lta ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor sprin gyis g-yogs pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de nas slob pa'i lta ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor sprin gyis g-yogs pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin te /
translated: The view of the trainee is like the seeing of forms on a cloudy day when the sun is covered by clouds.

original: slob pa'i lta ba dag gis ni de ltar chos la lta'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i lta ba dag gis ni de ltar chos la lta'o //
translated: The trainees see things in this way.

original: slob pa la ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba mngon du gyur pa'i phyir 'gro ba nyin mo lta bur gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: slob pa la ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba mngon du gyur pa'i phyir 'gro ba nyin mo lta bur gyur pa yin te /
translated: For the trainee, the light of uncontaminated wisdom is manifest, so the world is like a day for them.

original: ma rig pa'i sprin gyi dra ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ni sprin dang bcas pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sprin gyi dra ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ni sprin dang bcas pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: But because they have a remainder of the cloud of ignorance, they are like a cloudy day.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mun pa bsal ba'i nyin mo gzugs dmigs pa ltar mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos la lta ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mun pa bsal ba'i nyin mo gzugs dmigs pa ltar mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos la lta ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as on a day when the sun's rays dispel darkness, one sees forms, so the view of things by the view of the non-trainee is also like that.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are completely free from the net of clouds of afflicted ignorance.

original: de'i phyir mi slob pas ni chos la gsal bar lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi slob pas ni chos la gsal bar lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the nonlearner clearly sees phenomena.

original: 'o na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs pa phul du byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs pa phul du byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: But how can it be said that the vision of the Bhagavat Buddhas is superior?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir la /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas are completely free from the net of clouds of nonafflicted ignorance,

original: dgra bcom pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khyad par ro //
translated: but arhats are not. This is the difference.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams ji lta ji ltar shes rab goms pa'i sgo nas snying gi mun pa spong ba de lta de ltar dmigs pa rnam par dag par khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams ji lta ji ltar shes rab goms pa'i sgo nas snying gi mun pa spong ba de lta de ltar dmigs pa rnam par dag par khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: The yogis and yoginis eliminate the darkness of the heart through the practice of wisdom, and in that way, their object becomes increasingly pure.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang med kyi /
translated: Thus, there is no object that is either pure or impure.

original: rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni blo dri ma dang bcas pas dri ma can du byas pa dang / dag pas dag par byas par nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni blo dri ma dang bcas pas dri ma can du byas pa dang / dag pas dag par byas par nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthat which is pure becomes pure‚Äù means that the mind, when it is stained, is determined to be stained by the stain, and when it is pure, it is determined to be pure by purity.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summary meaning of this is as follows:

original: lta ba rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The views are of five types:

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / slob pa dang / @85b mi slob pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / slob pa dang / @85b mi slob pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: those that are neutral, those that are afflicted, those that are virtuous and impure, those that are learner‚Äôs, and those that are nonlearner‚Äôs.

original: de la lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs pas ni mi lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs pas ni mi lta ba yin gyi /
translated: Among them, the neutral type is not a view because it is neutral.

original: rna ba la sogs pa dang / shes rab ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa dang / shes rab ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: However, all the unobscured neutral wisdoms of the ear and so on are not.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi rigs las ni lta ba lnga po de dag las gzhan pa'i shes rab lta ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi rigs las ni lta ba lnga po de dag las gzhan pa'i shes rab lta ba ma yin te ;
translated: The afflicted type is not a view other than the five views.

original: de yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom la sogs pa dang lhan cig skye ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom la sogs pa dang lhan cig skye ba'o //
translated: It is also associated with attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, doubt, etc.

original: slob pa'i rigs las ni lta ba ma yin pa'i shes rab 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: slob pa'i rigs las ni lta ba ma yin pa'i shes rab 'ga' yang med do //
translated: In the family of the trainee, there is no wisdom that is not view.

original: mi slob pa'i rigs las ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas lta ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rigs las ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pas lta ba ma yin no ;
translated: In the family of the non-trainee, there is no view by the knowledge of elimination and non-arising.

original: / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rigs las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin gyi /üîΩrnam par gyi /
analyzed: / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rigs las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin gyi / rnam par gyi /
translated: In the family of wholesome with-outflows, it is only associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩIt is not associated with the five consciousnesses.

original: rnam par nga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par nga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with the five consciousnesses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúWhy is it only associated with the mental consciousness?‚Äù

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du khyad par med kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la bya'i /
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du khyad par med kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la bya'i /
translated: Although there is no distinction in being wholesome with-outflows, it should be understood as only associated with the mental consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: It is not concomitant with the five consciousnesses.

original: rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
analyzed: rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
translated: The mind that arises simultaneously with the five consciousnesses

original: nges rtog med phyir lta ma yin //
analyzed: nges rtog med phyir lta ma yin //
translated: is not view because it does not have definite conception.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharmakosa:

original: rtog par byed pa ni lta ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog par byed pa ni lta ba yin te /
translated: View is that which analyzes.

original: nges par sems pa las zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par sems pa las zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it engages its object through definite conception.

original: nges par rtog pa ni yul nges par sems pa sngon du 'gro ba can nges par 'dren par byed pa can yin na rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa ni yul nges par sems pa sngon du 'gro ba can nges par 'dren par byed pa can yin na rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
translated: If definite conception is that which definitely induces ascertainment, then wisdom that arises simultaneously with the five consciousnesses is not like that.

original: ji ltar nges par sems pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab rtog par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i shes rab gzhan la rtog pa la sems par ma zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar nges par sems pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab rtog par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i shes rab gzhan la rtog pa la sems par ma zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as wisdom concomitant with eye consciousness and so on is not investigation because it does not engage in definite investigation, so too other afflicted and unafflicted wisdom is not investigation because it does not engage in investigation and analysis.

original: rtog par byed pa ma yin pas lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog par byed pa ma yin pas lta ba ma yin te /
translated: Since it does not investigate, it is not view.

original: de yang gong kho nar rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang gong kho nar rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been extensively explained above.

original: gal te rtog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes rab lta ba yin na ni 'o na ni mig kyang rtog par byed pa nyid med na ji ltar lta ba yin zhe na /üîΩgzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te zhes bya ba la /üîΩmig ni gzugs la lta ba'i @86a * //
analyzed: gal te rtog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes rab lta ba yin na ni 'o na ni mig kyang rtog par byed pa nyid med na ji ltar lta ba yin zhe na / gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te zhes bya ba la / mig ni gzugs la lta ba'i @86a * //
translated: If wisdom is view because it investigates, then how is the eye view since it does not investigate?üîΩIt is said:üîΩThe eye is called view because it sees form.

original: don gyis lta ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: don gyis lta ba zhes brjod de /
translated: It is called view because it sees form,

original: nges par rtog par byed pa'i don gyis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: nges par rtog par byed pa'i don gyis ni ma yin la /
translated: but it is not called view because it definitely investigates.

original: shes rab ni nges par rtog par byed pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab ni nges par rtog par byed pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
translated: Wisdom is so called because it is the cause of definite understanding.

original: lta ba'i don gyis ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: lta ba'i don gyis ni ma yin pas /
translated: It is not so called because it is seeing.

original: gnyis ka yang lta ba nyid yin par 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang lta ba nyid yin par 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in both being seeing.

original: gang gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the statement, ‚ÄúThe eye sees visible form,‚Äù

original: gzugs mthong ba ni gzugs la lta ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba ni gzugs la lta ba yin te /
translated: seeing visible form is seeing visible form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis mig la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis mig la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye is called seeing because it is the cause of seeing visible form.üîΩIf the eye sees, then one would see even with another consciousness.

original: gal te mig gis mthong bar 'gyur na rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gzhan mngon du gyur pas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te mig gis mthong bar 'gyur na rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gzhan mngon du gyur pas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the eye sees, then one would see even with another consciousness present.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs par rang gi rnam par shes pa la ltos pa med pa rnams la yang nyan pa la sogs pa yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / yul thams cad cig car dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhen ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs par rang gi rnam par shes pa la ltos pa med pa rnams la yang nyan pa la sogs pa yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / yul thams cad cig car dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhen ;
translated: In the same way, one would also hear with the ear and so on, because one would accept that hearing and so on exist without relying on their own consciousnesses, and it would follow that all objects would be apprehended simultaneously.

original: mig thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mig thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Not all eyes see,

original: mig 'ga' zhig kho nas lta bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig 'ga' zhig kho nas lta bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that some eyes see and some do not.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa'o //
translated: When it is said that consciousness is the support of the eyes, it means that consciousness is the support of the eyes.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ni cig car dbang po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin pas yul thams cad cig car dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta na 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ni cig car dbang po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin pas yul thams cad cig car dmigs par yang mi 'gyur ro // de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Since consciousnesses do not simultaneously abide in the sense faculties, all objects are not simultaneously apprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa kho na lta ba la nus pa dang ldan par snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde la brten pa'i rnam shes min //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na lta ba la nus pa dang ldan par snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na / de la brten pa'i rnam shes min //
translated: If that is so, then since consciousness alone appears to be capable of seeing, it is consciousness itself that sees.üîΩThe eyes are not the consciousness that depends on them.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la brten pa'i 'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la brten pa'i 'o //
translated: The eyes are not the consciousness that depends on them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / gang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
translated: Therefore it says:

original: gzugs ni mthong ba'i min phyir lo //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzugs ni mthong ba'i min phyir lo //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because obstructed forms are not seen.

original: lo'i sgra ni rgyu 'dis ni rnam par shes pa mthong ba 'gog par nus pa ma yin no zhes mi 'dod par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni rgyu 'dis ni rnam par shes pa mthong ba 'gog par nus pa ma yin no zhes mi 'dod par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The suffix ‚Äúta‚Äù in ‚Äúdar≈õana‚Äù is used to indicate that it is not accepted that consciousness is able to stop seeing.

original: slob dpon 'dus ba zang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus ba zang na re /
translated: The master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not seeing.

original: rigs pa dang lung med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung med pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical and unstated in scripture, and because it contradicts the world.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu med par rigs pa med do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu med par rigs pa med do //
translated: It is illogical to posit that eye consciousness sees without a cause.

original: gang zhig thos pa las mig gi rnam par @86b shes pa mthong ngo zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur ba lung yang 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig thos pa las mig gi rnam par @86b shes pa mthong ngo zhes bya bar rtog par 'gyur ba lung yang 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no scripture at all that states that eye consciousness sees.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mig kho na mthong ba'i sgras de dang der gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mig kho na mthong ba'i sgras de dang der gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn stated in various places that the eye sees.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: It also contradicts the world to say that eye consciousness sees.

original: mig med na long ba zhes smra'i mig gi rnam par shes pa med na ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mig med na long ba zhes smra'i mig gi rnam par shes pa med na ni ma yin la /
translated: If the eye sense faculty does not exist, one is said to be blind, but if the eye consciousness does not exist, one is not said to be blind.

original: gang zhig mig dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba de la ni long ba zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig mig dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba de la ni long ba zhes brjod kyi /
translated: One who does not possess eyes is said to be blind,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but one who does not possess eye consciousness is not said to be blind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du gyur pa med pa ni mig dang mi ldan pa las long bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du gyur pa med pa ni mig dang mi ldan pa las long bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Those born in the second absorption and so on do not possess eye consciousness, but they are not blind.

original: mig dang mi ldan pa'i long ba thams cad kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang bral bar mi rigs so zhes zer te /
analyzed: mig dang mi ldan pa'i long ba thams cad kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang bral bar mi rigs so zhes zer te /
translated: It is illogical that all blind people who do not possess eyes are devoid of eye consciousness and therefore do not see.üîΩThis digression is sufficient.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog gi skabs su bab pa nyid brtsam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog gi skabs su bab pa nyid brtsam par bya ba'o //
translated: Now I will discuss the topic at hand.

original: 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig yin gyi /
translated: This is merely a partial presentation.

original: gzhung mangs pa 'jigs pas rnam par dpyad pa rgyas par ni ma byas te /
analyzed: gzhung mangs pa 'jigs pas rnam par dpyad pa rgyas par ni ma byas te /
translated: Fearing excessive length, I have not analyzed this in detail.

original: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya'o //
translated: I will now discuss the main point.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong bar 'gyur na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong bar 'gyur na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: If consciousness sees, then form that is obstructed would be seen, because consciousness is unimpeded by walls and so on.üîΩIf consciousness sees, then form obstructed by walls and so on would be seen, because consciousness is unimpeded by walls and so on, like the sense faculty of sight.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na rtsig pa la sogs pa dag la thogs pa med pa'i phyir mchod pa ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong bar gyur pa na chod pa ni mthong bas yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na rtsig pa la sogs pa dag la thogs pa med pa'i phyir mchod pa ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong bar gyur pa na chod pa ni mthong bas yang ma yin te /
translated: But form that is obstructed is not seen.

original: de'i phyir gang gis na chod pa mi mthong bar 'gyur ba lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin par rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis na chod pa mi mthong bar 'gyur ba lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin par rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no other cause for not seeing obstructed form, apart from the fact that consciousness is not by nature sight.

original: de lta na gzugs chod pa mi mthong ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa lta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na gzugs chod pa mi mthong ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa lta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin la /
translated: Thus, because form that is obstructed is not seen, consciousness is not by nature sight.

original: lta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir na ma chod pa yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: lta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir na ma chod pa yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: And because it is not by nature sight, it does not see even that which is not obstructed.

original: mig ni lta ba'i bdag nyid yin yang bar du chod pa la thogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ba dang / thogs pa med pas bar du mchod par mthong bar 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mig ni lta ba'i bdag nyid yin yang bar du chod pa la thogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ba dang / thogs pa med pas bar du mchod par mthong bar 'gal ba med do //
translated: The eye has the nature of seeing, but it is obstructed by the obstruction of form, and it does not see obstructed form. It is not contradictory that it sees unobstructed form because it is unobstructed.

original: bsgribs pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsgribs pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Obstructed form is not seen because eye consciousness does not arise.

original: lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir bsgribs pa mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not seen because it does not have the nature of seeing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir mi mthong ba'o //
translated: It is not seen because it does not arise.

original: ci ste mi skye zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci ste mi skye zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Why does it not arise?

original: rnam par shes pa @87a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa @87a * //
translated: Consciousness

original: kho na yul la byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kho na yul la byed pa yin gyi /
translated: is the agent that engages objects,

original: mig ma yin te /
analyzed: mig ma yin te /
translated: but the eye is not.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa kho na la byed pa yin la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa kho na la byed pa yin la /
translated: Eye consciousness is the agent that engages objects,

original: mig yang thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mig yang thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: but the eye is unobstructed.

original: de'i phyir yul dang dbang po yod na rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir mi skye /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dang dbang po yod na rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir mi skye /
translated: Therefore, if the object and sense faculty exist, why does consciousness not arise?

original: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong zhing rnam par shes pas shes pa de ltar na ni rnam par shes pa rten mig dang lhan cig tu yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong zhing rnam par shes pas shes pa de ltar na ni rnam par shes pa rten mig dang lhan cig tu yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: If one says that the eye sees and consciousness cognizes, then consciousness would engage the same object simultaneously with the eye sense faculty.

original: gzugs gang zhig mig gis mthong ba de nyid rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so //
analyzed: gzugs gang zhig mig gis mthong ba de nyid rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so //
translated: Thus, the form that the eye sees is the form that consciousness cognizes.

original: de'i phyir rten dang lhan cig yul la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten dang lhan cig yul la 'jug cing /
translated: Therefore, it is suitable that consciousness does not arise when the object is obstructed because the eye engages the object simultaneously with its support and because the eye is impeded.

original: mig kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir chod pa'i gzugs la 'jug pa med pa dang mthong ba med de /
analyzed: mig kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir chod pa'i gzugs la 'jug pa med pa dang mthong ba med de /
translated: The eye does not engage or see obstructed form because it is impeded.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang mi skye bar rung ngo //üîΩmig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yang mi skye bar rung ngo // mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is suitable that consciousness does not arise.üîΩThe eye does not see form that is obstructed by walls and so on, like the body sense faculty does.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang reg bya ltar yul dang phrad pa yin na ni chod pa mi mthong bar 'grub pa zhig go //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang reg bya ltar yul dang phrad pa yin na ni chod pa mi mthong bar 'grub pa zhig go //
translated: If the eye were to contact its object like the body sense faculty and tactile objects, then it would be established that it does not see obstructed form.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bar chod kyis bar du bcad pa'i yul dang ma phrad pa'i phyir mi reg go zhes bya bar ni rigs na mig gi dbang po ni yid ltar ma phrad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir bar du gcod pas cung zad kyang byed
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bar chod kyis bar du bcad pa'i yul dang ma phrad pa'i phyir mi reg go zhes bya bar ni rigs na mig gi dbang po ni yid ltar ma phrad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir bar du gcod pas cung zad kyang byed
translated: It is logical to say that the eyes do not see objects that are obstructed because they are obstructed and do not contact their object, but the eye organ does not obstruct its object in the slightest, since it is not a possessor of an object that does not contact its object like the mental faculty.

original: pa ma yin pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs kyang ci ste mi mthong /
analyzed: pa ma yin pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs kyang ci ste mi mthong /
translated: Therefore why does it not see obstructed form?

original: mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang ; shel dang / chu dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang ; shel dang / chu dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is like seeing through glass, a crystal, water and so on.

original: gal te mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po bzhin rang gi yul gcig pa la sogs pas chod pa la mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po bzhin rang gi yul gcig pa la sogs pas chod pa la mi 'jug na /
translated: If the eyes do not engage their object due to being obstructed by the same object and so on, like the body sense faculty because they possess obstruction,

original: mching bu dang lhang tsher la sogs pa dag gis chod pa la yang de kho na ltar mi 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mching bu dang lhang tsher la sogs pa dag gis chod pa la yang de kho na ltar mi 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then they would not engage their object in the same way when obstructed by glass, a crystal and so on.

original: mching bu la sogs pa dag gis bar du chod pa ni mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: mching bu la sogs pa dag gis bar du chod pa ni mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: But they do see form obstructed by glass and so on.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, obstruction is not the cause.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gang la snang ba la gegs med na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang la snang ba la gegs med na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwhere there is no obstruction to the appearance of form.‚Äù

original: mig gi snang ba'i lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir lhang tsher la sogs pa gang la snang ba la /üîΩgegs med na /
analyzed: mig gi snang ba'i lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir lhang tsher la sogs pa gang la snang ba la / gegs med na /
translated: Because the eye is the cooperative condition for the appearance of form, where there is no obstruction to the appearance of form,üîΩeven though form is obscured by a wall, for example, visual consciousness arises.

original: des gzugs bsgribs bzhin du yang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin pas des chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong la /
analyzed: des gzugs bsgribs bzhin du yang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin pas des chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong la /
translated: Therefore, one sees form that is obscured by that.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa gang du gegs yod na ni des chod pa'i gzugs la mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa gang du gegs yod na ni des chod pa'i gzugs la mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
translated: But where there is an obstruction, such as a wall, visual consciousness does not arise in regard to form that is obscured by that,

original: @87b lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @87b lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cooperative cause is absent.

original: de bas na mi skye ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa dag gis bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na mi skye ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa dag gis bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, one does not see form that is obscured by a wall, etc., because it does not arise.

original: 'o na gang mdo las zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal bar ston to //
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las zhes bya ba ni lung dang 'gal bar ston to //
translated: Now, if you maintain that the statement in the sutra is contradictory,

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na ni 'di skad du /
translated: If consciousness sees, then it should be said thatüîΩthe eye consciousness sees visible forms.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya bar gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya bar gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But it is said:

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur /üîΩmngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de skad du rgya cher gsungs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur / mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de skad du rgya cher gsungs pa yang yin te /
translated: The eye does not see visible forms,üîΩthe ear does not hear sounds.

original: de'i phyir mig kho nas mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig kho nas mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore it is certain that the eye sees, not the consciousness.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: lung ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the scriptures are interpretable in meaning.

original: yang 'dir dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /üîΩ'dir dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang 'dir dgongs pa gang yin zhe na / 'dir dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the intention behind the scriptures?üîΩThe intention is that the eye sees visible forms in dependence on consciousness.

original: mig la brten nas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la brten nas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the eye consciousness sees visible forms in dependence on the eye.

original: ji ltar de la brten nas rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar de la brten nas rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It is said that consciousness is based on it.üîΩ

original: mig kho nas ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mig kho nas ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it understood that consciousness is based on the eye, but not that consciousness is based on the eye itself?

original: de'i phyir / dper na yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩmdo de nyid las yid kyis chos rnams shes par byas nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dper na yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes bya ba smos te / mdo de nyid las yid kyis chos rnams shes par byas nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúFor example, it is said that the mind cognizes phenomena.‚Äù

original: mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //üîΩyid ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir chos rnams rnam par mi shes so zhes bya ba la 'das pa ni byed pa zhig pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so // yid ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir chos rnams rnam par mi shes so zhes bya ba la 'das pa ni byed pa zhig pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The same s≈´tra states, ‚ÄúHaving cognized phenomena with the mind, one does not grasp them as signs and does not grasp them as symbols.‚ÄùüîΩThe mind does not cognize phenomena because it is past.

original: brjod du med pa'i phyir ram yid kyis chos rnam par mi shes so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i phyir ram yid kyis chos rnam par mi shes so //
translated: The mind does not cognize phenomena because it is past, because it is destroyed, because it is inexpressible, or because it is the object of the mind consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩda ltar ba yin pa'i phyir ;üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes bas yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir ; yid kyi rnam par shes bas yin te /
translated: What is it then?üîΩIt is the present mind consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de la brten nas zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la brten nas zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the mind consciousness is based on the eye.

original: gal te der yid kyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i yid kyi sgras yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams gsungs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te der yid kyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i yid kyi sgras yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams gsungs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the mental faculty is the characteristic of mind, then wouldn‚Äôt the term ‚Äúmind‚Äù refer to the mental consciousness?

original: mig la sogs pa'i skabs yin pas na ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skabs yin pas na ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud de /
translated: No, because the context is the eye faculty, etc.,

original: gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten yin pa de bzhin du yid kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten yin pa de bzhin du yid kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the mental faculty is the basis of the mental consciousness, just as the eye faculty, etc., are the basis of visual consciousness, and so on.

original: yang na brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, the function of the supported is figuratively designated as the support.

original: brten pa mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i @88a * //
analyzed: brten pa mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i @88a * //
translated: The function of the supported visual consciousness

original: las gzugs mthong ba de'i rten mig dag la nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: las gzugs mthong ba de'i rten mig dag la nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: is seeing form, and that is figuratively designated as the eye faculty, which is its support.

original: de nyid la dpe ni /
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni /
translated: An example of this is

original: dper na khre'u dga' bod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na khre'u dga' bod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cowherd is happy.‚Äù

original: brten pa'i las 'bod pa de'i rten la nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brten pa'i las 'bod pa de'i rten la nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The function of the supported is figuratively designated as the support.

original: ji ltar mdo las mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la /üîΩrnam par shes pa ni de'i brten pa rnam par shes pa'i las yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la / rnam par shes pa ni de'i brten pa rnam par shes pa'i las yin gyi /
translated: For example, in the sutra it says, ‚Äúthat which is to be known by eye consciousness.‚Äù

original: mig gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is the action of the eye faculty, not the eye.

original: de bzhin du mdo las kyang brten pa'i las rten la brjod do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo las kyang brten pa'i las rten la brjod do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: In the same way, the sutra teaches that the action of the faculty is described as belonging to the faculty.

original: de nyid la lung gzhan smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la lung gzhan smras pa ni /
translated: The other scriptural passage that he cites is:

original: mdo las bram ze zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las bram ze zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBrahmin, the eye is the basis of eye consciousness and the objects of eye consciousness are the objects of eye consciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te mig gi sa mthong na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo nyid du nges par gsungs /
analyzed: gal te mig gi sa mthong na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo nyid du nges par gsungs /
translated: If the eye sees, why did the Lord say that the eye is the basis of eye consciousness?

original: sgo nas ni gzhan gyis mthong ba yin gyi sgos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgo nas ni gzhan gyis mthong ba yin gyi sgos ni ma yin te /
translated: The eye is the basis of eye consciousness, but the eye does not see because others see through the eye.

original: de'i phyir mig gi sgo nas rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi sgo nas rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the eye sees by means of eye consciousness.

original: der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that passage, seeing is the door.

original: mdo der ni lta ba gang yin pa de mig gi las yin zhing lta ba de la sgo zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo der ni lta ba gang yin pa de mig gi las yin zhing lta ba de la sgo zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: In that sutra, seeing is the action of the eye and that seeing is called the door of the eye.

original: de'i phyir mig nyid kyis mthong gi / rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig nyid kyis mthong gi / rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye sees, not consciousness.

original: sgo dang lta ba gnyis don tha mi dad pa nyid yin na ni brjod pa don med pa'i phyir 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgo dang lta ba gnyis don tha mi dad pa nyid yin na ni brjod pa don med pa'i phyir 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If the door and seeing were not different, then this would be unacceptable because the statement would be meaningless.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What would be meaningless?

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes de skad smras par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes de skad smras par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It would be meaningless to say, ‚ÄúThe eye is the door for the seeing of visible form.‚Äù

original: yid ni chos rnams shes par bya ba la sgo yin no zhes bya ba gsungs par der yang yid 'das pa kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gyur pas sgo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yid ni chos rnams shes par bya ba la sgo yin no zhes bya ba gsungs par der yang yid 'das pa kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gyur pas sgo zhes gsungs te /
translated: The sutra states that the mental faculty is the door for the consciousness of mental objects. There, the past mental faculty is the basis of the mental consciousness and is called the door.

original: yid 'das pas chos rnam par shes par nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs mthong ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir mig la rten zhes gsungs kyi de la mthong ba'i nus pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid 'das pas chos rnam par shes par nus pa med pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs mthong ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir mig la rten zhes gsungs kyi de la mthong ba'i nus pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the past mental faculty is not capable of being the consciousness of mental objects.

original: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, here the eye is called the basis because it is the basis for seeing visible form. But it does not have the ability to see because it is inanimate.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na gang gis rnam par shes /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na gang gis rnam par shes /
translated: If consciousness sees, by what is consciousness itself known?

original: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong ba de'i ltar na ni rnam par shes pas gzugs mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong ba de'i ltar na ni rnam par shes pas gzugs mthong ngo //
translated: According to those who maintain that the eye sees, it is consciousness that sees form.

original: rnam par shes so zhes tha snyad rigs na /
analyzed: rnam par shes so zhes tha snyad rigs na /
translated: If you say that it is proper to say that consciousness sees and knows,

original: gang gi ltar na rnam par shes pas mthong ba de'i ltar na ni gzhan gyis rnam par shes pa med pas tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na rnam par shes pas mthong ba de'i ltar na ni gzhan gyis rnam par shes pa med pas tha snyad med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then according to those who maintain that consciousness sees, since there is no other consciousness, it would be improper to say that consciousness knows.

original: 'di nyid la khyad par ci yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di nyid la khyad par ci yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod /üîΩgang gis @88b zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod / gang gis @88b zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: What is the difference between seeing and knowing?üîΩBy what is seeing known?

original: gang gis gzugs mthong ba dmigs pa de nyid kyis 'di rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs mthong ba dmigs pa de nyid kyis 'di rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: The very same that sees form also knows it.

original: gal te dmigs pa mthong ba yin na sgra la sogs pa dag tu yang dmigs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa mthong ba yin na sgra la sogs pa dag tu yang dmigs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If seeing is the apprehension of the object, then sound and so on would also be seen.

original: thog ma'i dmigs pa la mthong bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: thog ma'i dmigs pa la mthong bar 'dod kyi /
translated: We maintain that seeing is the apprehension of the initial object.

original: dmigs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: but not all objects.

original: dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, some wisdom is called seeing, as in the passage,

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin brgyad mthong ba yang yin zhing /
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin brgyad mthong ba yang yin zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúThe eight that are by nature views are also seeing,

original: rab tu shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: rab tu shes pa yang yin la /
translated: but the others are simply wisdom.‚Äù

original: de dag las gzhan rnams ni rab tu shes pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba yang yin zhing rnam par shes pa yang yin gyi rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa khoüîΩna yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan rnams ni rab tu shes pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba yang yin zhing rnam par shes pa yang yin gyi rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: Similarly, eye consciousness is both seeing and consciousness, but ear consciousness and so on are simply consciousness.

original: gzhan dag na re ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Others say: If seeing is seeing that is also consciousness,

original: de la ni gang byed pa na mthong ngo zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: de la ni gang byed pa na mthong ngo zhes brjod pa /
translated: then that which is seeing is also consciousness,üîΩbut that which is consciousness is not necessarily seeing.üîΩFor example, the eye faculty is consciousness but not seeing,

original: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan 'dra ba zhig med la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan 'dra ba zhig med la /
translated: because it is not seeing that is also consciousness.üîΩBut if seeing is seeing that is also seeing,üîΩthen that which is seeing is also seeing,

original: bya ba med par yang byed pa po nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: bya ba med par yang byed pa po nyid mi rigs te /
translated: but that which is seeing is not necessarily seeing.

original: 'gro ba po nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba po nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, eye consciousness is both seeing and seeing,üîΩbut the eye faculty is seeing but not seeing.

original: de ni klan kar mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni klan kar mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: That is not a criticism.

original: rnam par shes pa la ni rnam par shes pa zhes brjod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la ni rnam par shes pa zhes brjod na /
translated: If consciousness is called consciousness,

original: de la ni byed pa po dang bye brag kyang med de /
analyzed: de la ni byed pa po dang bye brag kyang med de /
translated: then there is no difference between it and an agent,

original: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no activity of consciousness apart from consciousness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig mas //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig mas //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.

original: mi gnas bya ba ga la yod //üîΩgang dag 'byung ba de nyid ni //üîΩbya ba de nyid byed por brjod //
analyzed: mi gnas bya ba ga la yod // gang dag 'byung ba de nyid ni // bya ba de nyid byed por brjod //
translated: How can they be active?üîΩThat which arises is called the agent

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: of that very activity.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also appropriate in this case.

original: ci zhe na /üîΩmig la byed pa po dang bya ba'i bye brag med kyang mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: ci zhe na / mig la byed pa po dang bya ba'i bye brag med kyang mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: What is it?üîΩIt is shown that even though there is no difference between the eye and an agent and activity, it is said, ‚ÄúThe eye sees.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re ni mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba ni lta ba'o //
translated: Others say: Seeing is eye consciousness.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the basis of that.

original: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye is called seeing because it is the basis of visual consciousness.

original: dper na sgrogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni de nyid la 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe smras pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sgrogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni de nyid la 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe smras pa ste /
translated: For example, it is like the expression ‚Äúthe bell rings.‚ÄùüîΩThe bell rings because it is the basis of sound.
