original: sgra sgrogs mod kyi de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir dril sgrogs so zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
analyzed: sgra sgrogs mod kyi de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir dril sgrogs so zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, here also.

original: de ltar na mig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩgal te @89a * //
analyzed: de ltar na mig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / gal te @89a * //
translated: Thus, the eye is the basis of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If the eye sees because it is the basis of seeing,

original: de lta na rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis rnam par shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩmi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis rnam par shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na / mi 'gyur te /
translated: then consciousness would be seeing because it is the basis of seeing.

original: byed pa po dang bya ba'i tha snyad 'di ni 'jig rten pa yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po dang bya ba'i tha snyad 'di ni 'jig rten pa yin la /
translated: No, because the conventions of agent and action are worldly.

original: 'jig rten na yang ;
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang ;
translated: And in the world,

original: rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba zhes grags kyi rnam par shes so zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba zhes grags kyi rnam par shes so zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is known as seeing, but it is not known as perceiving.

original: shes par byed pa smras pa /
analyzed: shes par byed pa smras pa /
translated: The proponent of the theory of perception replies:

original: 'di ltar de skyes na gzugs mthong ngo zhes 'dzer gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de skyes na gzugs mthong ngo zhes 'dzer gyi /
translated: When it arises, it is said that form is seen,

original: rnam par shes so zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes so zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: but it is not said that form is perceived.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The VibhƒÅ·π£ƒÅ states this in detail.

original: 'jig rten na yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: Not only is this the case in the world, but also in the treatises.

original: de mthong bar brjod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de mthong bar brjod do zhes ston to //
translated: It teaches that seeing is expressed in terms of that.

original: mig dang phrad cing zhes bya ba ni mig gis bltas shing de la snang bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mig dang phrad cing zhes bya ba ni mig gis bltas shing de la snang bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving come into contact with the eye‚Äù means that the eye sees and form appears to it.

original: de'i yul gyi dngos por gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi dngos por gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that form becomes its object.

original: gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya na /
translated: If it is said that the eye sees because it is the basis of seeing,

original: 'o na ni gang gi rten du gyur pas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang gi rten du gyur pas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod do //
translated: then it should be said that consciousness perceives form because it is the basis of perception.

original: de la rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But there is no other activity of consciousness apart from consciousness.

original: de'i phyir / rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúConsciousness is the mere existence of consciousness.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis phyogs pa dag na re mig ni nye ba tsam gyis mthong ngo zhes bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis phyogs pa dag na re mig ni nye ba tsam gyis mthong ngo zhes bstan par mi nus te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that it cannot be said that the eye sees merely by its presence,

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i mig kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i mig kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are eyes that are similar to it but do not see.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de lta ma yin pas de yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de lta ma yin pas de yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod de /
translated: But consciousness is not like that. Therefore, it is said that form is perceived by the mere existence of consciousness.

original: dper na nyi mas nyin par byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi mas nyin par byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is said that the sun makes the day.

original: 'di ltar gling rnams kyi snang ba'i gnas ni nyin par yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gling rnams kyi snang ba'i gnas ni nyin par yin la /
translated: The day is the time when the continents are illuminated.

original: de yang 'od dang bcas pa'i nyi ma las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'od dang bcas pa'i nyi ma las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not something other than the sun with its rays.üîΩTherefore, it is said that the sun makes the day by its mere existence.

original: de'i phyir nyi ma yod pa nyid las nyin par byed do zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi ma yod pa nyid las nyin par byed do zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The same is true here.

original: 'di la mdo sde pa rnams na re ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩci mig gis mthong ngam /
analyzed: 'di la mdo sde pa rnams na re ni zhes bya ba la / ci mig gis mthong ngam /
translated: Here, the Sutra school says:üîΩWhat is the context?üîΩIs it the context of ‚ÄúDoes the eye see?

original: rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i skabs gang yin pa der ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i skabs gang yin pa der ro //
translated: Or does consciousness see?‚Äù

original: de dag ji skad zer zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji skad zer zhe na /
translated: What do they say?

original: nam mkha' ldad pa 'di ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ldad pa 'di ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: rnam par dpyad pa 'di ni nam mkha' 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa 'di ni nam mkha' 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This analysis is pointless, like analyzing whether the sky is torn.üîΩThe point is that this analysis is pointless, like analyzing whether the sky is torn.

original: yang ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa 'di dgos pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa 'di dgos pa med ce na /
translated: Why is this analysis pointless?

original: de'i @89b phyir ;
analyzed: de'i @89b phyir ;
translated: Therefore, it says:

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In dependence on the eye and forms,

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: 'bras bu'i yod pa ni rgyu'i yod pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na /üîΩde la lta ba ni su zhig yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yod pa ni rgyu'i yod pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na / de la lta ba ni su zhig yin /
translated: The existence of an effect is preceded by the existence of a cause.üîΩWhat is the seer?

original: lta ba ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: lta ba ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is seeing?

original: 'di la tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: One should not have faith in mere words.

original: de'i phyir / 'di ni byed pa med pa dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ni byed pa med pa dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThis is without activity,‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i yod pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i yod pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba 'gag pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Without activity‚Äù means the cessation of activity that is different from the existence of the cause.

original: de las tha dad pa'i bya ba khas blangs na skad cig mar 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i bya ba khas blangs na skad cig mar 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: If one accepts that activity is different from that, then the momentary destruction of things is undermined.

original: dngos po rnams skad cig phan chad gnas pa ni tshad ma dag dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig phan chad gnas pa ni tshad ma dag dang 'gal lo //
translated: The persistence of things for more than an instant is contradicted by valid cognitions.

original: chos tsam zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos tsam zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Mere phenomena‚Äù means that the internal agent, the person, is refuted.

original: rgyu'i byed pa dang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa dang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that even without the activity of a cause and an internal agent, the relation of cause and effect is not undermined in regard to cause and effect,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIt is merely the relation of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: tha snyad gdags pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos su'o //
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos su'o //
translated: ‚Äú For the sake of conventional designation‚Äù means in the world and in treatises.

original: 'dun pa ni sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don gyi rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don gyi rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúgate‚Äù is not the reason.

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not cling to this.

original: tha snyad pa'i don ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i don ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of conventional expressions is a designation.

original: ci zhig las she na /
analyzed: ci zhig las she na /
translated: What is it?

original: sgra'i sgo nas 'byung ba ni 'byung ba po la ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa las te /
analyzed: sgra'i sgo nas 'byung ba ni 'byung ba po la ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa las te /
translated: Because the occurrence of a sound is dependent on the one who utters it, etc.

original: don dam par btsal na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par btsal na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, when sought in the ultimate sense, it is not perceived.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya bas ni tha snyad pa'i don la mngon par zhen pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag par mdzad do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya bas ni tha snyad pa'i don la mngon par zhen pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag par mdzad do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚ÄúLord‚Äù shows that the Lord has refuted the clinging to the meaning of conventional expressions.

original: ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ljongs kyi mi dang ljongs kyi mi nges pa ste /
analyzed: ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la ljongs kyi mi dang ljongs kyi mi nges pa ste /
translated: One should not cling to the words of the people of the country. The people of the country are uncertain.

original: gtan la phab pa'i tshig ljongs kyi mi'i tshig go //
analyzed: gtan la phab pa'i tshig ljongs kyi mi'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the people of the country are the words of the people of a particular country.

original: ci'i phyir 'di 'dir nges par byas zhes de dag la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di 'dir nges par byas zhes de dag la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not cling to the idea that this is definitely so in this case.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ni nges pa'i tshig yin gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ni nges pa'i tshig yin gyi /
translated: Why is this a definitive statement?

original: thams cad don dang ldan par rtogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad don dang ldan par rtogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that one should not understand that everything has meaning.

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not run after worldly names.

original: rtog pa dang rab tu brgyug par bya zhes bya ba 'di ni don gcig go //üîΩlus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag ni yod de zhes bya bar yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa'i sgo nas bdag dang srog ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad @90a * //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rab tu brgyug par bya zhes bya ba 'di ni don gcig go // lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag ni yod de zhes bya bar yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa'i sgo nas bdag dang srog ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad @90a * //
translated: Running after conceptual thoughts and running after worldly names have the same meaning.üîΩOne should not superimpose the self, which is separate from the body, etc.,

original: lhag par sgro gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par sgro gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: as something that exists, by means of the superimposition of what is unreal, and so on, with such expressions as ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúlife force.‚Äù

original: kha che'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kha che'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the tenet of the Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: 'dir ni kha che'i bye brag tu smra ba la grags pa'i chos mngon par bshad pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i phyir de dag nyid phyogs phyi mar gnas par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni kha che'i bye brag tu smra ba la grags pa'i chos mngon par bshad pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i phyir de dag nyid phyogs phyi mar gnas par byed do //
translated: But now we are discussing the Abhidharma that is renowned to the Vaibhasikas of Kasmir, so we will take their position as the latter position.

original: gal te gang yang rung ba zhig btsums na gzugs gang yang rung ba zhig dmigs pa'i phyir gnyis kas mthong bar nus par grub bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te gang yang rung ba zhig btsums na gzugs gang yang rung ba zhig dmigs pa'i phyir gnyis kas mthong bar nus par grub bzhin du /
translated: If one closes either eye, one can still observe form, so it is established that both eyes can see.

original: yang ci'i phyir /üîΩci mig gcig gis zhes rgyas par spyod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir / ci mig gcig gis zhes rgyas par spyod ce na /
translated: But why is it thatüîΩthe sutra says, ‚ÄúIf one eye is covered and one sees a form, is that form seen with one eye or with two eyes?‚Äù

original: gnyis ka phye na mthong ba gang yin pa de ci rim gyis sam 'on te cig car yin zhes bya ba 'di ma dpyad bas de'i phyir de dmigs kyis nges par bya ba'i phyir rtsom mo //
analyzed: gnyis ka phye na mthong ba gang yin pa de ci rim gyis sam 'on te cig car yin zhes bya ba 'di ma dpyad bas de'i phyir de dmigs kyis nges par bya ba'i phyir rtsom mo //
translated: This is not a critical analysis, so it is stated in this way in order to determine the point.

original: 'di la nges pa med de mig ni gnyis ka dag gis kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa med de mig ni gnyis ka dag gis kyang mthong ste /
translated: There is no certainty here, because one sees with both eyes.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gcig gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gcig gis kyang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means one sees with one eye.

original: 'dir gnyis kho na 'am gcig kho nas zhes nges par ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis kho na 'am gcig kho nas zhes nges par ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: Here one should not grasp that one sees with two eyes or one eye alone.

original: nges pa 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: nges pa 'di gang las she na /
translated: What is the certainty here?

original: gsal bar mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar mthong phyir ro //
translated: Because it is clearly seen.

original: chos mngon pa pa smos pa ni mdo sde pa rnams las kha cig gcig gis mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'dod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa smos pa ni mdo sde pa rnams las kha cig gcig gis mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'dod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúin the Abhidharma‚Äù is mentioned in order to show that some Sautrantikas assert that one eye sees.

original: 'di ltar gnyis ka phye na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis ka phye na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As it is said,

original: mig gcig btsums nas gzugs gang zhig rgyun chags su 'jug pa mi gsal bar dmigs pa de nyid gnyis ka phye bas ches gsal bar dmigs te /
analyzed: mig gcig btsums nas gzugs gang zhig rgyun chags su 'jug pa mi gsal bar dmigs pa de nyid gnyis ka phye bas ches gsal bar dmigs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf both eyes are open, the form that is seen by one eye alone, which is not clearly apprehended, is clearly apprehended when both eyes are open.‚Äù

original: gcig gis mthong na ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu mthong ba khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gis mthong na ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu mthong ba khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eye sees, then the seeing of the former and latter moments would not be distinct.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if one eye is different from the other, it is not so.

original: gal te phye ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gal te phye ba gang yin pa de /
translated: If the eye that is open

original: phyed btsums pa'am /
analyzed: phyed btsums pa'am /
translated: sees form, then the eye that is half open or half closedüîΩsees form.

original: phyed btsums pa de thams cad phye ba'am thams cad btsums na /
analyzed: phyed btsums pa de thams cad phye ba'am thams cad btsums na /
translated: If the eye that is half open or half closed sees form, then the eye that is completely open or completely closed sees form.

original: de nas zla ba gnyis su 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas zla ba gnyis su 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Then the moon would not be apprehended as two.

original: de'i phyir mig gcig gis mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gcig gis mthong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye sees.

original: de lta ma yin na mig gcig phye ba dang / gnyis pa phyed btsums na zla ba gnyis su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mig gcig phye ba dang / gnyis pa phyed btsums na zla ba gnyis su 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the eye did not see in this way, then when one eye is open and the other is half closed, one would not apprehend two moons.

original: de'i phyir gnyis ka yang der cig car nus so zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis ka yang der cig car nus so zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that both eyes simultaneously see.

original: gal te gnyis kas mthong na rten rnam par chad pas rnam par shes pa rnam par chad pas sems can gcig gi dbang bo ltar skad cig ma gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyis kas mthong na rten rnam par chad pas rnam par shes pa rnam par chad pas sems can gcig gi dbang bo ltar skad cig ma gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If both eyes see, then because the support is divided, the consciousness is divided, and it follows that there would be two consciousnesses in one sentient being, just as there are two eyes.

original: de'i phyir / rten rnam par chang pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rten rnam par chang pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúBecause the support is divided, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not exist in a place.

original: mig gi rnam @90b par shes pa ni 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug bzhin rten dang brten pa'i ngo bos mig la gnas te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam @90b par shes pa ni 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug bzhin rten dang brten pa'i ngo bos mig la gnas te /
translated: The eye consciousness exists in the eye in the nature of a support and something supported, like a tray and pastries.

original: de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba'i phyir mig la de'i rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba'i phyir mig la de'i rten zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it changes when they change, the eye is called its support.

original: de'i phyir rten gcig la rag las pa'i phyir dang / de yang gcig yin pa'i phyir mig brgyas kyang rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed par 'gal ba med na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rten gcig la rag las pa'i phyir dang / de yang gcig yin pa'i phyir mig brgyas kyang rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed par 'gal ba med na ;
translated: Therefore, since they depend on a single basis and that basis is single, there is no contradiction in a single visual consciousness being generated by a hundred eyes.

original: gnyis kyis yin pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gnyis kyis yin pa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the generation of a single visual consciousness by two eyes?

original: mig rnag gis bar chod pa gcig kyang rnam par shes pa du ma skyed par thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mig rnag gis bar chod pa gcig kyang rnam par shes pa du ma skyed par thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: It follows that a single visual consciousness would be generated by many eyes, since a single eye obstructed by eye-discharge would generate many visual consciousnesses.

original: yul na mi gnas pa de'i rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa de'i rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not interrupted, since the basis of that consciousness is not spatially extended, even though the object is not spatially extended.

original: gzugs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike form‚Äù is an example of something that is not spatially extended.

original: ci 'di dag yul dang phrad pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la the tshom 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: ci 'di dag yul dang phrad pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la the tshom 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is there this doubt as to whether or not the sense faculties come into contact with their objects?

original: gnyis ka yang bsnyad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang bsnyad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both positions have been taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du mig ni yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs la thogs so zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du mig ni yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs la thogs so zhes gsungs nas /
translated: The Bhagav√•n has said: The eye is obstructed by form that is attractive and unattractive.

original: ma phrad pa la ni thogs pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: ma phrad pa la ni thogs pa mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not reasonable that there is obstruction where there is no contact.

original: slar yang de'i lha'i mig gis sems can dag la lta'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / ring ba gang dag yin pa dang / nye ba gang dag yin pa zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: slar yang de'i lha'i mig gis sems can dag la lta'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / ring ba gang dag yin pa dang / nye ba gang dag yin pa zhes gsungs nas /
translated: And again, it is said that ‚Äúwith his divine eye he sees sentient beings‚Äù and so on, and it is said that ‚Äúthose who are far away and those who are near.‚Äù

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni nye ba dang / ring ba'i rnam par gzhag par mi srid do //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni nye ba dang / ring ba'i rnam par gzhag par mi srid do //
translated: But if there were contact with the object, it would not be possible to posit far and near.

original: de'i phyir / mig dang yid dang rna ba dang // yul dang ma phrad ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mig dang yid dang rna ba dang // yul dang ma phrad ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThe eye, the mental faculty, and the ear do not contact their objects.‚Äù

original: shes par yod pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: shes par yod pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the existence of consciousness?

original: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it says, ‚ÄúForm that is far away‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o zhes bya bar shes par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o zhes bya bar shes par byed do //
translated: This shows that there is no contact with the object.

original: mig la yod pa'i mig sman mi mthong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig la yod pa'i mig sman mi mthong zhes bya ba la /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúOne does not see eye medicine in the eye.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di yul dang phrad pa yin pa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di yul dang phrad pa yin pa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: This refutes the idea that there is contact with the object.

original: de lta yin dang yul dang ma phrad pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang yul dang ma phrad pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would be certain that the sense faculty does not come into contact with its object.

original: gang dag brten nas byung ste yul la gnas so zhes yul dang phrad par 'dod pa de dag gi de yang 'dod pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gang dag brten nas byung ste yul la gnas so zhes yul dang phrad par 'dod pa de dag gi de yang 'dod pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Those who maintain that the sense faculty comes into contact with its object because it arises in dependence on the object, their position is mere assertion.

original: nye ba dang ring bdag la dus mnyam par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring bdag la dus mnyam par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood that the object is simultaneous with the sense faculty, whether it is near or far.

original: chos 'di ni nag pa la sogs pa 'gro ba dang ldan pa rnams la mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni nag pa la sogs pa 'gro ba dang ldan pa rnams la mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: This phenomenon is not seen by those who are blind, etc.

original: mig ni 'od zer yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin du thag nye ba dang ring ba dag lan cig gsal bar byed par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: mig ni 'od zer yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin du thag nye ba dang ring ba dag lan cig gsal bar byed par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: It is not contradictory for the eye, because it is light rays, to illuminate both the near and the far at the same time, like a lamp.

original: blta bar 'dod pa rnams mun khung na snang ba tshol ba'i phyir 'od zer nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: blta bar 'dod pa rnams mun khung na snang ba tshol ba'i phyir 'od zer nyid ma grub po //
translated: Those who desire to see do not seek light in the dark, so light rays are not established.

original: mig gi 'od zer @91a * //
analyzed: mig gi 'od zer @91a * //
translated: The eye is not light rays.

original: nyung ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi snang ba tshol bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: nyung ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi snang ba tshol bar byed do zhe na /
translated: Because the eye has few light rays, it seeks external light.

original: nyung ngu ni mang pos zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyung ngu ni mang pos zil gyis gnon par byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the small is overwhelmed by the large, it would not be the object.

original: dpe don dang mtshungs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe don dang mtshungs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not similar to the example.

original: bar med pa phrad pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar med pa phrad pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that the unobstructed illuminates by contact.

original: mar me ni sdong bu dang mar la sogs pa phrad pa sreg cing snang bar byed na /
analyzed: mar me ni sdong bu dang mar la sogs pa phrad pa sreg cing snang bar byed na /
translated: The lamp burns and illuminates by contact with the wick and oil, etc.

original: mig ni me ltar mig sman la sogs pa shin tu nye ba rnams 'dzin bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ni me ltar mig sman la sogs pa shin tu nye ba rnams 'dzin bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But the eye, like the lamp, does not apprehend the very proximate eye medicine, etc.

original: shel la sogs pas chod pa yang dmigs pas ma phrad par 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / the tshom mthong ba'i phyir na mig ni yul dang phrad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shel la sogs pas chod pa yang dmigs pas ma phrad par 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / the tshom mthong ba'i phyir na mig ni yul dang phrad pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is observed that the eye apprehends without contact, because it is obstructed by glass, etc., and because of the doubt, the eye does not contact its object.

original: phrad pa yin na ni reng reng po ltar mtho yor la mi yin snyam du de'i khyad par dag la the tshom za bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: phrad pa yin na ni reng reng po ltar mtho yor la mi yin snyam du de'i khyad par dag la the tshom za bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: If there were contact, it would not be reasonable to doubt the difference between a cairn and a man, thinking that the cairn is a man.

original: de dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is proximate by its entire nature.

original: dpag tshad stong phrag du mas bskal ba dang phrad pa mi phrad pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dpag tshad stong phrag du mas bskal ba dang phrad pa mi phrad pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: because it is not possible for it to meet with an eon that is many thousands of yojanas away.

original: lan cig phye ma thag tu mig zla ba dang phrad do zhes bya bar brjod pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: lan cig phye ma thag tu mig zla ba dang phrad do zhes bya bar brjod pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to say that as soon as the eye opens, it meets with the moon.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: mig de 'gro dang ldan 'gyur na //
analyzed: mig de 'gro dang ldan 'gyur na //
translated: If the eye were to go to the object,

original: rgyang ring yun ring gyis mthong 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyang ring yun ring gyis mthong 'gyur //
translated: it would see distant objects after a long time.

original: nye ba dang ni ring ba yi //
analyzed: nye ba dang ni ring ba yi //
translated: If it sees both distant and near objects

original: gzugs ni mtshungs na de go ci //
analyzed: gzugs ni mtshungs na de go ci //
translated: at the same time, what is the point of going?

original: gal te gzugs mthong mig 'gro na //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mthong mig 'gro na //
translated: If the eye goes to the object in order to see it,

original: 'gro la yon tan ci zhig yod //üîΩblta bar bya ba nges pa ni //
analyzed: 'gro la yon tan ci zhig yod // blta bar bya ba nges pa ni //
translated: what is the point of going?

original: 'dod ces bya ba don med 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba don med 'gyur //
translated: The assertion that the object to be seen is definite

original: zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: zhes bshad do ;
translated: is meaningless.

original: / de'i phyir mig ni yul de'i phyir dang ma phrad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir mig ni yul de'i phyir dang ma phrad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye does not meet with the object.

original: de bzhin du sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba ni rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba ni rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the statement ‚ÄúSound is heard from a distance‚Äù shows that the ear does not meet with the object.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni sna ltar phrad pa'i yul kho na rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni sna ltar phrad pa'i yul kho na rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were to come into contact with its object-field, then, like the nose, it would only know the object-field with which it is in contact.

original: ring ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ring ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not know distant things.

original: sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How do you know that sound is distant?

original: phyogs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one determines it through the distinctions of direction, etc.

original: lho phyogs kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi sgra'o //
translated: This sound is in the south,

original: byang phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi'o //
translated: in the north,üîΩfar away,

original: rgyang ring ba'o //üîΩnye ba'o zhes de ltar nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyang ring ba'o // nye ba'o zhes de ltar nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: near by.

original: phrad pa la de mi rigs te /
analyzed: phrad pa la de mi rigs te /
translated: This is not possible for the sense-faculty that is in contact with its object-field.

original: dril sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dril sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nose, etc.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If it were to be in contact with its object-field, then, like the nose, etc., it would not know distant things.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni mi dag na'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni mi dag na'o //
translated: Here means among humans.

original: gal te mi g-yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis sna la sogs pa dag las khyad par du gyur na ni de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te mi g-yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis sna la sogs pa dag las khyad par du gyur na ni de ltar na /
translated: If the visual sense-faculty were to differ from the nose sense-faculty, etc., because it does not come into contact with its object-field, then, in that case,

original: bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig gzugs phra ba dang / chod pa dang / thag ring ba la sogs par 'dzin par byed pa skye bar mi 'gal te /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig gzugs phra ba dang / chod pa dang / thag ring ba la sogs par 'dzin par byed pa skye bar mi 'gal te /
translated: It is not contradictory for the eye of the meditator to apprehend subtle, obscured, distant forms, etc.

original: 'bad rtsol gyi khyad par @91b las 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol gyi khyad par @91b las 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result arises from the special effort.

original: de bzhin du sgra la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sound should be explained in the same way.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni lha'i dang / lha'i ma yin pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni lha'i dang / lha'i ma yin pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to contact its object, then there would be no point in the effort because there would be no difference between the divine eye and the non-divine eye.

original: gal te mig yul dang ma phrad pa yin na ci'i phyir thag ring ba dang / bar du chod pa thams cad mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig yul dang ma phrad pa yin na ci'i phyir thag ring ba dang / bar du chod pa thams cad mi mthong zhe na /
translated: If the eye does not contact its object, why does one not see all distant and obscured forms?

original: bshad pa / nus pa'i khyad par las te /
analyzed: bshad pa / nus pa'i khyad par las te /
translated: It is said: because of the special power.

original: khab long bzhin no //
analyzed: khab long bzhin no //
translated: Like a magnet.

original: khab long gis ma phrad pa'i lcags 'dren zhes te /
analyzed: khab long gis ma phrad pa'i lcags 'dren zhes te /
translated: A magnet attracts iron without contacting it.

original: chod pa dang / thag ring ba dang / mngon du phyogs par mi gnas pa thams cad 'dren par ni mi nus pa nyid de /
analyzed: chod pa dang / thag ring ba dang / mngon du phyogs par mi gnas pa thams cad 'dren par ni mi nus pa nyid de /
translated: But it cannot attract all iron, whether distant, obscured, or not directly in front of it.

original: de bzhin du mig kyang yul dang ma phrad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig kyang yul dang ma phrad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, the eye does not see its object by coming into contact with it.

original: ma phrad pa thams cad mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma phrad pa thams cad mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But not all noncontact is seeing.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di mtshungs so zhes 'chad pa ni /üîΩci'i phyir mig sman nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na yang thal bar 'gyur ba 'di mtshungs so zhes 'chad pa ni / ci'i phyir mig sman nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If the eye sees by coming into contact with its object, the same difficulty still remains.üîΩWhy does the eye not see the ointment or the stick?

original: mig sman nam thur ma ni phrad pa mi mthong ngo //üîΩji ltar sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba la nus pa tha dad pas phrad pa yul yin gyi /
analyzed: mig sman nam thur ma ni phrad pa mi mthong ngo // ji ltar sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba la nus pa tha dad pas phrad pa yul yin gyi /
translated: The ointment or the stick is not seen because it is in contact with the eye.üîΩThe nose, etc., do not see because they are different in power.

original: thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: The nose, tongue, and body do not see because they are different in power.

original: ji ltar thams cad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they different in power?

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they do not grasp the smell, etc., that arises simultaneously with them.

original: sna la sogs pa dbang po dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dag ni phrad pa yin pa yang sna la sogs pa dag gis mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: sna la sogs pa dbang po dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dag ni phrad pa yin pa yang sna la sogs pa dag gis mi 'dzin te /
translated: The smell, taste, and tangible that arise simultaneously with the nose, tongue, and body are in contact with the nose, etc., but are not grasped by the nose, etc.

original: de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the eye.

original: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is not material.

original: phrad pa ni phan tshun 'dab chags par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: phrad pa ni phan tshun 'dab chags par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Contact is the mutual contact of two things.

original: de yang yul na gnas pa'i phyir gzugs can rnams kho na yin na yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas te /
analyzed: de yang yul na gnas pa'i phyir gzugs can rnams kho na yin na yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas te /
translated: And that is only of material things, because they occupy a place. But the mind is not material, and so does not occupy a place.

original: de'i phyir rang gi yul dang phrad par mi nus pa nyid do //üîΩrna ba'i nang du yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi yul dang phrad par mi nus pa nyid do // rna ba'i nang du yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it cannot contact its object.üîΩAlso, sound is not contacted, because it is heard even when distant.

original: yang gi sgras ni thag ring po nas kyang thos pa'i phyir rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa yin par sems so //üîΩmu stegs byed kha cig na re /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni thag ring po nas kyang thos pa'i phyir rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa yin par sems so // mu stegs byed kha cig na re /
translated: The word also in the verse indicates that the ear does not contact its object, because sound is heard even when distant.

original: sgra rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i rim pas rna bas 'ongs pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rna ba ni yul dang phrad pa kho na yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgra rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i rim pas rna bas 'ongs pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rna ba ni yul dang phrad pa kho na yin zhes zer ro //
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas say that the ear is only in contact with its object, because it apprehends sound that has come to it through the process of the continuity of sound.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: lag par bcangs pas dril bu'i sgra 'gags ma thag tu sgra mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag par bcangs pas dril bu'i sgra 'gags ma thag tu sgra mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one holds the ear with ones hand, one does not hear the sound that has just ceased.

original: de zhig kyang gang zhig bar nas chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ong ba'i sgra de 'dzin pa sus bzlog / de'i phyir dril bu'i yul na gnas pa'i sgra kho na 'dzin gyi /üîΩchu rlabs kyi tshul du rna @92a * //
analyzed: de zhig kyang gang zhig bar nas chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ong ba'i sgra de 'dzin pa sus bzlog / de'i phyir dril bu'i yul na gnas pa'i sgra kho na 'dzin gyi / chu rlabs kyi tshul du rna @92a * //
translated: Thus, the sound that is perceived is only the sound that exists in the bell.

original: 'brug gi bu gar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brug gi bu gar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The sound does not go to the ear sense-faculty in the manner of an echo.

original: gsum gzhan du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum gzhan du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other three are of both kinds.

original: gzhan du zhes smos pa ni yul dang phrad pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes smos pa ni yul dang phrad pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúof both kinds‚Äù is used because the other three sense-faculties, i.e., the eye sense-faculty, the nose sense-faculty, the tongue sense-faculty, are of two types:

original: gal te yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yin par 'dod na ni de ltar gzhan du dang / gzhan du ma yin pa zhes bya bar sma bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yin par 'dod na ni de ltar gzhan du dang / gzhan du ma yin pa zhes bya bar sma bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they are sometimes in contact with their object-field, sometimes not in contact with their object-field.

original: sna ji ltar yul dang phrad pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: sna ji ltar yul dang phrad pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: How is the nose sense-faculty in contact with its object-field?

original: gang las the tshom za zhe na /
analyzed: gang las the tshom za zhe na /
translated: From what does doubt arise?

original: dri'i rten me tog la sogs pa thag ring po 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri'i rten me tog la sogs pa thag ring po 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: From the fact that one perceives the odor of a flower at a distance.

original: ro dang reg bya dag ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: ro dang reg bya dag ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case for taste and tangible.

original: dbugs ma brngubs par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩdbugs brngubs pa dang bcas pas dri dang ldan pa'i me tog gis bsgos pa'i rlung sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes pa na dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dbugs ma brngubs par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / dbugs brngubs pa dang bcas pas dri dang ldan pa'i me tog gis bsgos pa'i rlung sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes pa na dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it does not apprehend odor without inhaling.üîΩWhen the wind that is perfumed by a flower possessing odor is inhaled, it comes into contact with the nose sense faculty and apprehends odor.üîΩOr, when the nose sense faculty comes into contact with odor, it apprehends odor that is drawn in by the great element of odor.

original: dri'i byung ba chen pos drangs pas sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes pa'i dri 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / drangs pa med pas ma brngubs pa la dri dang dbang po phrad pa med pa de'i phyir sna ni yul dang phrad pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: dri'i byung ba chen pos drangs pas sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes pa'i dri 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / drangs pa med pas ma brngubs pa la dri dang dbang po phrad pa med pa de'i phyir sna ni yul dang phrad pa nyid du nges so //
translated: Since there is no drawing in without inhaling, odor and the sense faculty do not come into contact. Therefore it is certain that the nose definitely comes into contact with its object.

original: yul dang ma phrad pa nyid yin na ni mig dang rna ba bzhin du brngubs ba dang bcas pa dang ma brngubs pa gnyis la khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad pa nyid yin na ni mig dang rna ba bzhin du brngubs ba dang bcas pa dang ma brngubs pa gnyis la khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not come into contact with its object, then there would be no difference between inhaling and not inhaling, as there is no difference between the eye and ear and inhaling and not inhaling.

original: kha cig gis ni ldan pa'i ming gnyis pa can phrad pa don gzhan zhig 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni ldan pa'i ming gnyis pa can phrad pa don gzhan zhig 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that contact is a separate object that has two names.

original: dper na bye brag pa rnams kyis 'dod pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa rnams kyis 'dod pa lta bu'o ;
translated: For example, it is like the desire of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: / de'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,üîΩwhat is this so-called contact?

original: phrad pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba dris so //üîΩ'dab chags par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: phrad pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba dris so // 'dab chags par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It is the occurrence of the arising of things in an unbroken continuum.

original: de ltar na 'dab chags par 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i phrad pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dab chags par 'byung ba yang kha cig gi ltar na nam mkha'i khams ma gtogs pa'i gzugs kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin la /üîΩgzhan gyi ltar na gzugs thams cad kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin no //üîΩci rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dab chags par 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i phrad pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro // 'dab chags par 'byung ba yang kha cig gi ltar na nam mkha'i khams ma gtogs pa'i gzugs kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin la / gzhan gyi ltar na gzugs thams cad kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin no // ci rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that apart from the occurrence of the arising of things in an unbroken continuum, there is no other contact.

original: gal te phan tshun reg na ni cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun reg na ni cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: The occurrence of the arising of things in an unbroken continuum is due to the occurrence of the arising of things in an unbroken continuum in the sense that some say it is due to the occurrence of the arising of things in an unbroken continuum in the sense that some say it is due to the occurrence of the arising of things in an unbroken continuum in the sense that some say it is
