due to the occurrence of the arising

original: cha shas med pa nyid yin na yang sems dang sems las byung ba ltar reg pa med do //
analyzed: cha shas med pa nyid yin na yang sems dang sems las byung ba ltar reg pa med do //
translated: But even if it is partless, it does not touch, like mind and mental factors.

original: ci ste mi reg na de lta yin dang gsum ni yul dang phrad pa'o zhes bya bar 'gal te /
analyzed: ci ste mi reg na de lta yin dang gsum ni yul dang phrad pa'o zhes bya bar 'gal te /
translated: If it does not touch, then it contradicts the statement, ‚ÄúThe three are contact when there is contact with the object.‚Äù

original: ma reg pa ni phrad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma reg pa ni phrad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that which does not touch does not contact.

original: 'dir ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab la mngon par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab la mngon par 'dod kyi /
translated: Here, the substantial atom is intended,

original: 'dus pa'i rdul phra @92b rab ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rdul phra @92b rab ni ma yin te /
translated: not the aggregated atom,

original: de ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has parts.

original: 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt would mix‚Äù means it would not have a different location.

original: de'i dngos po med par thal bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i dngos po med par thal bar snang ngo //
translated: It appears that the consequence is that it would not exist.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyis mi reg go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyis mi reg go //
translated: Therefore, it does not touch with its entire self.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig reg na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig reg na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if it touches in one part,

original: 'ga' zhig dag gis reg cing 'ga' zhig dag gis mi reg na cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dag gis reg cing 'ga' zhig dag gis mi reg na cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if it touches in some parts and does not touch in other parts, it follows that it has parts.

original: gal te mi reg na reg pa'i mtshan nyid can thogs pa las sgra 'byung bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gal te mi reg na reg pa'i mtshan nyid can thogs pa las sgra 'byung bar mthong ste /
translated: If they do not touch, then sound would arise from what does not obstruct, since that which obstructs has the characteristic of touching.

original: 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: How then is sound established?

original: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma yin zhing /
translated: If sound is not established by all of itself,

original: phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin phan tshun ma reg pas thogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgra 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin phan tshun ma reg pas thogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgra 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: and also not by part, since they do not touch each other and are unobstructed, how is sound established?

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes zer ba ni kha che ba rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes zer ba ni kha che ba rnams so //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: Because of that.

original: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab kyi phan tshun mi reg pa de nyid kyi phyir sgra 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab kyi phan tshun mi reg pa de nyid kyi phyir sgra 'grub bo //
translated: Because subtle particles do not touch each other, sound is established.

original: gal te reg na ni la cha la la cha gzhag ltar lag pas lag pa la bsnun na yang 'bying bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te reg na ni la cha la la cha gzhag ltar lag pas lag pa la bsnun na yang 'bying bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they touch, then when one hand strikes another hand, or one foot strikes another foot, they would sink into each other,

original: gcig par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gcig par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because they would become one.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore obstruction would be lost.

original: de med na thogs pa med pas gang las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na thogs pa med pas gang las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, then since they are unobstructed, from what would sound arise?

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa'i dus mi 'thad pas gzegs zan pa ltar ldan pa las sgra 'byung bar khas blang bar yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa'i dus mi 'thad pas gzegs zan pa ltar ldan pa las sgra 'byung bar khas blang bar yang mi bya ste /
translated: Since sound is momentary, it is untenable that it possesses sound. Therefore, one should not accept that sound arises from conjunction, as the Samkhya school does.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gsung rab las byung ba dag kho na la ldan pa'i ming ngam phrad pa'i ming btags so //
analyzed: gsung rab las byung ba dag kho na la ldan pa'i ming ngam phrad pa'i ming btags so //
translated: The name conjunction or contact is imputed to that which occurs in the scriptures.

original: 'byung ba bzhi tshan 'ga' zhig gis ni 'byung ba'i khyad par gzhan 'dab chags su skyed pa na /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi tshan 'ga' zhig gis ni 'byung ba'i khyad par gzhan 'dab chags su skyed pa na /
translated: When a group of four primary elements generates another specific primary element in a continuous series,

original: gang zhig sgra skyed par byed par 'byar pa phrad pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob la /üîΩde dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas 'dir ci ste mi dpyod /
analyzed: gang zhig sgra skyed par byed par 'byar pa phrad pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob la / de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas 'dir ci ste mi dpyod /
translated: that which generates sound obtains the name conjunction or contact.

original: ji ltar bsags pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar bsags pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Why do you not investigate that sound arises from that and is simultaneously generated with it?

original: bsags pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: bsags pa ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is a collection?

original: bong ba dang so phag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bong ba dang so phag la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is a collection of clods of earth, bricks and so on.

original: de dag gi rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ma 'byar ba'i phyir brgyab na bye ma 'dus pa bzhin ji ltar mi 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gi rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ma 'byar ba'i phyir brgyab na bye ma 'dus pa bzhin ji ltar mi 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: Why would they not disintegrate when struck, like a pile of sand?

original: rlung gi khams kyis gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyis gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: They do not disintegrate because they are held together by the wind element.

original: gal te rlung gi khams kyis brdabs pa'i dngos po rnams la yang 'bral ba'i rgyu ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rlung gi khams kyis brdabs pa'i dngos po rnams la yang 'bral ba'i rgyu ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If so, then would not the wind element also be the cause of their separation?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di ni gcig pu nges pa med de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'di ni gcig pu nges pa med de /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: This is not definite for any one thing.

original: sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis byung ba'i rlung gi khams kha cig ni 'jig par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis byung ba'i rlung gi khams kha cig ni 'jig par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Some wind elements arise through the power of sentient beings‚Äô karma and cause destruction.

original: @93a * // dper na 'jig pa'i tshe'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: @93a * // dper na 'jig pa'i tshe'i lta bu'o //
translated: For example, at the time of destruction.

original: kha cig ni 'dzin par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dzin par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Some cause holding together.

original: dper na chags pa'i tshe lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na chags pa'i tshe lta bu ste /
translated: For example, at the time of formation.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The same applies to other things.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun mi reg na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun mi reg na /
translated: If subtle particles do not mutually contact each other,

original: da ni ji ltar 'dab chags par phrad pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'dab chags par phrad pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Now, how is it that they contact each other?

original: phan tshun phrad pa med par 'dab chags pa nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: phan tshun phrad pa med par 'dab chags pa nyid mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that they contact each other without mutual contact.

original: de dag gi dbus na cung zad kyang med pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dbus na cung zad kyang med pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever in between them.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan no //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan no //
translated: The form of light, etc. is different.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩnyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg gam /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i don to // nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg gam /
translated: Also means moreover.

original: phyogs gcig gis reg ces nyes pa brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis reg ces nyes pa brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: There is no fault means that the fault is stated as to whether they contact each other by their whole or by a part.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: da ni ji ltar 'dab chags par phrad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de nyes pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'dab chags par phrad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de nyes pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: There is no fault in what was said, beginning with ‚ÄúNow, how is it that they contact each other?‚Äù

original: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having done so means

original: gal te 'dus pa rnams phan tshun reg pa na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa rnams phan tshun reg pa na'o //
translated: if the aggregates contact each other.

original: ci reg pa'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci reg pa'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the cause of contact?

original: gang la reg pa rgyur yod pa de ni reg pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: gang la reg pa rgyur yod pa de ni reg pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: That which has contact as its cause is caused by contact.

original: reg pa zhig skye'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg pa zhig skye'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúContact arises‚Äù means

original: gang zhig gzhan gyis reg pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyis reg pa'o //
translated: that which is contacted by another.

original: ma reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúCaused by non-contact‚Äù meansüîΩthat which has non-contact as its cause.

original: reg pa rgyur gang la yod pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: reg pa rgyur gang la yod pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase is to be analyzed in this way.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni phan tshun ma reg pas ma reg pa'o//
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni phan tshun ma reg pas ma reg pa'o//
translated: The atoms are not contacted by each other, so they are non-contact.

original: rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the cause‚Äù means

original: reg pa'am ma reg pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: reg pa'am ma reg pa yang rung ste /
translated: whether there is contact or not,

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni de'i rgyu ste /
translated: that which is the cause of something is its cause.

original: rgyu'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: This is said because of the cause.

original: res 'ga' zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes‚Äù means

original: gang gi tshe bsags pa zhig rdul phra rab kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa de'i tshe reg pa'i rgyu can gyi ma reg pa skye'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsags pa zhig rdul phra rab kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa de'i tshe reg pa'i rgyu can gyi ma reg pa skye'o //
translated: when an accumulation becomes the state of an atom, then non-contact caused by contact arises.

original: res 'ga' ni ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes contact caused by non-contact arises,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams bsags par ma gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams bsags par ma gyur pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When the subtle particles have not accumulated,

original: ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyi reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyi reg par 'gyur te /
translated: contact arises from non-contact.

original: dper na kha ba bzhin no //üîΩde ni steng nas ma reg pa ltung zhing /
analyzed: dper na kha ba bzhin no // de ni steng nas ma reg pa ltung zhing /
translated: For example, like snow.üîΩIt falls without touching the ground,

original: sa la bab nas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la bab nas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: and when it lands on the ground, it touches.

original: res 'ga' ni reg pa'i rgyu can gyi reg pa skye ste zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang gi tshe bsags pa dang ldan pa bsags pa ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni reg pa'i rgyu can gyi reg pa skye ste zhes bya ba la / gang gi tshe bsags pa dang ldan pa bsags pa ste /
translated: Sometimes contact arises from contact.üîΩWhen the accumulated particles are combined,

original: 'dus pa rnams 'dus pa de'i tshe ni reg pa'i rgyu can gyi reg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus pa rnams 'dus pa de'i tshe ni reg pa'i rgyu can gyi reg par 'gyur te /
translated: contact arises from contact.

original: dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu gnyis 'dus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'ji ba'i gong bu gnyis 'dus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like two lumps of clay combined.

original: res 'ga' ni ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyi ma reg pa skye ste /üîΩdper na nyi zer gyi rdul lta bu'o//
analyzed: res 'ga' ni ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyi ma reg pa skye ste / dper na nyi zer gyi rdul lta bu'o//
translated: Sometimes non-contact arises from non-contact.

original: @93b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @93b zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, like the particles of sunlight.

original: nyi zer gyi rdul ni rgyun gyi skad cig gnyis pa ma phrad pa'i rgyu can ma 'phrad pa ste /
analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul ni rgyun gyi skad cig gnyis pa ma phrad pa'i rgyu can ma 'phrad pa ste /
translated: The particles of sunlight in the second moment of the continuum arise from non-contact, without meeting.

original: de ni phan tshun mi reg pas ma reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun mi reg pas ma reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called non-contact because the two do not touch each other.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa dang 'gal ba la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa dang 'gal ba la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of the contradiction of momentary destruction is stated:

original: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it would remain in the next moment.

original: reg pa'i skad cig na skyes pa'i skad cig pas 'phyi ba yin te /
analyzed: reg pa'i skad cig na skyes pa'i skad cig pas 'phyi ba yin te /
translated: The moment of birth in the moment of contact is later,

original: bdag nyid thob ma thag tu phan tshun reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thob ma thag tu phan tshun reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obtains its own nature immediately after, and then contacts the other.

original: skad cig mar gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not remain in a moment,

original: de'i phyir reg pa'i dus su 'gag pa'i phyir mi reg go //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa'i dus su 'gag pa'i phyir mi reg go //
translated: therefore it does not contact because it ceases at the time of contact.

original: btsun pa na re ni reg pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: btsun pa na re ni reg pa ni med kyi /
translated: The Bhadanta says: There is no contact,

original: 'dab chags pa la reg go snyam du 'du shes par zad do zhes zer ro//
analyzed: 'dab chags pa la reg go snyam du 'du shes par zad do zhes zer ro//
translated: but there is the perception of contact in the case of proximity.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs las 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs las 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system?

original: 'di ni gzugs 'ba' zhig nyid du ma zad kyi bar du nam mkha' yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs 'ba' zhig nyid du ma zad kyi bar du nam mkha' yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Not only is this form not accepted, but space is also not accepted.

original: btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par bya'o zhes zer ba ni bstan bcos mkhan po'o //
analyzed: btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par bya'o zhes zer ba ni bstan bcos mkhan po'o //
translated: The author of the treatise says that the Bhadanta‚Äôs system should be accepted.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /üîΩbtsun pa'i lugs 'dod par yang mi bya la /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re / btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par yang mi bya la /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: sdang bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdang bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should neither accept nor reject the Venerable‚Äôs system.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: btsa' bar bya ste /
analyzed: btsa' bar bya ste /
translated: One should analyze it.

original: gal te 'di dag la bar cung zad med na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag la bar cung zad med na /
translated: If there is not the slightest interval between these particles,

original: de ltar na cha shas dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na cha shas dang bcas pa'am /
translated: then they would have parts or they would occupy the same place.

original: go gcig par 'gyur ro zhes nyes pa snga ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ji ltar btsun pa'i lugs 'dod ces zer ro //
analyzed: go gcig par 'gyur ro zhes nyes pa snga ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ji ltar btsun pa'i lugs 'dod ces zer ro //
translated: Since they do not escape the previous errors, how can one accept the Venerable‚Äôs system?

original: 'dir bstan bcos mkhan po btsun pa'i lugs la rjes su yi rang ba'i rgyu smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mkhan po btsun pa'i lugs la rjes su yi rang ba'i rgyu smra ba ni /
translated: Here, the author of the treatise states the reason for rejoicing in the Venerable‚Äôs system:

original: de ltar ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it were not so, etc.

original: gal te btsun pa'i lugs las gzhan du rdul phra rab kyi bar dag tu nam mkha' 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te btsun pa'i lugs las gzhan du rdul phra rab kyi bar dag tu nam mkha' 'dod na'o //
translated: If space were asserted to be between the particles, other than the Venerable‚Äôs system,

original: bar stong pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bar stong pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the intervals, etc.

original: gzugs gzhan gyis ma bkag pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: gzugs gzhan gyis ma bkag pa dag tu'o //
translated: means in the spaces that are not obstructed by other forms.

original: 'gro ba la 'gog pa ni thogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba la 'gog pa ni thogs pa ste /
translated: Obstruction to movement is contact.

original: de ni rdul phra rab kyi bar stong pa dag la mi rigs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab kyi bar stong pa dag la mi rigs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not possible for the space-like subtle particles, and so the quality of being obstructive is lost.

original: yang 'dus pa rnams ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir reg par 'gyur bas zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: yang 'dus pa rnams ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir reg par 'gyur bas zhes gang smras pa /
translated: Again, you say that the composite is tangible because it has parts.

original: de'i lan smras pa /
analyzed: de'i lan smras pa /
translated: We reply:

original: ji skad du bye brag pa rnams yan lag dag las yan lag can no zhes smras pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa dag gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bye brag pa rnams yan lag dag las yan lag can no zhes smras pa ltar rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa dag gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The composite is not different from the subtle particles, just as the whole is not different from the parts, as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas say.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rdul phra rab de dag kho na bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag kho na bsags pa yin no //
translated: It is just the aggregation of subtle particles.

original: reg pa yin te dper na gzugs su rung ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg pa yin te dper na gzugs su rung ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is tangible, just as it is visible, for example.

original: rdul phra rab phan tshun @94a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab phan tshun @94a * //
translated: The subtle particles are tangible only in relation to each other,

original: ltos pa rnams kho na gzugs su rung gi / med pa'i phyir 'dus pa ni ma yin pa /
analyzed: ltos pa rnams kho na gzugs su rung gi / med pa'i phyir 'dus pa ni ma yin pa /
translated: but not in an aggregation, because they do not have parts.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa kho na la reg gi 'dus pa dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa kho na la reg gi 'dus pa dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the aggregation of subtle particles is tangible, but not the aggregation of tangibles.

original: 'dus pa rnams rdul phra rab kyi las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa rnams rdul phra rab kyi las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the collections of atoms are not different in terms of their activity.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams las 'dres par 'gyur ba dang / cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi nyes pa so na 'dug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams las 'dres par 'gyur ba dang / cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi nyes pa so na 'dug pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the fault of atoms being mixed together and having parts remains.

original: 'on te / phyogs gcig gis reg na ni cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na zhes gang smras pa de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te / phyogs gcig gis reg na ni cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na zhes gang smras pa de la bshad pa ni /
translated: But if you say that they touch in one part, then the fault of having parts would follow.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs tha dad par rtog na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs tha dad par rtog na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: If you imagine that atoms have different parts, then.

original: phyogs chas tha dad pa ni phyogs tha dad pa ste /üîΩshar ni gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: phyogs chas tha dad pa ni phyogs tha dad pa ste / shar ni gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: Different parts are different directions.üîΩThe east is different,

original: nub kyang gzhan nyid yin /üîΩsteng ni gzhan nyid du yin zhing /
analyzed: nub kyang gzhan nyid yin / steng ni gzhan nyid du yin zhing /
translated: the west is different,üîΩthe top is different,

original: 'og gi bar du gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'og gi bar du gzhan yin no //
translated: and the bottom is different.

original: de ltar na phyogs cha tha dad pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir reg pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs cha tha dad pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir reg pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Since they have different parts in this way, not only do they touch,

original: ma reg pa yang cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma reg pa yang cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not touch, it would follow that it has parts.

original: gal te phyogs cha tha dad par rtog pa ma yin na ni reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phyogs cha tha dad par rtog pa ma yin na ni reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not conceived as having different parts, then it would not follow that it touches.

original: gang du zhe na /üîΩcha shas dang bcas pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: gang du zhe na / cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du ste /
translated: Where?üîΩIn having parts.

original: go gcig par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: go gcig par ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not have the same location.

original: ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thal bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because it would not follow that it has parts.

original: phyogs cha tha dad par brjod pa ni cha shas dang bcas par brjod pa'i rnam grangs yin no //üîΩmyur du 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni lta ba de dang / nyan pa'i bye brag myur du 'jug pas so //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad par brjod pa ni cha shas dang bcas par brjod pa'i rnam grangs yin no // myur du 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni lta ba de dang / nyan pa'i bye brag myur du 'jug pas so //
translated: Having different parts is a synonym for having parts.üîΩBecause it quickly engages its object, like a firebrand

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: is seen as a wheel.

original: dper na yul gzhan du myur du 'jug pas mgal me la 'khor lo'i blor 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yul gzhan du myur du 'jug pas mgal me la 'khor lo'i blor 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, because it quickly engages another place, a firebrand is seen as a wheel.

original: 'on te mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhig la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhig la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, if it is equal or not equal to its object,

original: rgun 'bru la sogs pa mthong na ni mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rgun 'bru la sogs pa mthong na ni mnyam pa'o //
translated: if it sees a grape, it is equal to it.

original: skra'i rtse mo dang ri la sogs pa mthong ba ni mi mnyam ba la'o snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo dang ri la sogs pa mthong ba ni mi mnyam ba la'o snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that the seeing of the tip of the hair and the mountain, etc. is unequal.

original: dbang po rdul phra rab rnams ji snyed pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbang po rdul phra rab rnams ji snyed pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: To the extent that there are sense-faculty atoms, etc.

original: sna la sogs pa dag gis ni dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag pas ches lhag pa'i yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams mi rtogs so //üîΩ'di ltar dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni yul ches chung ba la yang de snyed cig byed pa dang bcas kyi /
analyzed: sna la sogs pa dag gis ni dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag pas ches lhag pa'i yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams mi rtogs so // 'di ltar dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni yul ches chung ba la yang de snyed cig byed pa dang bcas kyi /
translated: The sense faculties such as the nose do not cognize objects that are composed of atoms that are greater in number than the sense-faculty atoms.

original: ches chung pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ches chung pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the sense-faculty atoms function in regard to the smallest object, but not in regard to a smaller object.

original: de lta na de dag yul dang phrad pa nyid du 'grub kyi /
analyzed: de lta na de dag yul dang phrad pa nyid du 'grub kyi /
translated: If they did, they would not be established as contacting their objects.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, they would not be.

original: mig dang rna ba dag gis ma nges par smras pas snga ma dag las ni mnyam pa kho na 'dzin no zhes bya bar smras @94b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag gis ma nges par smras pas snga ma dag las ni mnyam pa kho na 'dzin no zhes bya bar smras @94b par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the eye and ear were mentioned as indeterminate, it is said that the former, i.e., the nose, tongue and body, grasp only equal objects.

original: res 'ga' ni chung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni chung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Sometimes they are smaller, etc.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is said:

original: yul ma nges pa'i phyir lhag par 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: yul ma nges pa'i phyir lhag par 'dzin gyi /
translated: because the object is not determined.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar myur du 'jug pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not mean that the mind engages quickly, like the circle of a firebrand.

original: mig phye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig phye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúmerely by opening the eyes,‚Äù

original: cam smos pa ni myur du rgyu bar rtogs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cam smos pa ni myur du rgyu bar rtogs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: where the word merely is to refute the idea that the mind engages quickly.

original: de bzhin du rna bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Similarly, the text says, ‚Äúmerely by opening the ears,‚Äù

original: res 'ga' ni chung ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni chung ste /
translated: sometimes the sound is small,

original: gang gi tshe sbrang bu'i sgra thos ba na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbrang bu'i sgra thos ba na'o //
translated: as when one hears the sound of a mosquito.

original: res 'ga' ni che ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni che ste /
translated: Sometimes the sound is large,

original: gang gi tshe 'brug gi sgra thos pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'brug gi sgra thos pa na'o //
translated: as when one hears the sound of thunder.

original: sgra la res 'ga' ni mnyam ste zhes ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: sgra la res 'ga' ni mnyam ste zhes ni mi brjod do //
translated: But one does not say that sometimes the sound is equal,

original: tshad nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad nges par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the size is not determined.

original: yang na ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should say that

original: gang gi tshe rna ba'i nang du sgra thos pa de'i tshe mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rna ba'i nang du sgra thos pa de'i tshe mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: when one hears a sound inside the ear, then the sound is equal, because it is the same distance from the ear-drum on both sides.

original: yid kyis ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyis ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How does the mental faculty apprehend?

original: de'i phyir yid ni lus can ma yin pa kho na bas zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩtshad ni lus can gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir na yid la tshad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid ni lus can ma yin pa kho na bas zhes bya ba smos te / tshad ni lus can gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir na yid la tshad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe mental faculty is not a physical object.‚Äù

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the physical body is a substance that has size, the mental faculty does not have size because it is not a physical object.

original: de'i phyir 'di la tshad mi dpyod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la tshad mi dpyod do //
translated: Therefore, its size cannot be measured.

original: dbang po nyams pa rnams la rten yod kyang gzugs mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa rnams la rten yod kyang gzugs mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Even though those whose faculties are impaired have a physical body, they do not see visible form.

original: mig la sogs pa dag rten las gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya bar nges mod kyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag rten las gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya bar nges mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the eye faculty and so on are different from their physical supports.

original: de dag ngag tu'am ji ltar gnas pa ni ma nges pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ngag tu'am ji ltar gnas pa ni ma nges pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: However, it is not certain that they exist in the form of speech.

original: yang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa 'di dag gi zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa 'di dag gi zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the root text asks, ‚ÄúWhere are the eye faculty and so on located?‚Äù

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye faculty and so on are not located in the eye and so on because they are not visible.

original: 'di dag gi gnas tshul rnam par gzhag par dka' mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di dag gi gnas tshul rnam par gzhag par dka' mod kyi /
translated: It is difficult to determine the location of these faculties.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams yul tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnams skye ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar gang dag ji ltar gnas pa de brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams yul tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnams skye ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar gang dag ji ltar gnas pa de brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Since those that are obstructed exist in different places and those that are assembled are born, it is necessary to state how they exist.

original: re zhig mig gi rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig mig gi rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: First, the atoms of the eye sense faculty exist in the eye sense base,

original: mig gi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: mig gi 'bras bu ste /
translated: which is the eye sense faculty.

original: rno mig gi kor ling la go snyod kyi me tog bzhin du yul mngon du phyogs par gnas so //
analyzed: rno mig gi kor ling la go snyod kyi me tog bzhin du yul mngon du phyogs par gnas so //
translated: They exist facing the object, like the petals of a jasmine flower.

original: go snyod kyi me tog smos pa ni phan tshun ma 'brel bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go snyod kyi me tog smos pa ni phan tshun ma 'brel bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of jasmine flowers is to indicate that they are not mutually connected.

original: phan tshun du ma 'brel ba'i phyir 'gyes par thal zhes bya ba'i dgos pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun du ma 'brel ba'i phyir 'gyes par thal zhes bya ba'i dgos pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: To prevent the consequence that they would disperse because they are not mutually connected,

original: kha dog dangs pas bkag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kha dog dangs pas bkag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThey are held together by the clear light element.‚Äù

original: kha dog dangs pa smos pa ni shel ltar lta ba'i gegs bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dangs pa smos pa ni shel ltar lta ba'i gegs bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of clear light is to rule out the hindrance of seeing them like crystal.

original: bla 'og nas gnas na nang ma rnams la sgrib par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / phan tshun @95a * //
analyzed: bla 'og nas gnas na nang ma rnams la sgrib par 'gyur ro zhe na / de'i phyir / phan tshun @95a * //
translated: If they were located above and below, they would obscure the internal organs.üîΩTherefore it is said,

original: mi sgrib bo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi sgrib bo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: they do not obscure each other.

original: shel gyi cha shas dag ni phan tshun mi sgrib ste /
analyzed: shel gyi cha shas dag ni phan tshun mi sgrib ste /
translated: The parts of a crystal do not obscure each other.

original: phan tshun sgrib na shel gyis sgrib pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun sgrib na shel gyis sgrib pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did obscure each other, the crystal would not hold the form that is obscured.

original: rna 'brug gi nang na gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rna 'brug gi nang na gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is located in the ear-holes.

original: rna 'brug ni rna khung du bu ga'i bar ro //
analyzed: rna 'brug ni rna khung du bu ga'i bar ro //
translated: The ear-holes are the holes in the ears.

original: gang zhig gro shog gi kha dog gi rnam pa can de ni 'gro ba dang 'dra bas rna 'brug ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gro shog gi kha dog gi rnam pa can de ni 'gro ba dang 'dra bas rna 'brug ste /
translated: That which has the color-form of parchment is like a goiter, and is located in the ear-holes.

original: de'i nang na gnas so //üîΩmtshul pa'i nang na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i nang na gnas so // mtshul pa'i nang na zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is located in the nose.

original: sna'i nang na rten dang 'dra bar kha thur du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: sna'i nang na rten dang 'dra bar kha thur du bltas pa'o //
translated: The nose is like a support located in the nose, with its mouth facing downward.

original: dbang po dang po gsum ni phreng ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba ni mnyam por tshar du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang po gsum ni phreng ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba ni mnyam por tshar du gnas pa ste /
translated: The first three faculties are located like a garland, that is, they are located in a straight line.

original: de dag gi rten rnams phreng ba dang 'dra bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rten rnams phreng ba dang 'dra bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bases of those sense faculties are arranged like a garland.

original: ji ltar lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams zla ba kham pa lta bur gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams zla ba kham pa lta bur gnas she na /
translated: How are the atoms of the tongue sense faculty arranged like the half moon?

original: lce'i dbus na skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam zhig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lce'i dbus na skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam zhig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúin the middle of the tongue, the size of the tip of a fingernail.

original: ma khebs pa ni ma khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ma khebs pa ni ma khyab pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù Uncovered means not covered.

original: grag go'i sgra ni lung yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag go'i sgra ni lung yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúit is said‚Äù is stated to indicate that this is scriptural authority.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The atoms of the body sense faculty are distributed over the entire body.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bo nas lus kyi mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bo nas lus kyi mthar thug pa ste /
translated: From the toes to the extremities of the body.

original: thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it pervades all.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: lus bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lus bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúit is situated like the body.‚Äù

original: ser skya ba dag ni 'doms ni lus kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: ser skya ba dag ni 'doms ni lus kyi dbang po ste /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of the Western Region say, ‚ÄúThe body sense faculty is the interior of the body.

original: rma tsam zhig go zhes bya bar log par rtogs te /
analyzed: rma tsam zhig go zhes bya bar log par rtogs te /
translated: It is merely a wound.‚Äù

original: de dgag par bya ba'i phyir rnga'i sbubs lta bu yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dgag par bya ba'i phyir rnga'i sbubs lta bu yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To refute that, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf it were like the interior of a drum.‚Äù

original: lus kyi khams las don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi khams las don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is not a different object of experience than the body element.

original: pho'i dbang po ni rten tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: pho'i dbang po ni rten tsam ma yin te /
translated: The male faculty is not merely a support.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: mthe bo ltar gnas so //
analyzed: mthe bo ltar gnas so //
translated: It is like a thumb in size.

original: de yang lus kyi khams las don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang lus kyi khams las don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is also not a different object of experience than the body element.

original: de la mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe atoms of the eye faculty‚Äù and so on.

original: res 'ga' ni thams cad brten pa dang bcas pa dag yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni thams cad brten pa dang bcas pa dag yin te /
translated: Sometimes all of them are supported.

original: gang gi tshe phrad par 'dod pas 'dzin par 'dod pa'i dbang po la lta ba na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phrad par 'dod pas 'dzin par 'dod pa'i dbang po la lta ba na ste /
translated: This occurs when one wishes to see an object that one desires to grasp.

original: de'i tshe thams cad brten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad brten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, all of the atoms of the eye faculty are supported.

original: res 'ga' ni de dag mtshungs pa dag yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni de dag mtshungs pa dag yin te /
translated: Sometimes they are equal.

original: gang gi tshe gnyid log pa dang / mig btsums par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyid log pa dang / mig btsums par gyur pa na'o //
translated: This occurs when one is asleep or when one‚Äôs eyes are closed.

original: res 'ga' ni kha cig brten pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni kha cig brten pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Sometimes some of them are supported.

original: gang gi tshe phrad par 'dod pa med par 'dod rgyal du lta ba na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phrad par 'dod pa med par 'dod rgyal du lta ba na ste /
translated: When one wishes to see at will without wishing to make contact,

original: de'i tshe na kha cig brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe na kha cig brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: at that time, some are supported,

original: kha cig de dang mtshungs pa dag go //
analyzed: kha cig de dang mtshungs pa dag go //
translated: some are similar to that.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The atoms of the body facultyüîΩare not all supported, because they are extremely numerous.

original: shin tu mang ba'i phyir phrad par @95b 'dod pas gzung bar 'dod pa'i dngos po la yang thams cad brten pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu mang ba'i phyir phrad par @95b 'dod pas gzung bar 'dod pa'i dngos po la yang thams cad brten pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even in the case of an object that one wishes to grasp by desiring to make contact with it, not all atoms are supported.

original: dmyal ba dag ni brten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dmyal ba dag ni brten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that those in hell are supported,üîΩthen it is said:

original: de'i phyir rab tu 'bar ba'i dmyal ba'i nang na gnas pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu 'bar ba'i dmyal ba'i nang na gnas pa rnams la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even those who dwell in the blazing hellsüîΩare not all supported.

original: re zhig dmyal ba na yang thams cad brten pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dmyal ba na yang thams cad brten pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: Even in hell, not all are supported.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause for that is stated:

original: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa bskyed na ni lus zhig par 'gyur lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa bskyed na ni lus zhig par 'gyur lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If all of them were to generate consciousness, the body would disintegrate.

original: lo'i sgra ni der lus mi 'jig pa ni las kyis gzung ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni der lus mi 'jig pa ni las kyis gzung ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù means that the body does not disintegrate there because it is held together by karma.

original: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa mi bskyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa mi bskyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o//
translated: It does not mean that all of them do not generate consciousness.

original: dbang po'i rdul phra rab bam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rdul phra rab bam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe atoms of the sense faculties . . . ‚Äù

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir rten dang dmigs par mi srid do //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir rten dang dmigs par mi srid do //
translated: The sense faculties are not possible as supports or objects because they are beyond the range of the five collections of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi rten dang dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi rten dang dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúBecause the supports and objects of the five collections of consciousness are aggregated.‚Äù

original: rten bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten bsags pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa bsags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supports are aggregated and the objects are aggregated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab bam yul gyi rdul phra rab gcig gis rnam par shes pa skyed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab bam yul gyi rdul phra rab gcig gis rnam par shes pa skyed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because a single atom of the sense faculty or a single atom of the object does not generate consciousness.

original: yid ni gcig pu zhig kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid ni gcig pu zhig kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du 'gyur la /
translated: The mental faculty alone is the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: chos gcig dang du ma yang yin pas lnga po dag gi zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: chos gcig dang du ma yang yin pas lnga po dag gi zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: Since one dharma is both singular and plural, it is distinguished as being of the five.

original: bstan du med pa yang don gang gis she na /
analyzed: bstan du med pa yang don gang gis she na /
translated: By what meaning is it also said to be invisible?

original: de'i phyir / mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be because it is not seen.

original: ci mig gi rnam par shes pa nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci mig gi rnam par shes pa nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It is said, Is the eye consciousness...,

original: 'di ni rten nges par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di ni rten nges par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtsams te /
translated: This is begun in order to teach the definite basis,

original: rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in order to teach the basis.

original: tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba ni gong du drug po 'das ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'i mdo der bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba ni gong du drug po 'das ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'i mdo der bstan zin to //
translated: The basis of the last is past, it is said, has already been taught in the sutra above, The six that have just ceased.

original: tha ma'i rten ni 'das pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: tha ma'i rten ni 'das pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The final support is only past.

original: tha ma ni 'don pa'i go rims kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: tha ma ni 'don pa'i go rims kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: The final support is the mental consciousness, because of the order of recitation.

original: de'i rten ni 'das pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rten ni 'das pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Its support is only past.

original: da ltar ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: da ltar ba ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not future.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa yang yin pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa yang yin pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is also past.

original: lnga rnams kyi /
analyzed: lnga rnams kyi /
translated: The five are

original: de dag lhan cig skyes pa yin //
analyzed: de dag lhan cig skyes pa yin //
translated: co-arisen.

original: zhes smras na 'das pa'i mi rtogs la /
analyzed: zhes smras na 'das pa'i mi rtogs la /
translated: If this were stated, the past would not be understood.

original: 'das pa ni 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: The past is also intended.

original: de'i phyir yang gi sgra ni de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gi sgra ni de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is taught in order to include that.

original: de ltar na lnga po rnams kyi 'das pa dang / da ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na lnga po rnams kyi 'das pa dang / da ltar yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the five are past and present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin @96a * //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin @96a * //
translated: They are not future.

original: pas rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa yul dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa yul dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the presentation of the support is not like the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dbang po gnyis kyi rten can yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dbang po gnyis kyi rten can yin la /
translated: Therefore means because the five collections of consciousness are the support of two faculties.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi dbang po kho na'i rten can yin pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ mu dang po mig yin no zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yin gyi /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi dbang po kho na'i rten can yin pa'i phyir ro ; / mu dang po mig yin no zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yin gyi /
translated: Mental consciousness is the support of the mental faculty alone.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: The first possibility is the eye because it is the support of the eye consciousness but not its equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises simultaneously with eye consciousness and because minds and mental factors are definitely equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: The eye is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of eye consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second possibility is the immediately past mental factor of the phenomena element.

original: sems las byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po kho nar yin gyi /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po kho nar yin gyi /
translated: They are only the state of equivalent immediately preceding condition because mental factors are not the basis of consciousness.üîΩ

original: rten gyi dngos por ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: rten gyi dngos por ni ma yin no ;
translated: Mental factors are not the basis of consciousness, so they are only the equivalent immediately preceding condition, not the basis.

original: / sems las byung ba smos pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'das ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sems las byung ba smos pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro // 'das ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term mental factors is mentioned in order to exclude the dissociated formative forces.üîΩThe term immediately past is used to exclude the future.

original: de ma thag pa smos pa ni bar dang bcas pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang yin la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa smos pa ni bar dang bcas pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro // gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang yin la /
translated: The term immediately past is used to exclude those that are separated by other states.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang yin pa'o //
translated: The third is the immediately past mind, which is both the basis and the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang ma yin la /
translated: The fourth is those phenomena not mentioned, which are neither the basis nor the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not a similar immediately preceding condition.

original: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dang / rna ba la sogs pa rnams dang / sems las byung ba mi skye ba'i chos can rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dang / rna ba la sogs pa rnams dang / sems las byung ba mi skye ba'i chos can rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: These are the objects such as form, the ear and so on, the mental factors that are not produced, and unconditioned states.

original: de bzhin du gang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi rten gyi dngos por yin pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyi rten gyi dngos por yin pa de /
translated: Similarly, that which is the basis of the body consciousness is the basis of the ear consciousness.

original: de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it also the similar immediately preceding condition?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni lus yin no //
analyzed: mu dang po ni lus yin no //
translated: The first possibility is the body.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The second is the immediately past mental factor of the phenomena element.

original: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no //
translated: The third is the immediately past mental faculty.

original: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin no //
translated: The fourth possibility is phenomena not mentioned as being excluded from the explanation.üîΩThe first line of the root text states,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The similar immediately preceding condition of mental consciousness is the immediately past mind.

original: gang du sngar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor @96b ba'o ;
analyzed: gang du sngar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor @96b ba'o ;
translated: When the meaning is understood through a word seen previously, it is connected with the previous word.

original: / gang du phyi mar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba de ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: / gang du phyi mar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba de ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: When the meaning is understood through a word seen later, it is connected with the later word.

original: gang zhig rten gyi dngos por yin pa de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis dngos por yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig rten gyi dngos por yin pa de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis dngos por yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is the basis is also the object of the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i yid de ni de'i rten dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i yid de ni de'i rten dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The immediately past mind is the basis and the similar and immediately antecedent condition of that.

original: chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immediately past mental factor of the phenomena element.

original: de ni de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kho na yin gyi /
translated: That is the similar and immediately antecedent condition of that.

original: rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the basis.

original: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gnyis ka la rag lus te skye ba na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gnyis ka la rag lus te skye ba na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When eye consciousness arises, it is generated in dependence on both.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa rkyen du ma las grub pa yin bzhin du yang gnyis kho na ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa rkyen du ma las grub pa yin bzhin du yang gnyis kho na ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why is it that, although eye consciousness is produced from many conditions, only two are mentioned?

original: rten dang dmigs pa nyid kyi sgo nas rkyen ches nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa nyid kyi sgo nas rkyen ches nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and form are the most important conditions from the point of view of being the basis and object of that consciousness.

original: snang ba med kyang mtshan mo'i rgyu ba rnams dang / nam mkha' med par chu la rgyu ba rnams dang / mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang / shel gyis bar du gcad pa la mi rnams dang gnyis ka med par lha'i mig dang ldan pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de ltar /
analyzed: snang ba med kyang mtshan mo'i rgyu ba rnams dang / nam mkha' med par chu la rgyu ba rnams dang / mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang / shel gyis bar du gcad pa la mi rnams dang gnyis ka med par lha'i mig dang ldan pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de ltar /
translated: Even though there is no light, eye consciousness arises in the night; even though there is no sky, it arises in water; and even though there is no light, it arises in those who have the divine eye, which is unobstructed by crystal, glass, or clouds.

original: mig dang gzugs dag med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that there is no eye and form.

original: yid la byed pa yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skyed pa la rten thun mong ba yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug skyed pa la rten thun mong ba yin te /
translated: Attention is the common basis for the production of the six collections of consciousness.

original: mig dang gzugs ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: The eye and form are not like that.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis kho na smos pa mdzes so //üîΩde dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis kho na smos pa mdzes so // de dag gyur pas gyur nyid phyir //
translated: Therefore, it is fitting that only these two are mentioned.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are the cause of the consciousnesses and their changes.

original: de rnams gyur pa ni de dag gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams gyur pa ni de dag gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose that are transformed‚Äù are the eye, etc.

original: de dag gyur pas gyur pa de dag la yod pas na de gyur pas gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gyur pas gyur pa de dag la yod pas na de gyur pas gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe state of being transformed by those‚Äù is the state of being transformed by those that are transformed.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //üîΩde dag gyur pas gyur pa'i dngos po ni de dag gyur pas gyur nyid do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so // de dag gyur pas gyur pa'i dngos po ni de dag gyur pas gyur nyid do //
translated: They are the eye consciousnesses, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe state of being transformed by those that are transformed‚Äù is the state of being transformed by that.

original: de dag gyur pas nyid de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas nyid de'i phyir ro //
translated: It is that because it is the state of being transformed by those that are transformed.

original: phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it conforms to benefit and harm and to clarity and lack of clarity.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag ni rkyen la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag ni rkyen la ltos pa yin la /
translated: Benefit and harm depend on conditions.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Clarity and lack of clarity are the intrinsic nature of the eye.üîΩThe suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúclarity-tva‚Äù and ‚Äúlack of clarity-tva‚Äù indicates the intrinsic nature of clarity and lack of clarity.üîΩThe suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúconforming-tva‚Äù indicates the action of conforming.

original: rjes su byed pa'i sgra ni phan pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rjes su byed pa'i sgra ni phan pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúbenefit-tva‚Äù indicates the action of benefiting.üîΩThe suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúharm-tva‚Äù indicates the action of harming.üîΩThe suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúconforming-tva‚Äù indicates the action of conforming.üîΩThe suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúclarity-tva‚Äù indicates the action of being clear.

original: mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The suffix ‚Äú-tva‚Äù in ‚Äúlack of clarity-tva‚Äù indicates the action of being unclear.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni go rims bzhin bde ba skye ba dang / sdug bsngal skye ba'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa dag la mig sman dang / rdul la sogs pa dag gis phan btags pa dang / gnod pa byas pa'i rjes su byed @97a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni go rims bzhin bde ba skye ba dang / sdug bsngal skye ba'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa dag la mig sman dang / rdul la sogs pa dag gis phan btags pa dang / gnod pa byas pa'i rjes su byed @97a * //
translated: They are also similar to the eye and so on because they are benefited and harmed by the benefit and harm to the eye and so on.

original: cing ; de bzhin du gsal ba dang mi gsal ba skyes pas gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyis kyang rjes su byed de /
analyzed: cing ; de bzhin du gsal ba dang mi gsal ba skyes pas gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid kyis kyang rjes su byed de /
translated: They are also similar to the eye and so on because they are clear and unclear due to the generation of clarity and unclarity.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag rnam par gyur pas rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag rnam par gyur pas rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore it is understood that the eye consciousness and so on are transformed by the transformation of the eye and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gyur pas de dag 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag gyur pas de dag 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But the eye and so on are not transformed by the transformation of form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gi / phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag gi / phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and so on are not similar to form and so on in terms of benefit, harm, clarity and unclarity.

original: 'di ltar gzugs gsal ba yang mig ser gyis mig nyams pa rnams kyis dung ser por mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs gsal ba yang mig ser gyis mig nyams pa rnams kyis dung ser por mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, form is clear, but those whose eyes are impaired by jaundice see a white conch as yellow.

original: rab rib la sogs pas gnod par byas pa gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas gnod par byas pa gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: And those whose eyes are impaired by cataracts and so on see hairs, flies, and so on.

original: de bzhin du mig mi gsal na gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid kyis tshang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig mi gsal na gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid kyis tshang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the eyes are not clear, form, even though complete in its own characteristics, will give rise to an unclear eye consciousness.

original: de ltar na mig gsal na gzugs mi gsal yang de'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mig gsal na gzugs mi gsal yang de'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye'o //
translated: Thus, when the eyes are clear, even though form is unclear, its consciousness will arise clearly.

original: 'dir rten gyi don ni rjes su byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rten gyi don ni rjes su byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of basis is the meaning of that which is to be followed.

original: shin tu legs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni ches legs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu legs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni ches legs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is very good means it is excellent.

original: gang la rnam par shes pa byed pa de nyid kyi de bsnyad par rigs so snyam du bsams te 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: gang la rnam par shes pa byed pa de nyid kyi de bsnyad par rigs so snyam du bsams te 'dri ba ni /
translated: Thinking that it is reasonable to call that which is the object of consciousness by the name of the consciousness itself, he asks:

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: Why is it called the eye consciousness?

original: rten gyi don bshad zin pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi don bshad zin pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since the meaning of basis has already been explained, he asks about the unsharedness:

original: ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin zhes pa'o //
translated: How is it unshared?

original: mig ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eye is not the basis of the consciousness of another.

original: gzhan nyid ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs kyang rigs tha dad pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs kyang rigs tha dad pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: Another means that even though it belongs to one‚Äôs own continuum, it is the mental consciousness because it is a different type.

original: rigs mtshungs nyid yin yang sems can gyi rten tha dad pas mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mtshungs nyid yin yang sems can gyi rten tha dad pas mig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Even though it is the same type, it is the eye consciousness because it is a different basis for sentient beings.

original: rten ma yin no //
analyzed: rten ma yin no //
translated: It is not the basis.

original: lus kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies up to the body.

original: gang gi phyir skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i gzugs la yang skye gnas bzhi la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i gzugs la yang skye gnas bzhi la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
translated: Because even the form of one abiding in one birth-source generates the eye consciousness of one abiding in four birth-sources.

original: skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i mig gis skye gnas gnyis la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi skye na /
analyzed: skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i mig gis skye gnas gnyis la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi skye na /
translated: The eye consciousness of one abiding in one birth-source does not generate the eye consciousness of one abiding in two birth-sources.

original: skye gnas bzhi la gzhan pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: skye gnas bzhi la gzhan pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention that it is different from one abiding in four birth-sources?

original: de bzhin du khams dang 'gro pa nges pa las kyang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang 'gro pa nges pa las kyang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the mental consciousness is not common to the realms and the destinies.

original: gal te yang skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa skye mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa skye mod kyi /
translated: Even though the mental consciousness of one who is in a certain realm or destiny can produce the mental consciousness of one who is in another realm or destiny,

original: gcig gis cig car skye gnas du ma la gnas pa skyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig gis cig car skye gnas du ma la gnas pa skyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it does not simultaneously produce the mental consciousness of many beings in different realms or destinies,

original: gzugs la @97b sogs pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la @97b sogs pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: just as the eye consciousness and so on do not.

original: de bzhin rten gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin rten gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de dag gis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by the word ‚Äútheir‚Äù because it is supported by the same support and is not common.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩsgra dang myu gu 'byung ba rgyu du ma la rag las pa yin yang rnga bo che dang nas gnyis thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu bzhin no zhes bya ba la / sgra dang myu gu 'byung ba rgyu du ma la rag las pa yin yang rnga bo che dang nas gnyis thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley.üîΩEven though the sound and the sprout arise in dependence on many causes,

original: rnga bo che'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes de dag gis bstan gyi /
analyzed: rnga bo che'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes de dag gis bstan gyi /
translated: the sound of the drum and the sprout of barley are taught by the word ‚Äútheir‚Äù because the drum and the barley are not common.

original: rnga lcag la sogs pa dag dang / chu la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: rnga lcag la sogs pa dag dang / chu la sogs pa dag ni /
translated: The stick and so on that beat the drum and the water and so on that produce the sproutüîΩare not taught by the word ‚Äútheir.‚Äù

original: rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra dag dang / s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa dag la yang thun mong ma yin pas rnga lcag gi sgra chu'i myu gu zhes de dag gis ma bstan to //
analyzed: rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra dag dang / s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa dag la yang thun mong ma yin pas rnga lcag gi sgra chu'i myu gu zhes de dag gis ma bstan to //
translated: The sound of a drum, etc. and the sprout of rice, etc. are not taught by that, because they are not specific.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they are not specific.

original: /'on kyang rnga bo che'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes bstan to //
analyzed: /'on kyang rnga bo che'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes bstan to //
translated: But the sound of a drum is taught as the sprout of rice.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, here also, it is the consciousness of the eye, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the consciousness of form, etc.

original: yang lus gang la gnas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang lus gang la gnas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, in regard to the question, ‚ÄúIn dependence upon what body does it exist?,‚Äù

original: yang gi sgra ni dbang du bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni dbang du bya ba'i don to //
translated: the word ‚Äúmoreover‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúunder one‚Äôs control.‚Äù

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa'am ;üîΩbsam gtan dang po'am /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa'am ; bsam gtan dang po'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence upon what‚Äù means in dependence upon a body belonging to the desire realm,üîΩor the first,

original: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am /
translated: second, third,

original: bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: or fourth meditative absorptions.

original: ci lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In regard to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the body like?,‚Äù etc.,

original: ci lus 'dod par gtogs na mig dang / gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dag kyang 'dod par gtogs pa kho na yin pa nas de bzhin du lus bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na /
analyzed: ci lus 'dod par gtogs na mig dang / gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dag kyang 'dod par gtogs pa kho na yin pa nas de bzhin du lus bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na /
translated: If the body belongs to the desire realm, then the eyes, form and consciousness also belong to the desire realm alone.üîΩ

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du yin pa zhig gam /
