original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rdzas dgu'i bdag nyid can rnams las yid kyi dbang po ma gtogs pa gzhan rdzas brgyad do //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rdzas dgu'i bdag nyid can rnams las yid kyi dbang po ma gtogs pa gzhan rdzas brgyad do //
translated: The faculties are nine substances, consisting of the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, etc. Eight of these are substances, excluding the mental faculty.

original: mig la sogs pa lnga ni rang gi mig gis smos so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lnga ni rang gi mig gis smos so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five beginning with the eye are mentioned by their own names.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga @101b ni dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams lnga @101b ni dbang po lnga ste /
translated: The five elements of the eye, etc., are the five faculties.

original: mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nas lus kyi dbang po'i bar ro //
translated: The faculty of the eye is the faculty of the eye, and so on up to the faculty of the body.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis ni lus kyi khams kyi phyogs yin te /
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis ni lus kyi khams kyi phyogs yin te /
translated: The two faculties of male and female are parts of the element of touch.

original: gang gi phyir pho'i khams dang / mo'i khams gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'og nas 'chad do zhes bya ba ni /üîΩlus las pho dang mo dbang dag / ces bya ba de nas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pho'i khams dang / mo'i khams gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // 'og nas 'chad do zhes bya ba ni / lus las pho dang mo dbang dag / ces bya ba de nas so //
translated: Because there is no other element of male and female.üîΩThe remaining five elements

original: lhag ma khams lnga po dag ces bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma khams lnga po dag ces bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams dag go //
translated: are the five elements of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: chos kyis khams kyi phyogs ni dbang po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po bcu gcig ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyis khams kyi phyogs ni dbang po ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po bcu gcig ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: The factor of the element of mental objects is not a faculty, because it is not included in the eleven faculties.

original: slob dpon gang ba spel bas mdzad pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba las khams bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas dang po'i 'grel bshad do /
analyzed: slob dpon gang ba spel bas mdzad pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel bshad mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba las khams bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas dang po'i 'grel bshad do /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the first chapter of the Abhidharmakosa, having the nature of an exposition of the elements.

original: // / dbang po rnams bshad pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / dbang po rnams bshad pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculties have been explained.

original: gar bshad ce na /
analyzed: gar bshad ce na /
translated: Where were they explained?

original: khams kyi mdzod kyi mthar ro //
analyzed: khams kyi mdzod kyi mthar ro //
translated: At the end of the chapter on the elements.

original: ji ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad ce na /
translated: How were they explained?

original: bsdu ba dang / rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas te /üîΩchos kyi phyed dang gang dag ni //
analyzed: bsdu ba dang / rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas te / chos kyi phyed dang gang dag ni //
translated: By way of inclusion and classification.üîΩThe half of the element of mental objects

original: bcu gnyis nang gir bshad dbang po //
analyzed: bcu gnyis nang gir bshad dbang po //
translated: and the twelve that are said to be internal are faculties.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the inclusion.

original: mig gi dbang po nas /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nas /
translated: The eye faculty up toüîΩthe final faculty of final knowledge.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang zhes bya bar ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang zhes bya bar ni rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the classification.

original: de ltar dbang po rnams bshad pa la dbang po'i don mi shes pa de'i phyir dbang po'i don ci zhe na zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po rnams bshad pa la dbang po'i don mi shes pa de'i phyir dbang po'i don ci zhe na zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: Since the faculties have been explained in this way, since one does not understand the meaning of faculty, therefore it is said: What is the meaning of faculty?

original: 'di'i sgra'i don gyi dbang du byas nas dris pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i sgra'i don gyi dbang du byas nas dris pa yin gyi /
translated: This is asked from the perspective of the meaning of the term,

original: dngos po'i don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i don ni ma yin te /
translated: but not from the perspective of the object.

original: dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa nye bar bzung nas sgra 'jug pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa nye bar bzung nas sgra 'jug pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical for a term to engage in objects that are mutually different while holding that they are not different.

original: dngos po'i don ni mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa 'ga' zhig gi ni mdzod kyi gnas dang po kho nar bstan la /
analyzed: dngos po'i don ni mig la sogs pa pho'i dbang po la thug pa 'ga' zhig gi ni mdzod kyi gnas dang po kho nar bstan la /
translated: The object of the term is taught in the first chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa itself as some of the faculties such as the eyes and so on up to the male faculty.

original: srog gi dbang po ni ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi nang nas 'chad do //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi nang nas 'chad do //
translated: The faculty of life force is explained from among the nonassociated formative factors.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi nang nas so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni sems las byung ba rnams kyi nang nas so //
translated: Faith and so on are explained from among the mental factors.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag ni dbang po'i skabs 'di nyid nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa dag ni dbang po'i skabs 'di nyid nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The faculties of pleasure, etc., and the faculty of coming to know the unknown, etc., will be explained in the section on the faculties.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i don gyi dbang du byas nas dris pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i don gyi dbang du byas nas dris pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the question is not based on the meaning of the term.

original: slob dpon yang sgra'i don kho na ston cing /
analyzed: slob dpon yang sgra'i don kho na ston cing /
translated: The Master [Vasubandhu] also teaches only the meaning of the term.

original: skad kyi dbyings kyi don yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings kyi don yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pa ni /
translated: He explains the meaning of the verbal root in the term ‚Äúfaculty‚Äù:

original: dbang ni dbang phyug dam pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang ni dbang phyug dam pa'o // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIndriya‚Äù means supreme power.

original: dngos po'i yul can gyi dri ba yin na ni 'di lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can gyi dri ba yin na ni 'di lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: If the question were based on the meaning of the term, this would not be a suitable answer.

original: de dbang byed pas na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dbang byed pas na zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it dominates‚Äù means

original: skad kyi dbyings 'di @102a * //
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings 'di @102a * //
translated: this verbal root

original: gzugs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: is to be viewed as having the meaning of ‚Äúseeing.‚Äù

original: dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: dbang byed pas na dbang po rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúIndriya‚Äù means faculty because it dominates.

original: dbang bdag byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang bdag byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúindriya‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which acts as a lord.‚Äù

original: 'dus pa 'di la dbang byed do snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: 'dus pa 'di la dbang byed do snyam du bsam mo //
translated: It is thought that it dominates this collection.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gi phyir dbang byed pas dbang po rnams yin pa de'i phyir dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang byed pas dbang po rnams yin pa de'i phyir dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
translated: Because they exercise controlling power, they are faculties. Therefore, the meaning of faculty is the meaning of controlling power.

original: gal te dbang byad pas dbang po rnams yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang byad pas dbang po rnams yin na ni /
translated: If they are faculties because they exercise controlling power,

original: dbang byed rnams so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbang byed rnams so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the meaning of faculty would be the meaning of that which exercises controlling power.

original: dbang po ni dbang byed pa'i rtags dang / dbang byed pas bsten pa dang / dbang byed pas phyung ba'o zhes bya bas 'don pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po ni dbang byed pa'i rtags dang / dbang byed pas bsten pa dang / dbang byed pas phyung ba'o zhes bya bas 'don pa'i phyir dbang po zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of faculty is that which exercises controlling power, that which is supported by that which exercises controlling power, and that which is derived from that which exercises controlling power.

original: de ltar na yang gha nya'i don brjod par bya dgos na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gha nya'i don brjod par bya dgos na /
translated: Even if that is so, the meaning of ghana must be stated.

original: de yang ma smras pas 'di ni lan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ma smras pas 'di ni lan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since that is not stated, this is not an answer.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is similar to consciousness.

original: dper na rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ni de las tha dad pa'i shes pa pos bsdus pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ni de las tha dad pa'i shes pa pos bsdus pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, it is said that consciousness is that which is aware because it is aware. This is stated in order to eliminate the notion that it is an experiencer that is separate from that.

original: la ta'i don la gus pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: la ta'i don la gus pa med par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúindriya‚Äù is not to be taken literally.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bshad pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dbang byed pa zhes bya ba dbang po las tha dad par brtags pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yin no //üîΩde'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag las tha dad pa'i dbang byed pas brtags pa gsal bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bshad pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dbang byed pa zhes bya ba dbang po las tha dad par brtags pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir yin no // de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag las tha dad pa'i dbang byed pas brtags pa gsal bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: Just as ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is explained, so too here, ‚Äúmastery‚Äù is imagined to be a distinct entity from the faculties in order to clarify the meaning of ‚Äúfaculty.‚Äù

original: don de dang de dag la dbang byed par gyur pa'i phyir dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po rnams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don de dang de dag la dbang byed par gyur pa'i phyir dbang byed pa'i don gyis na dbang po rnams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn stated that the faculties are so called because they exercise mastery over this and that object, in order to clarify the imagined mastery that is distinct from those objects.

original: lnga po rnams ni don bzhi la //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga po rnams ni don bzhi la // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five exercise mastery over four things.

original: grangs mi mnyam par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / bsnan pa ni mngon par byas pa'i phyir dang / lnga po rnams re re zhing don bzhi la dbang byed pa'i zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: grangs mi mnyam par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / bsnan pa ni mngon par byas pa'i phyir dang / lnga po rnams re re zhing don bzhi la dbang byed pa'i zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: In order to teach that the number is not the same, and in order to clarify the addition, it is understood that each of the five faculties exercises mastery over four things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: re zhig mig dang rna ba dag / ces don tha dad pa bye brag tu phye sde nya bar bkod do //
analyzed: re zhig mig dang rna ba dag / ces don tha dad pa bye brag tu phye sde nya bar bkod do //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe eye and the ear‚Äù are placed first in the verse because they are the most excellent of the sense faculties.

original: re re zhing zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩlus mdzes par byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re re zhing zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa ma yin pa'o // lus mdzes par byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúeach of them‚Äù indicate that the faculties are not combined.üîΩThe words ‚Äúthe body as the seat of beauty‚Äù are explained as follows.

original: lus ni 'dir gzugs kyi tshogs la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: lus ni 'dir gzugs kyi tshogs la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: The body is the aggregate of form.

original: mdzes pa ni gang gzung bar 'os pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mdzes pa ni gang gzung bar 'os pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Beauty is the nature of that which is to be grasped.

original: mi mdzes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzung bar 'os pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mdzes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzung bar 'os pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúbecause of the nature of ugliness‚Äù is because of the nature of that which is not to be grasped.

original: ma long ba dang ma 'on pa dag ni rten du gzung bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir lus mdzes par bya ba la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma long ba dang ma 'on pa dag ni rten du gzung bar 'os pa nyid kyi phyir lus mdzes par bya ba la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: The eye and the ear are the dominant influences in the production of beauty because the body is beautiful when it is not blind or deaf, and is fit to be grasped.

original: lus yongs su srung ba dang zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dag dbang byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lus yongs su srung ba dang zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dag dbang byed do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe body as the seat of protection‚Äù are connected with the words ‚Äúthe eye and the ear are the dominant influences.

original: srung ba ni yongs su 'dren dang 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: srung ba ni yongs su 'dren dang 'tsho ba ste /
translated: ‚Äù Protection is the preservation of life.

original: srog gi bar chad kyi rgyu yongs su spong ba'o zhes bya @102b ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog gi bar chad kyi rgyu yongs su spong ba'o zhes bya @102b ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one completely abandons the cause of an obstacle to life.

original: lus srung ba de ji ltar mig dang / rna ba dag gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: lus srung ba de ji ltar mig dang / rna ba dag gis yin zhe na /
translated: How does one protect the body through the eye and ear?

original: de'i phyir / mthong ba dang thos pa nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /üîΩgcong rong la sogs pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mthong ba dang thos pa nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / gcong rong la sogs pa mthong zhing /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúhaving seen and heard,‚Äù and so on.

original: stag la sogs pa'i sgra thos nas gcong rong la sogs pa dang / stag la sogs pa srog gi bar chad kyi rgyu yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stag la sogs pa'i sgra thos nas gcong rong la sogs pa dang / stag la sogs pa srog gi bar chad kyi rgyu yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having seen a precipice, and so on, and having heard the sound of a tiger, and so on, one completely abandons the cause of an obstacle to life, such as a precipice, and a tiger, and so on.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba ni sems las byung ba dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTogether with their associates‚Äù means together with mental factors.

original: mig dang rna ba gyur pa'i rjes su byas pas rten gyi ngo bo gnas pa'i phyir de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa la dbang byed do //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba gyur pa'i rjes su byas pas rten gyi ngo bo gnas pa'i phyir de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa la dbang byed do //
translated: Because the eye and ear are the basis of the eye and ear consciousness, the eye and ear have power over the arising of the eye and ear consciousness, since they are the support of the eye and ear consciousness.

original: gzugs lta ba dang sgra mnyan pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs lta ba dang sgra mnyan pa dag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen form and having heard sound,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs dang sgra 'dzin pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra 'dzin pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they apprehend form and sound.

original: 'di dag gi byed pa ni lus la 'dzin pa zhig 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gi byed pa ni lus la 'dzin pa zhig 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their function is to hold the body together, because they are desired.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la zhes bya ba ni yul ma 'dres pa'i yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩrna bas gzugs lta ba'am /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la zhes bya ba ni yul ma 'dres pa'i yin pa'i phyir te / rna bas gzugs lta ba'am /
translated: The reason is that they are the uncommon cause of the eye and ear consciousnesses, because they are the uncommon cause of the eye and ear consciousnesses.üîΩThe eye does not see form,

original: mig gis nyan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gis nyan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: nor does the ear hear sound.

original: ci'i phyir mig dang rna ba dag kho na gzugs lta ba dang ; sgra nyan pa dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig dang rna ba dag kho na gzugs lta ba dang ; sgra nyan pa dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Why are the eye and ear the uncommon cause of seeing form and hearing sound?üîΩThe nose, tongue, and body

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: are the uncommon cause of apprehending smell, taste, and tactility.

original: de dag las dbang po gang yang rung ba zhig nyams na yang rten gzung bar mi 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las dbang po gang yang rung ba zhig nyams na yang rten gzung bar mi 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because if any of those sense faculties is impaired, the object is not suitable to be apprehended.

original: rten nyid mdzes par bya ba la dbang byed do //üîΩzhe na / ma yin te /
analyzed: rten nyid mdzes par bya ba la dbang byed do // zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: They are the dominant condition of the beauty of the body.

original: shi ba'i gzugs mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba'i gzugs mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because a dead body is not beautiful.

original: de dag gis kham gyi zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya la /
analyzed: de dag gis kham gyi zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya la /
translated: Because they fully enjoy oral food.

original: kham gyi zas ni dri la sogs pa skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni dri la sogs pa skye mched gsum gyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Oral food is the nature of the three sense spheres of smell, etc.

original: dri la sogs pa de dag kyang sna la sogs pa dag gis yongs su longs spyod pas kham gyi zas yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir lus srung ba yin te /üîΩ'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa de dag kyang sna la sogs pa dag gis yongs su longs spyod pas kham gyi zas yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir lus srung ba yin te / 'gro ba zas kyis gnas pa yin //
translated: Since those smells, etc. are fully enjoyed by the nose, etc., the body is protected because oral food is fully enjoyed.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe world is sustained by food.‚Äù

original: sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe consciousnesses of the nose, etc.‚Äù is self-evident.

original: dri bsnam pa dang / ro myang ba dang / reg bya reg pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la dbang byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dri bsnam pa dang / ro myang ba dang / reg bya reg pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la dbang byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe state of controlling power over the uncommon cause of smelling smells, tasting tastes, and touching touchables‚Äù is as already explained.

original: bzhi rnams gnyis la'o zhes bya bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: bzhi rnams gnyis la'o zhes bya bar 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe four are in two‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: 'dir yang bsnan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang bsnan pa ste /
translated: Here, too, the text is to be supplemented.

original: re re zhing don gnyis dang / gnyis la dbang byed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: re re zhing don gnyis dang / gnyis la dbang byed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Each of the faculties is the dominant condition for two things, and the two are the dominant condition for one thing.

original: bzhi po rnams re re zhing dbang byed do //
analyzed: bzhi po rnams re re zhing dbang byed do //
translated: Each of the four faculties is the dominant condition for one thing.

original: yul dang yul can dag grangs mi mnyam pa'i phyir re re zhing yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: yul dang yul can dag grangs mi mnyam pa'i phyir re re zhing yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Since the number of objects and subjects is not the same, it is understood that each of the faculties is the dominant condition for one thing.

original: lo'i sgra ni rang gi don dang thams cad ces bya @103a * //üîΩba la sogs pa rnam grangs phyi ma gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni rang gi don dang thams cad ces bya @103a * // ba la sogs pa rnam grangs phyi ma gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúeach‚Äù clarifies the meaning of ‚Äútheir own object‚Äù and ‚Äúall,‚Äù etc.

original: sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag dang khyad par dag la dbang byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the dominant condition for the distinction and differentiation of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams mig la sogs pa ni dbang po can du mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: sems can rnams mig la sogs pa ni dbang po can du mtshungs kyang /
translated: Although sentient beings are the same in having eyes, etc.,

original: pho'o / mo'o zhes bya ba'i bye brag 'di pho dang mo'i dbang pos byas pa yin te /
analyzed: pho'o / mo'o zhes bya ba'i bye brag 'di pho dang mo'i dbang pos byas pa yin te /
translated: the distinction of male and female is made by the male and female faculties.

original: 'di ltar skal pa dang po pa rnams ni dbang po gnyis 'byung ba'i gong rol du sems can sems can zhes bya bar bye brag med par rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skal pa dang po pa rnams ni dbang po gnyis 'byung ba'i gong rol du sems can sems can zhes bya bar bye brag med par rnam par gnas la /
translated: Thus, in the beginning, when the first sentient beings appeared, they were called sentient beings without any distinction.

original: dbang po gnyis byung bas ni pho'o //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis byung bas ni pho'o //
translated: The two organs are produced in the male.

original: mo'o zhes bya ba de ltar bye brag tu gyur to //
analyzed: mo'o zhes bya ba de ltar bye brag tu gyur to //
translated: The distinction of male and female is due to the appearance of the two sex organs.üîΩThe first beings of the eon were sexless, and their bodies were like those of children of six years of age.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po gnyis byung ba'i gong rol du bskal pa dang po pa rnams kyi nu ma la sogs pa dbyibs dang / nga ro dang / spyod pa la sogs pa dag bye brag med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po gnyis byung ba'i gong rol du bskal pa dang po pa rnams kyi nu ma la sogs pa dbyibs dang / nga ro dang / spyod pa la sogs pa dag bye brag med la /
translated: Prior to the appearance of the two sex organs, the breasts of the beings of the eon did not differ from those of men, and their voices and behavior were the same.

original: dbang po byung bas nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang / nga ro dang / spyod pa la sogs pa dag bye brag yod pa de'i phyir de dag ni sems can gyi khyad par la yang dbang byed do //
analyzed: dbang po byung bas nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang / nga ro dang / spyod pa la sogs pa dag bye brag yod pa de'i phyir de dag ni sems can gyi khyad par la yang dbang byed do //
translated: But when the two sex organs appeared, the breasts of some beings developed, their voices and behavior changed, and they became women.

original: gzhan dag na re ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag la dbang byed de zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag la dbang byed de zhe'o //
translated: Others say that the faculties exercise controlling power with regard to defilement and purification.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: In fact, means for the following reason.

original: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / nyams pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / de dag dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / nyams pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dang mi ldan pa dang / de dag dang nyams pa'o //
translated: Those who are not endowed with them, or who are deficient in them, are not endowed with them, or are deficient in them.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang bral ba ni za ma rnams te /
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang bral ba ni za ma rnams te /
translated: Eunuchs are those who are devoid of either the male or female faculty.

original: 'byin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are incapable of emitting semen.

original: de dag nyams pa ni ma ning rnams te /
analyzed: de dag nyams pa ni ma ning rnams te /
translated: Neuter persons are those whose sexual organ is damaged.

original: gnod pas nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pas nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their organ is damaged by disease.

original: mtshan gnyis pa ni gnyis ka nyams pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa ni gnyis ka nyams pa ste /
translated: Those with two organs are those whose organ is damaged in both ways.

original: gnas nyams pa'i phyir dang / bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas nyams pa'i phyir dang / bde ba chung ngu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their organ is damaged in terms of location and is the cause of little pleasure.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyes par spyod pa rab dang / de'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyes par spyod pa rab dang / de'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Those who are defiled are those who engage in bad conduct and the cause of that, the afflictions.

original: de ni sdom pa ma yin pa dang / mtshams med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa de rnams med do //
analyzed: de ni sdom pa ma yin pa dang / mtshams med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa de rnams med do //
translated: They do not have negative commitments, the heinous actions, or severed roots of virtue.

original: za ma ma ning sgra mi snyan //üîΩmtshan gnyis ma gtogs mi rnams la //
analyzed: za ma ma ning sgra mi snyan // mtshan gnyis ma gtogs mi rnams la //
translated: Eunuchs, hermaphrodites, and those of KuruüîΩare not candidates for the prƒÅtimok·π£a.

original: sdom min zhes bya ba dang / za ma sogs la mi 'dod de //
analyzed: sdom min zhes bya ba dang / za ma sogs la mi 'dod de //
translated: Eunuchs and so on are not candidates for negative commitments,üîΩbecause they are not candidates for the prƒÅtimok·π£a.

original: zhes bya ba dang / skyes pa bud med kyis spyod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / skyes pa bud med kyis spyod do //
translated: They are not candidates for the heinous actions,üîΩbecause they are not candidates for the result of nonreturn.üîΩThey are not candidates for severed roots of virtue,

original: zhes bya ba dang / lta spyad ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / lta spyad ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are not candidates for the result of an arhat.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa dag dang / de dag gis kun nas bslang ba'i las rnam par 'byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa dag dang / de dag gis kun nas bslang ba'i las rnam par 'byang bar byed pas na rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: It is purification because it purifies the passions and the karma that they instigate.

original: de sdom pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba de rnams med do //
analyzed: de sdom pa dang / 'bras bu thob pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba de rnams med do //
translated: But it does not have the vows, the attainment of the fruits, or the freedom from passion.

original: gang gi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kho na @103b la yod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kho na @103b la yod kyi /
translated: Because the passions and purification exist only for men and women,

original: za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dag la med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa dag la med pa de'i phyir /
translated: not for eunuchs, neuters, or hermaphrodites.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do //
translated: Therefore, the male and female faculties control the passions and purification.

original: srog gi dbang po ni zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dir ris mthun par mtshams sbyor ba ni 'chi ba'i sred pa'i mjug thogs su srid pa bar ma dor mtshams sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni zhes bya ba la / 'dir ris mthun par mtshams sbyor ba ni 'chi ba'i sred pa'i mjug thogs su srid pa bar ma dor mtshams sbyor ba'am /
translated: The faculty of life force controls the continuity of the class and the attainment of rebirth.üîΩHere, the continuity of the class means the connection with a new rebirth, which occurs immediately after the craving for death in the intermediate existence.

original: skye ba'i srid par mtshams sbyor ba bzung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid par mtshams sbyor ba bzung ste /
translated: Or it means the attainment of rebirth.

original: gzugs med pa dag tu yang de rnyed pa yin dang skye ba nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag tu yang de rnyed pa yin dang skye ba nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also acquired in the formless realm, because one is definitely born there.

original: de'i 'og rol du ni yang dag par 'dzin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og rol du ni yang dag par 'dzin te /
translated: One takes up again after that,

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa thams cad kyang srog gi dbang po'i stobs kyis gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa thams cad kyang srog gi dbang po'i stobs kyis gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba med par mthong ngo //
translated: because it is seen that all minds, whether afflicted or virtuous, do not transmigrate from the formless realm through the power of the faculty of life force.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba dang zhes bya bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba dang zhes bya bar 'byung ste /
translated: The mental faculty is the link to rebirth,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyis yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyis yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it links to rebirth through affliction.

original: de nyid la khungs smos pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la khungs smos pa ni /
translated: The source for that is stated:üîΩWhen the gandharva enters the womb,üîΩtwo minds arise,

original: ji skad du de'i tshe dri za'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji skad du de'i tshe dri za'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: as stated in the sutra:

original: pha ma log par 'jug pa'i tshe sems gnyis pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pha ma log par 'jug pa'i tshe sems gnyis pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: At that time, when the gandharva enters the womb, two minds arise.

original: 'dis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kun tu spyod pa med par skye ba'i sred pa med pa'i phyir yid ni srid par yang mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kun tu spyod pa med par skye ba'i sred pa med pa'i phyir yid ni srid par yang mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the mental faculty has power over the linking of existence, because there is no craving for rebirth without the activity of an afflicted mind.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di la /
translated: Others explain this passage as follows:

original: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du 'jug par ma gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba khongs su smra'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du 'jug par ma gyur na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba khongs su smra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnanda, if consciousness did not enter the mother‚Äôs womb‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa la dbang byed pa nyid kyis ni yid kyi dbang gis lus dang / ngag dag mthun par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa la dbang byed pa nyid kyis ni yid kyi dbang gis lus dang / ngag dag mthun par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mental faculty has power over the body and speech acting in concert, because it has power over the nature of the dominant condition.

original: de nyid la khungs ni /
analyzed: de nyid la khungs ni /
translated: The source for this is as follows:

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: As it has been said,

original: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid //
translated: ‚ÄúThis world is led by mind,

original: sems kyis yongs su drangs pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyis yongs su drangs pa yin //
translated: and drawn by mind.

original: 'di dag thams cad sems kyi chos //üîΩgcig gi dbang du mthun bar 'gro //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems kyi chos // gcig gi dbang du mthun bar 'gro //
translated: All phenomena are mind‚Äôs phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: They go according to the power of one.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bya ste /
translated: Here, the world is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can rten thams cad dam /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can rten thams cad dam /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the characteristic of the world.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la sems dbang du byed par gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la sems dbang du byed par gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the mind controls all the bases, or the body with the faculties.

original: lnga dang brgyad po de dag ni //
analyzed: lnga dang brgyad po de dag ni //
translated: These five and eightüîΩare the controlling faculties with regard to

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang la //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang la // zhes bya ba la /
translated: afflicted and purified phenomena.

original: lnga dang brgyad po 'di rnams te //
analyzed: lnga dang brgyad po 'di rnams te //
translated: These five and eightüîΩare the controlling faculties with regard to afflicted and purified phenomena.

original: lnga ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed la /
analyzed: lnga ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed la /
translated: The five are controlling faculties with regard to affliction.

original: brgyad po rnams ni rnam par byang ba la ste /
analyzed: brgyad po rnams ni rnam par byang ba la ste /
translated: The eight are controlling faculties with regard to purification.

original: grangs mnyam @104a * //üîΩpar bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: grangs mnyam @104a * // par bstan pa'i phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: They are taught in equal number.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin order,‚Äù

original: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang ldan par mtshungs pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas pa'i gzhir gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang ldan par mtshungs pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas pa'i gzhir gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: This means that they are the basis for the increase of attachment and so on, because they are similar in possessing the object.

original: ji skad du tshor ba bde ba las ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du tshor ba bde ba las ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: As it is said, attachment increases from the feeling of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal las ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Aversion increases from the feeling of pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa las ni gti mug go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa las ni gti mug go zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Delusion increases from the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩFaith and so on control purification.

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de zhes bya ba de nyid la rgyu smos pa ni /üîΩde dag gi rnam par byang ba la byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de zhes bya ba de nyid la rgyu smos pa ni / de dag gi rnam par byang ba la byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is stated:üîΩthey control purification.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed pa de'i phyir de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gis rnam par byang bar byed pa de'i phyir de dag rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do //
translated: Because they purify, they control purification.

original: rnam par byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni spong bar byed do zhes byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni spong bar byed do zhes byed pa'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt purifies‚Äù means it abandons.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dad pa'i sgo gtan phun sum tshogs pa ;
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dad pa'i sgo gtan phun sum tshogs pa ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe noble disciple who is endowed with the door bolt of faith,

original: brtson 'grus kyi dpung phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dpung phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: endowed with the army of effort,

original: dran pa'i sgo srung phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: dran pa'i sgo srung phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: endowed with the doorkeeper of mindfulness,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni shes rab kyi mtshon gyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and whose mind is in equipoise is liberated by the weapon of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: These three are included in just these three.

original: gzhan dag na re bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bde ba la sogs pa rnams ni rnam par byang ba la /
translated: Others say: Pleasure and so on are included in the three roots of virtue.

original: yang zhes bya ba la yang gi sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la yang ngo zhes bya bar rtogs te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la yang gi sgras ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la yang ngo zhes bya bar rtogs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúAlso, the three roots of virtue‚Äù indicates that they are also included in the afflictions.

original: bde bar gyur pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bar gyur pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: A mind that is happy is in equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And by means of the mind in meditative equipoise, one knows things as they really are.

original: de ltar na bde ba'i dbang po ni rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na bde ba'i dbang po ni rnam par byang ba la yang dbang byed do //
translated: Thus, the faculty of pleasure also has a controlling power over purification.

original: dad pa gang la sdug bsngal rgyu ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang la sdug bsngal rgyu ste /
translated: Faith is the cause of suffering.

original: rgyu mtshan du yod pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan du yod pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can te /
translated: That which has suffering as its cause is ‚Äúhaving suffering as its cause.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni dad pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed par ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni dad pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po yang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed par ston te /
translated: This shows that the faculty of suffering also has a controlling power over purification, because faith has suffering as its cause.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ces bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa drug ces bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The six that are based on deliverance.

original: nges par 'byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i lam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúDeliverance‚Äù refers to the contaminated and uncontaminated paths.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa ni nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa ni nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBased on deliverance‚Äù means that they have deliverance as their object.

original: yid bde ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid bde ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are mental pleasure, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include mental dissatisfaction and equanimity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dbye @104b pas ni rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dbye @104b pas ni rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: They are classified as six types by the division of their objects, such as form and so on.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las ji skad du mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas yid bde ba la nges par 'byung ba la brten pa /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la brten nas yid bde ba la nges par 'byung ba la brten pa /
translated: In dependence on forms that are objects of eye consciousness, mental satisfaction definitely arises in dependence on renunciation,

original: nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang mthun pa /
translated: it is compatible with renunciation,

original: nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas /üîΩde bzhin du yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la brten nas yid bde ba /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la dmigs pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas / de bzhin du yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la brten nas yid bde ba /
translated: and it focuses on renunciation.üîΩIn dependence on phenomena that are objects of mental consciousness, mental satisfaction arises in dependence on renunciation.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyang bsdus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar dang / de bzhin du yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyang bsdus pa lta bu'o //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction and equanimity are also included in this statement.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor rtog pa la ni yongs su spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yid bde ba dge ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams la so sor rtog pa la ni yongs su spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yid bde ba dge ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa skye la /
translated: The joy that precedes thorough examination of form, etc. is based on renunciation, because it is virtuous and free from attachment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gis bslus pa la tshul bzhin du yid mi bde ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag gis bslus pa la tshul bzhin du yid mi bde ba 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'o //
translated: The displeasure that is in accord with freedom from attachment and is due to proper reflection on being deceived by form, etc. is also based on renunciation.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dag la so sor brtags te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dag la so sor brtags te /
translated: Having thoroughly examined the objects of form, etc.

original: btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: one abides in equanimity.

original: yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /üîΩyid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'i btang snyoms te /
analyzed: yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur / yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba la brten pa'i btang snyoms te /
translated: One neither becomes joyfulüîΩnor becomes sorrowful.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is equanimity based on renunciation, because it is in accord with freedom from attachment.

original: de ltar na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams kyang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do zhes bya bar shes so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: de ltar na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams kyang rnam par byang ba la dbang byed do zhes bya bar shes so zhes zer ro zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Thus it is understood that mental satisfaction, mental dissatisfaction, and equanimity also control purification.

original: / ji skad smras pa'i don ma lus pa rnams la dbang byed pa mi srid pas slob dpon ma rangs par ston par byed pa'o //üîΩgzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag na re'o //
analyzed: / ji skad smras pa'i don ma lus pa rnams la dbang byed pa mi srid pas slob dpon ma rangs par ston par byed pa'o // gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa dag na re'o //
translated: The Master Vasubandhu states that it is impossible for any of the faculties to control all the objects mentioned, and so he is not satisfied with this explanation.

original: rnam par shes nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /üîΩbyang bas de gnod par byed pa nyid du yongs su spong ba'i phyir mig dang / rna ba dag gis ni lus su byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la / byang bas de gnod par byed pa nyid du yongs su spong ba'i phyir mig dang / rna ba dag gis ni lus su byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Others say that the Sautrantikas say that the eye and ear faculties do not control the body because they abandon what is harmful after they cognize it.üîΩThe body is not harmed by what is seen or heard, but it is harmed by what is tasted or touched.

original: 'di ltar ma byang ba ni mthong zhing thos kyang yongs su mi spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma byang ba ni mthong zhing thos kyang yongs su mi spong ngo //
translated: Thus, the body is not harmed by what is seen or heard because the eye and ear faculties abandon what is harmful.

original: gal te lus su yongs su bsrung ba ma yin na de dag gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te lus su yongs su bsrung ba ma yin na de dag gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: If the body is not protected by the eye and ear faculties, what do they control?

original: de'i phyir / de gnyis rnam par shes pa la ni dbang byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de gnyis rnam par shes pa la ni dbang byed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThey control consciousness.‚Äù

original: de gnyis ni mig dang rna ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni mig dang rna ba gnyis so //
translated: ‚Äú Those two‚Äù are the eye and ear.

original: ni'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa kho na la'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to //üîΩrnam par shes pa las gzhan pa gzugs mthong ba'am zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa kho na la'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i don to // rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa gzugs mthong ba'am zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means that they control consciousness alone.

original: gzugs mthong ba dang sgra thos pa ni rnam par dpyad pa na 'dzin pa las tha dad par mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba dang sgra thos pa ni rnam par dpyad pa na 'dzin pa las tha dad par mi dmigs la /
translated: ‚Äú Seeing form and hearing sound are not observed to be different from the apprehender when analyzed.

original: 'dzin pa yang rnam par shes pa kho na yin pas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang rnam par shes pa kho na yin pas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: And the apprehender is consciousness alone, not something else.‚Äù

original: @105a * // de'i phyir mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag bskyed pa la dbang byed par smras pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dzin pa la yin gyi /
analyzed: @105a * // de'i phyir mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag bskyed pa la dbang byed par smras pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dzin pa la yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the eye and ear consciousnesses, together with their associated mental factors, control the generation of form and sound.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that they control the apprehender, not something else.

original: lus mdzes pa la rten kho na dbang byed kyi /
analyzed: lus mdzes pa la rten kho na dbang byed kyi /
translated: ‚Äú They control the beauty of the body. ‚Äù

analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /

analyzed: rang gi don gyi dmigs pa ni rang gi don la dmigs pa'o // dbang byed pa'i dngos po ni dbang byed pa'i ste /
translated: The faculty of life force is the basis of the designation of a sentient being because it is the basis of the designation of a sentient being.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the basis of the designation of a sentient being because it is the basis of the designation of a sentient being.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the basis of the designation of a sentient being because it is the basis of the designation of a sentient being.

analyzed: rang gi don gyi dmigs pa la dbang byed pa ni rang gi don la dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: The faculty of life force is the basis of the designation of a sentient being because it is the basis of the designation of a sentient being.

analyzed: rang gi don la dmigs par dbang byed pa nyid de'i phyir ro // ci zhe na /
translated: The faculty of life force is the basis of the designation of a sentient being because it is the basis of the designation of a sentient being.

analyzed: lnga po dag dbang po nyid yin no //üîΩthams cad la zhes bya ba ni dmigs par dbang zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The faculty of life force is the basis of the designation of a

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?üîΩThe mental faculty.

original: yid do // 'di la don rnams kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid do // 'di la don rnams kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, if objects are also like that,

original: ji ltar dbang po med par dmigs par mi 'gyur bas de bzhin du don med pa yang dmigs par mi 'gyur bas dbang po ltar don yang de la dbang byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po med par dmigs par mi 'gyur bas de bzhin du don med pa yang dmigs par mi 'gyur bas dbang po ltar don yang de la dbang byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then just as the sense faculties are not observed without objects, so too objects would not be observed without sense faculties. Thus, just as the sense faculties, so too objects would exercise controlling power over mental consciousness.

original: don ni dbang byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni dbang byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Objects do not exercise controlling power.

original: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ni dbang byed pa yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid ni dbang byed pa yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Controlling power is the power to control.

original: lhag par dbang byed pa ni dbang byed pa yin la /
analyzed: lhag par dbang byed pa ni dbang byed pa yin la /
translated: Controlling power is the power to control.

original: de'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni /
translated: The state of that is

original: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag par dbang byed pa nyid do //
translated: the state of controlling power.

original: yang gang zhig don la med pa dbang po rnams kyi dbang byed pa nyid ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig don la med pa dbang po rnams kyi dbang byed pa nyid ci zhig ce na /
translated: Moreover, what is the controlling power of the sense faculties that does not exist in objects?
